Increase of the plasma concentrations of the dexamethasone due to decrease of its hepatic metabolism by the enzyme inhibitor, with risk of appearance of Cushing's syndrome

CLASS.name: LOW MOLECULAR WEIGHT HEPARINS AND RELATED DRUGS (CURATIVE DOSES AND/OR OLDER PATIENT)

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Increase of the risk of hemorrhage (inhibition of the platelet function by the dextran 40)

CLASS.name: UNFRACTIONATED HEPARIN (CURATIVE DOSES AND/OR OLDER PATIENTS)

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Increase of the risk of hemorrhage (inhibition of the platelet function by the dextran 40)
Very large increase of the plasma concentrations of dextromethorphan with risk of overdose, due to decrease of its hepatic metabolism by the cinacalcet
Risk of appearance of a serotonin syndrome: diarrhea, tachycardia, sweats, trembling, confusion, even coma

CLASS.name: REVERSIBLE MAOI-A, INCLUDING LINEZOLIDE AND METHYLENE BLUE

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Risk of appearance of a serotonin syndrome: diarrhea, tachycardia, sweats, trembling, confusion, even coma
Risk of increase of the undesirable effects of the buspirone
With the cimetidine used in doses greater than or equal to 800 mg/day: accrued risk of drowsiness
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Warn the patient of the increase of risk when driving an automobile or using machinery.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Unpredictable variations: the plasma concentrations of phenytoin can increase, with signs of overdose, but also decrease or remain stable.
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Clinical monitoring and testing of the plasma concentrations of phenytoin.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Increase of the plasma concentrations of the diazepam, with risk of overdose, due to inhibition of its hepatic metabolism
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Clinical monitoring and plasma dosage, when that is possible, of the anticonvulsant taken with the stiripentol and possible adjustment of the dosage of the anticonvulsant taken with it as well.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Increase of the concentrations of agomelatine, with risk of increase of its undesirable effects.
Increase of the concentrations of agomelatine, with risk of increase of its undesirable effects.
Increase of the plasma concentrations of didanosine and of its undesirable effects

Risk of increase of the undesirable effects of the didanosine, and especially the mitochondrial toxicity, due to substantial increase of its concentrations. In addition, risk of decrease of the effectiveness of the ganciclovir due to decrease of its concentrations, if the two medications are ingested in an interval of less than 2 hours
Increased risk of onset of pancreatitis due to addition of undesirable effects
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Monitoring of the blood amylase level. Do not use these two medications together if the blood amylase level is at the high range of normal.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Risk of increase of the mitochrondrial toxicity of the didanosine due to increase of its active metabolite
Risk of failure of the antiretroviral treatment, even emergence of resistance. In addition, increase of the risk of the mitchondrial toxicity of the didanosine
Increased risk of onset of peripheral neuropathy due to addition of undesirable effects
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Regular clinical monitoring and laboratory tests, especially at the beginning of the administration of the two substances together.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Increased risk of onset of pancreatitis and of peripheral neuropathy due to addition of undesirable effects
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Regular clinical monitoring and monitoring of the amylasemia. Do not administer these substances together if the amylasemia is at the high range of normal.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Depression of autoregulation (excessive bradycardia) and disorders of atrioventricular conduction. When digoxin is used, increase of the digoxinemia due to decrease of the renal clearance of the digoxin.
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Clinical monitoring, EKG, and, when there is reason to, test the digoxinemia and adjust the dosage of the digoxin.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Disorders of autoregulation (bradycardia, sinus arrest) and disorders of sino-atrial and atrioventricular conduction
Risk of serious arrhythmias, even lethal ones with the calcium salts administered by IV route
INTERACTION.COMMENT: -with calcium salts via IV aside from parenteral supplementation

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Hypokaliemia promoting the toxic effects of the digitalis glycosides
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Correct any pre-existing hypokaliemia and maintain clinical monitoring, monitoring of electrolyte balance, and electrocardographic monitoring

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Disorders of autoregulation (increase of the bradycardia inducing effect of the midodrine) and disorders of atrioventricular conduction
INTERACTION.COMMENT: If administering theses substances together cannot be avoided, strengthen clinical monitoring and EKG.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Decrease of the plasma concentrations and of the effectiveness of the digitoxin (increase of its hepatic metabolism)
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Clinical monitoring, EKG, and, possibly, monitoring of the digitoxinemia. If there is reason for it, adjustment of the dosage of the digitoxin during the administration of these substances together and after it is stopped, or choose digoxin, less metabolized by the liver.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Decrease of the plasma concentrations and of the effectiveness of the digitoxin due to increase of its hepatic metabolism.
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Clinical monitoring, EKG, and, possibly, monitoring of the blood level of digitoxin. If there is reason for it, adjustment of the dosage of the digitoxin during the administration of these substances together and after it is stopped, or choose digoxin, less metabolized by the liver.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Increase of the digoxinemia due to increase of its absorption
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Clinical monitoring and possibly monitoring of the digoxinemia during treatment with the azithromycin and after it is stopped.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Increase of the plasma concentrations of carbamazepine and decrease of the digoxinemia
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Exercise caution in the interpretation of the plasma concentrations.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Increase of the digoxinemia due to increase of its absorption
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Clinical monitoring and possibly monitoring of the digoxinemia during the treatment with the clarithromycin and after it is stopped.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Depression of autoregulation (excessive bradycardia) and disorders of atrioventricular conduction. In addition, increase of the digoxinemia due to decrease of the metabolism of the digoxin. Clinical monitoring and EKG.
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Reduce the doses of digoxin by half.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Increase of the digoxinemia due to increase of its absorption
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Clinical monitoring and possibly monitoring of the digoxinemia during the treatment with the erythromycin and after it is stopped.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Increase of the digoxinemia due to decrease of the renal clearance of the digoxin. In addition, disorders of autoregulation (excessive bradycardia and disorders of atrioventricular conduction).
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Clinical monitoring and EKG. In the case of unexpected results, test the digoxinemia and adjust the dosage.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Increase of the digoxinemia, more marked for IV route, due to increase of the absorption of the digoxin or decrease of its renal clearance.
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Clinical monitoring and, if there is reason for them, EKG and monitoring of the digoxinemia, with possible adjustment of the dosage of digoxin.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Increase of the digoxinemia with nausea, vomiting, arrhythmias.
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Clinical monitoring, and, if there is reason for them, EKG, and monitoring of the digoxinemia with adjustment of the dosage of the digoxin during the treatment with the itraconazole and after it is stopped.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Decrease of the digoxinemia, by reason of the enzyme inducer effect of the St Johns wort, with risk of reduction of effectiveness, even complete loss of the effect, which can have possibly serious consequences (acute decompensated heart failure).
INTERACTION.COMMENT: In the case of the two substances being taken together by accident, do not stop the St Johns wort abruptly, but test the plasma concentrations (or the effectiveness) of the digoxin before and then after the St Johns wort is stopped.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Moderate increase of the digoxinemia due to increase of its absorption by the omeprazole
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Clinical monitoring, EKG, and monitoring of the digoxinemia, particularly with an older patient.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Increase of the digoxinemia with nausea, vomiting, arrhythmias.
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Clinical monitoring, and, if there is reason for them, EKG and monitoring of the digoxinemia, with adjustment of the dosage of the digxoin during the treatment with the posaconazole and after it is stopped.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Risk of increase of the digoxinemia, especially with older patients
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Clinical monitoring and possibly monitoring of the digoxinemia during the treatment with propafenone and after it is stopped.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Increase of the digoxinemia due to decrease of the renal clearance of the digoxin. In addition, disorders of autoregulation (excessive bradycardia and disorders of atrioventricular conduction)
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Clinical monitoring and EKG. In the case of an unexpected result, test the digoxinemia and adjust the dosage.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Moderate increase of the digoxinemia
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Clinical monitoring and EKG, if needed, with possible adjustment of the doses of digoxin.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Increase of the digoxinemia
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Clinical monitoring, laboratory tests, and possibly EKG. Adjustment of the dosage of the digoxin if needed.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Decrease of the digestive absorption of the digoxin
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Take the sucralfate at a different time from the digoxin (more than 2 hours apart, if possible).

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Decrease of the digoxinemia that can reach 50%
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Clinical monitoring, EKG, and, possibly, monitoring of the digoxinemia. If there is reason for it, adjustment of the dosage of the digoxin during the treatment with the sulfasalazine and after it is stopped.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Increase of the digoxinemia
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Clinical monitoring, laboratory tests, and adjustment, if needed, of the dosage of the digoxin during the treatment with the telaprevir and after it is stopped.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Increase of the digoxinemia due to increase of its absorption
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Clinical monitoring and possibly monitoring of the digoxinemia during the treatment with the telithromycin and after it is stopped

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Excessive bradycardia and atrioventricular block due to increase of the effects of the digoxin on autoregulation and conduction and due to decrease of the renal and extra-renal elimination of the digoxin
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Clinical monitoring, EKG, and, possibly, testing of the digoxinemia. If there is reason for it, adjustment of the dosage of the digoxin during the treatment with the verapamil and after it is stopped.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Ergotism with possibility of necrosis of the extremities (inhibition of the hepatic metabolism of the alkaloid of ergot of rye).
Ergotism with possibility of necrosis of the extremities (inhibition of the hepatic metabolism of the alkaloid of ergot of rye).
Ergotism with possibility of necrosis of the extremities (inhibition of the hepatic metabolism of the alkaloid of ergot of rye).
Ergotism with possibility of necrosis of the extremities (inhibition of the hepatic elimination of the alkaloid of ergot of rye).
Ergotism with possibility of necrosis of the extremities (inhibition of the hepatic metabolism of the alkaloid of ergot of rye).
Ergotism with possibility of necrosis of the extremities (inhibition of the hepatic elimination of the alkaloid of ergot of rye).
Ergotism with possibility of necrosis of the extremities (inhibition of the hepatic metabolism of the alkaloid of ergot of rye).
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Wait 24 hours between stopping the triclabendazole and taking the medication derived from ergot of rye, and the reverse.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Ergotism with possibility of necrosis of the extremities (inhibition of the hepatic metabolism of the alkaloid of ergot of rye).

Hypotension, heart failure with patients having latent or uncontrolled cardiac insufficiency (addition of the negative inotropic effects). The beta blocking agent can furthermore minimize the sympathetic reflex reaction brought into play in the case of excessive hemodynamic repercussion

Hypotension, heart failure in patients with latent or uncontrolled cardiac insufficiency (negative inotropic effect of the dihydropyridines in vitro, more or less marked, and susceptible of adding to the negative inotropic effects of the beta blocking agents). The presence of a beta-blocking treatment can furthermore minimize the sympathetic reflex reaction put into play in cases of excessive hemodynamic repercussion.

With the dantrolene administered via IV: with animals, fatal cases of ventricular fibrillations are constantly observed when verapamil and dantrolene are administered via IV route. The administration of a calcium channel blocker and dantrolene together is thus potentially dangerous. However, some patients have received nifedipine and dantrolene together without incident
Increase of the opioid analgesic's effect of respiratory depression due to decrease of its hepatic metabolism
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Adjust the dosage of the alfentanil when administered with the diltiazem.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION:
For diltiazem by injection: risk of bradycardia and of atrioventricular block
For deltiazem by mouth: risk of bradycardia or of atrioventricular block, especially in older persons.
INTERACTION.COMMENT: -with diltiazem administered intravenously

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Increased risk of undesirable effects (concentration-dependant) of the rhabodmyolysis type due to decrease of the hepatic metabolism of the cholesterol lowering agent
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Use lower doses of the cholesterol lowering agent or another statin not affected by this type of interaction.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Disorders of autoregulation (excessive bradycardia, sinus arrest), disorders of sinoatrial and atrioventricular conduction, and cardiac failure
INTERACTION.COMMENT: The administration of these medications together should only be done under strict clinical monitoring and EKG, in particular with older patients or at the beginning of treatment.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Negative inotropic effect with risk of acute decompensated heart failure, disorders of autoregulation (bradycardia, sinus arrest), and disorders of sinoatrial and atrioventricular conduction
Increase of the plasma concentrations of the buspirone due to decrease of its hepatic metabolism by the diltiazem, with increase of its undesirable effects
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Clinical monitoring and adjustment of the dosage of the buspirone if necessary.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Disorders of autoregulation (disorders of atrioventricular conduction due to addition of the negative effects on conduction)

With the dantrolene administered by IV: with animals, fatal cases of ventricular fibrillations are constantly observed when verapamil and dantrolene are administered by IV route. The administration of a calcium channel blocker and dantolene together is thus potentially dangerous. However, some patients have received nifedipine and dantolene together without incident
Ergotism with possibility of necrosis of the extremities (inhibition of the hepatic metabolism of the alkaloid of ergot of rye).

Risk of bradycardia or of atrioventricular block, especially with older patients. Furthermore, slight increase of the concentrations of dronedarone due to decrease of its metabolism by the calcium channel blocker
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Begin the treatment with the calcium channel blocker at the minimum recommended dosages and adjust the doses according to the EKG.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Ergotism with possibility of necrosis of the extremities (inhibition of the hepatic metabolism of the alkaloid of ergot of rye)
Disorders of autoregulation (excessive bradycardia, sinus arrest), disorders of sinoatrial and atrioventricular conduction, and cardiac arrest.
INTERACTION.COMMENT: -in case of alteration of left ventricular function

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Increase of the plasma concentrations of ibrutinib due to decrease of its hepatic metabolism
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Strict clinical monitoring and reduction of the dose of ibrutinib to 140 mg/day during the length of time that these medications are administered together.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Increase of the blood concentrations of the immunosuppressant due to decrease of its metabolism
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Blood concentration dosage of the immunosuppressant, testing of renal function, and adjustment of the dosage during the treatment with these medications together and after it is stopped.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Increase of the plasma concentrations of the ivabradine and of its undesirable effects, especially cardiac ones (inhibition of its hepatic metabolism by the diltiazem), that add to the bradycardia inducing effects of these molecules.
Increase of the plasma concentrations of midazolam due to decrease of its hepatic metabolism, with increase of sedation
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Clinical monitoring and reduction of the dosage during the treatment with the diltiazem

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Large increase of the concentrations of nefidipine due to decrease of its hepatic metabolism by the diltiazem, with risk of severe hypotension
Increased risk of ventricular arrhythmias, especially of torsades de pointes
Increased risk of undesirable effects (concentration-dependant) of the rhabdomyolysis type, due to decrease of the hepatic metabolism of the cholesterol lowering agent
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Do not exceed the dosage of 20 mg/day of simvastatin. If the therapeutic objective is not reached at this dosage, use another statin not affected by this type of interaction

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Risk of increase of the undesirable effects of the tamsulosine, due to inhibition of its hepatic metabolism
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Clinical monitoring and adjustment of the dosage of the tamsulosine during the treatment with the enzyme inhibitor and after it is stopped, if that were the case.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Risk of increase of the plasma concentrations of ticagrelor due to decrease of its hepatic metabolsim
Risk of overdose due to increase of the plasma concentrations of diprophylline (inhibition of its renal tubular secretion)
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Reduce the dosage of diprophylline during the treatment with the probenicid

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: With the dipyridamole by injection: reduction of the vasodilator effect of the dipyridamole by the theine
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Avoid the consumption of theine based products during the 24 hours before myocardial perfusion imaging with dipyridamole

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: With the dipyridamole by injection: increase of the antihypertensive effect
With the dipyridamole by injection: reduction of the vasodilator effect of the dipyridamole by the caffeine
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Interrupt a caffeine based treatment at least 5 days before myocardial perfusion imaging with the dipyridamole and avoid consuming coffee, tea, chocolate, or cola during the 24 hours that precede the test.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: With the dipyridamole by injection: reduction of the vasodilator effect of the dipyridamole by the theophylline
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Interrupt a treatment with theophylline at least 5 days before myocardial perfusion imaging with the dipyridamole.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Risk of increase of the undesirable effects of the disopyramide: severe hypoglycemia, lengthening of the QT interval, and serious ventricular arrhythmias, especially of the torsades de pointes type
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Regular clinical monitoring, laboratory tests, and EKG

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Risk of increase of the undesirable effects of the disopyramide: severe hypoglycemia, lengthening of the QT interval, and serious ventricular arrhythmias, especially of the torsades de pointes type.
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Regular clinical monitoring, laboratory tests, and EKG

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Risk of increase of the undesirable effects of the disopyramide: severe hypoglycemia, lengthening of the QT interval, and serious ventricular arrhythmias, especially of the torsades de pointes type.
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Regular clinical monitoring, laboratory tests, and EKG

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Large decrease of the plasma concentrations of the albendazole and of its active metabolite by the inducer, with risk of loss of its effectiveness.
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Clinical monitoring of the therapeutic response and possible adjustment of the dosage of the albendazole during the treatment with the enzymatic inducer and after it is stopped.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Large decrease of the plasma concentrations of the albendazole and of its active metabolite by the ritonavir, with risk of loss of its effectiveness.
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Clinical monitoring of the therapeutic response and possible adjustment of the dosage of the albendazole during the treatment with the enzymatic inducer [sic] and after it is stopped.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Large decrease of the plasma concentrations of the albendazole and of its active metabolite by the inducer, with risk of loss of its effectiveness.
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Clinical monitoring of the therapeutic response and possible adjustment of the dosage of the albendazole during the treatment with the enzymatic inducer and after it is stopped.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Increase of the effect of the vitamin K antagonist and of the risk of hemorrhage
INTERACTION.COMMENT: More frequent testing of the INR. Adjustment of the dosage of the vitamin K antagonist during the treatment with the disulfiram and a week after it is stopped

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Disorders of behavior and of coordination
Risk of episodes of acute psychosis or confused state, reversible upon stopping the administration of the two substances together
Large and rapid increase of the plasma concentrations of phenytoin with signs of toxicity (inhibition of its metabolism)
INTERACTION.COMMENT: If the administration of these substances together cannot be avoided, clinical monitoring and monitoring of the plasma concentrations of phenytoin during the treatment with the disulfiram and after it is stopped.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION:
For anti-inflammatory doses of acetylsalicylic acid (>=1gr per dose and/or >=3gr per day) or for analgesic or antipyretic doses (>=500 mg per dose and/or <3 gr per day):
Acute renal insufficiency in dehydrated patients due to decrease of the glomerular filtration as a result of a decrease of the synthesis of the renal prostaglandins. Furthermore, reduction of the anti-hypertensive effect.
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Hydrate the patient and monitor renal function at the start of treatment.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Acute renal insufficiency with the patient at risk (older patient and/or dehydrated one) due to decrease of the glomerular filtration (inhibition of the vasodilator prostaglandins due to the NSAIs). Furthermore, reduction of the antihypertensive effect
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Hydrate the patient and monitor renal function at the start of treatment

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: In case of dehydration caused by the diuretics, increased risk of acute functional renal insufficiency, in particular when large doses of the contrast media are used
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Rehydrate before administration of the iodinated product

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Increase of the nephrotoxic and ototoxic risks of the aminoglycoside (functional renal insufficiency linked to the dehydration caused by the diuretic)
INTERACTION.COMMENT: The two medications may be taken together when there is monitoring of the state of hydration, of the renal and cochleovestibulary functions, and possibly, of the plasma concentrations of the aminoglycoside

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Increase of the lithemia with signs of overdose of lithium as with a low sodium regimen (decrease of the urinary excretion of the lithium)
Lactic acidosis due to the metformin, set into action by a possible functional renal insufficiency, linked to the loop diuretics
Risk of addition of the ototoxic and/or nephrotoxic effects

CLASS.name: POTASSIUM SPARING DIURETICS (ALONE OR IN COMBINATION)
POTASSIUM SPARING DIURETICS (ALONE OR IN COMBINATION)

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Potentially lethal hyperkalemia, especially when there is renal insufficiency (addition of the hyperkalemia inducing effects)
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Contraindication unless there is hypokalemia.

CLASS.name: POTASSIUM SPARING DIURETICS (ALONE OR IN COMBINATION)
ANGIOTENSIN II RECEPTOR ANTAGONISTS or ANGIOTENSIN RECEPTOR BLOCKERS (ARBs)

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Except for the eplerenone and the spironolactone in doses between 12.5mg and 50 mg/day for the treatment of heart failure as well as in cases of hypokalemia: Risk of hyperkalemia (possibly lethal) especially when there is renal insufficiency (addition of the effects of the hyperkalemia inducing substances)
INTERACTION.COMMENT: If administering these medications together is justified, strict testing of the kalemia and of the renal function.

CLASS.name: POTASSIUM SPARING DIURETICS (ALONE OR IN COMBINATION)

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Potentially lethal hyperkalemia, especially when there is renal insufficiency (addition of the hyperkalemia inducing effects)

CLASS.name: POTASSIUM SPARING DIURETICS (ALONE OR IN COMBINATION)

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: The rational choice of these two medications, useful for some patients, does not exclude the onset of hypokalemia or, in particular with patients having renal insufficiency and diabetes, of hyperkalemia
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Monitor the kalemia, possibly EKG and, if there is reason to, reconsider the treatment.

CLASS.name: POTASSIUM SPARING DIURETICS (ALONE OR IN COMBINATION)

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Except for the eplerenone and the spironolactone in doses between 12.5 mg and 50 mg/day for the treatment of heart failure as well as in cases of hypokalemia: Risk of hyperkalemia (potentially lethal) especially when there is renal insufficiency (addition of the hyperkalemia producing effects)
INTERACTION.COMMENT: If the administration of the two medications together is justified, strict testing of the kalemia and of the renal function.

CLASS.name: POTASSIUM SPARING DIURETICS (ALONE OR IN COMBINATION)

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Increase of the lithemia with signs of overdose of lithium, as with a low sodium regimen (decrease of the urinary excretion of the lithium)
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Strict monitoring of the lithemia and possible adjustment of the dosage of the lithium.

CLASS.name: POTASSIUM SPARING DIURETICS (ALONE OR IN COMBINATION)

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Potentially lethal hyperkalemia, especially with renal insufficiency (addition of the hyperkalemia producing effects)
INTERACTION.COMMENT: -aside from hypokalemia or in case of parenteral use of the potassium salts

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Risk of abrupt arterial hypotension and/or acute renal insufficiency at the beginning of treatment or at an increase in the dosage of a treatment with an angiotensin II antagonist where there is pre-existing fluid depletion.
INTERACTION.COMMENT: With arterial hypertension, where there has been pre-existing diuretic treatment that has caused fluid depletion, it is necessary:

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Risk of symptomatic hyponatremia
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Clinical monitoring and laboratory tests. If possible, use another class of diuretics.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Risk of increase of the creatinemia without modification of the blood concentrations of the ciclosporin, even in the absence of fluid depletion. Also risk of hyperuricemia and of complications such as gout

CLASS.name: POTASSIUM SPARING DIURETICS (ALONE OR IN COMBINATION)

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: The rational choice of these medications, useful for some patients, does not exclude the onset of hypokalemia or, in particular with patients having renal insufficiency and diabetes, of hyperkalemia

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Risk of abrupt arterial hypotension and/or renal insufficiency at the start of or when there is an increase of the dosage of the treatment with the ACE inihitor in cases of pre-existing fluid depletion

Increase of the lithemia with signs of overdose of lithium, as with a reduced sodium regimen (decrease of the urinary excretion of the lithium)
INTERACTION.COMMENT: If administering the substances together cannot be avoided, strict monitoring of the lithemia and adjustment of the dosage of the lithium.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Risk of increase of the toxicity of the docetaxel due to decrease of its metabolism
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Clinical monitoring and possible adjustment of the dosage of the docetaxel during the treatment with the enzyme inhibitor.

Risk of increase of the undesirable dose-dependent effects of the docetaxel due to inhibition of its metabolism by the enzyme inhibitor
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Clinical monitoring and possible adjustment of the dosage of the docetaxel during the treatment with the enzyme inhibitor.

INTERACTION.COMMENT: Use an antiemetic that does not have extrapyramidal effects.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Increase of the plasma concentrations of the quinidine and risk of overdose (decrease of the renal excretion of the quinidine by alkalinizing of the urine).

INTERACTION.COMMENT: Clinical monitoring and possible adjustment of the dosage of the doxycycline.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Large decrease of the concentrations of dronedarone due to increase of its metabolism, without significant modification of the active metabolite

INTERACTION.COMMENT: Start the treatment with the calcium channel blocker with minimum recommended dosages, and adjust the doses according to the EKG.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Risk of increase of the toxicity of the docetaxel due to decrease of its metabolism.
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Clinical monitoring and possible adjustment of the dosage of the docetaxel during the treatment with the enzyme inhibitor.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Increase of the plasma concentrations of fidaxomicin.

Large increase of the concentrations of drodedarone due to decrease of its metabolism

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Large decrease of the concentrations of dronedarone due to increase of its metabolism, without significant modification of the active metabolite.

Increase of the plasma concentrations of carbamazepine with signs of overdose, due to inhibition of its hepatic metabolism
INTERACTION.COMMENT: It is possible to use other macrolides (except spiramycine) whose interference on the clinical level is currently considered minimal or nonexistent. However, in cases of Legionnaires' disease, erythromycin is still the antibiotic of choice; clinical monitoring with testing of plasma concentrations of carbamazepine is thus preferable in this specialized environment.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Increase of the concentrations of darifenacin, with risk of increase of its undesirable effects.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Decrease of the concentrations of ethinylestradiol, with risk of lower contraceptive effectiveness. In addition, increase of the concentrations of the progestin
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Use a combined estrogen-progestin contraceptive with at least 30ug of ethinylestradiol

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Risk of decrease of the contraceptive effectiveness due to increase of its hepatic metabolism
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Another method of contraception, in particular a barrier method or IUD, should be used during the time the two substances are administered together and a cycle after.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Decrease of the contraceptive effectiveness, due to increase of the hepatic metabolism of the hormonal contraceptive by the inducer
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Another method of contraception, in particular a barrier method or IUD, should be used during the time the substances are administered together and a cycle after.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Risk of decrease of the contraceptive effectiveness due to decrease of the concentrations of the hormonal contraceptive because of the increase of its hepatic metabolism by the ritonavir.
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Another method of contraception, in particular a barrier method (condom or IUD), should be used during the length of the treatment with these medications together and a cycle following.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Risk of decrease of the concentrations and of the effectiveness of the lamotrigine due to increase of its hepatic metabolism
INTERACTION.COMMENT: -avoid starting an oral contraceptive during the period of adjustment of the dosage of the lamotrigine.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Decrease of the plasma concentrations of the hormonal contraceptive, by reason of the enzymatic inducer effect of the St Johns Wort, with risk of reduction of effectiveness, even complete loss of the effect, of the contraceptive, which can have possibly serious consequences (pregnancy).
Risk of decrease of the contraceptive effectiveness, during the treatment and one cycle after the end of the treatment with the modafinil, due to its enzymatic inducer potential
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Use oral contraceptives containing estrogens and progestins which have 50 micrograms of estrogen or another method of contraception.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Risk of decrease of the contraceptive effectiveness due to decrease of the concentrations of the hormonal contraceptive
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Another method of contraception, in particular a barrier method (condom or IUD), should be used during the length of the treatment with these substances together and a cycle after.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Moderate decrease of the concentrations of ethinylestradiol
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Another contraceptive method, in particular a barrier type or IUD, should be used.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Risk of decrease of the contraceptive effectiveness by increase of the hepatic metabolism of the hormonal contraceptive by the telaprevir
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Use a reliable contraceptive method, additional or alternative, during the time these are administered together and two cycles following.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: For doses of topiramate >=200 mg/day: Risk of decrease of the contraceptive effectiveness due to decrease of the concentrations of estrogen
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Another method of contraception, in particular a barrier method or IUD, should be used.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Risk of decrease of the concentrations of the combined estrogen-progestin contraceptive with the consequence of a risk of ineffectiveness
Increased risk of serious infections and neutropenia
Increase of the hepatotoxicity
Increase of the concentrations of ethinylestradiol by the etoricoxib
Increase of the hepatotoxicity.
Decrease of the plasma concentrations of ethosuximide
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Clinical monitoring, plasma dosage of the ethosuximide and possible increase of its dosage.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Increase of the concentrations of ethinylestradiol by the etoricoxib
In the treatment of infections with Mycobacterium avium complex, risk of decrease of the effectiveness of the clarithromycin due to increase of its hepatic metabolism by the etravirine
Increase of the blood concentrations of the everolimus by the ciclosporin. The nephrotoxicity of the ciclosprorin is also increased when the two medications are administered together
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Blood concentration dosage of the everolimus, possibly adjustment of the dosage, and testing of the renal function, during the administration of the two together and after it is stopped

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Increase of the blood concentrations of the everolimus due to decrease of its hepatic metabolism by the verapamil
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Blood concentration dosage of the immunosuppressant, testing of the renal function, and adjustment of the dosage during the administration of the two medications together and after it is stopped.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Risk of decrease of the effectiveness of the exemestane due to increase of its hepatic metabolism by the enzymatic inducer

For one thing, increased risk of undesirable effects (concentration-dependent) of the rhabdomyolysis type, due to increase of the concentrations of ezetimibe; for another thing, possible increase of the concentrations of ciclosporin
Risk of gallstones due to increase of the biliary excretion of cholesterol

Increase of the risk of reaction to the contrast media in cases of previous treatment with interleukin2:
skin rash or more rarely low blood pressure, oliguria, or even renal failure

Increase of the plasma concentrations of the active metabolite of the carbamazepine. In addition, decrease of the plasma concentrations of felbamate due to increase of its hepatic metabolism by the carbamazepine
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Clinical monitoring, plasma dosages, and possible adjustment of the dosages of the two anticonvulsants.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Decrease of the plasma concentrations and of the effectiveness of the felbamate and increase of the plasma concentrations of the phenobarbital, with risk of overdose.
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Clinical monitoring and testing of the plasma concentrations of phenobarbital with adjustment of the dosage if needed.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Increase of the plasma concentrations of phenytoin with risk of overdose, due to inhibition of its metabolism by the felbamate
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Clinical monitoring, testing of the plasma concentrations of phenytoin, and if needed adjustment of the dosage during the treatment with the felbamate.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Increase of the plasma concentrations of the valproic acid, with risk of overdose
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Clinical monitoring, laboratory tests, and possible adjustment of the dosage of the valproate or of the valpromide during the treatment with the felbamate and after it is stopped.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Risk of increase of the nephrotoxicity of the ciclosporin
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Clinical monitoring and laboratory tests of renal function, during and after the administration of the two medications together.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Risk of gallstones due to increase of the biliary excretion of cholesterol
Decrease of the plasma concentrations of fentanyl due to increase of its hepatic metabolism by the anticonvulsant
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Choose another opioid.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Increase of the opioid analgesic's effect of respiratory depression due to decrease of its hepatic metabolism
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Clinical monitoring and adjustment of the dosage of the opioid analgesic when there is also treatment with a strong inhibitor of CYP3A4.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Decrease of the plasma concentrations of fentanyl due to increase of its hepatic metabolism by the rifampicin
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Choose another opioid.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Lypothymia, even loss of consciousness attributed to the rapid release of the iron in its complex form and to the saturation of the transferrin
Decrease of the digestive absorption of these two medications due to chelation of the iron
For the iron salts administered via oral route: decrease of the digestive absorption of the bisphosphonates
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Take the iron salts at a different time from the bisphosphonates (from 30 minutes minimum to more than 2 hours apart, if possible, depending on the bisphosphonate).

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: With the iron salts by oral route: decrease of the digestive absorption of the iron salts
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Take the iron salts at a different time from meals and in the absence of calcium.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: With the tetracycline antibiotics administered by oral route: decrease of the digestive absorption of the tetracycline antibiotics (formation of complexes)
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Take the iron salts at a different time from the tetracycline antibiotics (more than 2 hours apart if possible).

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Decrease of the digestive absorption of the entacapone and of the iron due to chelation of the latter by the entacapone
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Take the iron salts at a different time from the entacapone (more than 2 hours apart if possible).

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Decrease of the digestive absorption of the fluoroquinolones
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Take the iron salts at a different time from the fluoroquinolones (more that 2 hours apart if possible).

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Decrease of the digestive absorption of the thyroid hormones
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Take the thyroid hormones at a different time from the iron (more than 2 hours apart, if possible).

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Decrease of the digestive absorption of the levodopa
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Take the iron salts at a different time from the levodopa (more than 2 hours apart if possible).

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Decrease of the digestive absorption of the methyldopa (formation of complexes)
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Take the iron salts at a different time from the methyldopa (more than two hours apart if possible).

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Decrease of the digestive absorption of the penicillamine
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Take the iron salts at a different time from the penicillamine (more than 2 hours apart if possible).

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Decrease of the digestive absorption of the strontium.
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Take the strontium at a different time from the iron salts (more than two hours apart if possible).

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Decrease of the digestive absorption of the zinc by the iron
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Take the iron salts at a different time from the zinc (more than 2 hours apart if possible).

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Increase of the concentrations of fesoterodine with patients who are slow metabolizers, with risk of overdose
Increase of the concentrations of fesoterodine with patients who are slow metabolizers, with risk of overdose.
Increase of the concentrations of fesoterodine with patients who are slow metabolizers, with risk of overdose
Increase of the concentrations of fesoterodine with patients who are slow metabolizers, with risk of overdose
Increase of the concentrations of fesoterodine with patients who are slow metabolizers, with risk of overdose
Increased risk of undesirable effects of the rhabdomyolosis type and of pharmacodynamic antagonism between the two molecules
Increase of the effect of the vitamin K antagonist and of the risk of hemorrhage
INTERACTION.COMMENT: More frequent testing of the INR. Possible adjustment of the dosage of the vitamin K antagonist during the treatment with the fibrate and a week after it is stopped.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Risk of increase of the undesirable muscular effects of these substances, and especially of rhabdomyolosis
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Clinical monitoring and laboratory tests, particularly at the beginning of the administration of these substances together.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Risk of addition of undesirable effects (dose-dependent) of the rhabdomyolosis type. In addition, with the gemfibrozil, decrease of the metabolism of the simvastatin and of the rosuvastatin, which increases the muscular risk, as well as the nephrotoxicity of the rosuvastatin
INTERACTION.COMMENT: --for doses of 40mg of rosuvastatin

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Increase of the plasma concentrations of fidaxomycin
Increase of the plasma concentrations of the fidaxomicin
Increase of the plasma concentrations of the fidaxomicin
Increase of the plasma concentrations of the fidaxomicin
Increase of the plasma concentrations of the fidaxomicin
Increase of the plasma concentrations of the fidaxomicin
Increase of the plasma concentrations of the fidaxomicin
Increase of the bradycardia inducing effects which can have fatal consequences. The beta-blocking agents are even more at risk since they inhibit the adrenergic compensation mechanisms
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Clinical monitoring and continuous EKG during the 24 hours following the first dose.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Risk of increase of the undesirable effects of the flecainide, due to decrease of its hepatic metabolism by the abiraterone
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Clinical monitoring. If needed, adjustment of the dosage of the flecainide during the treatment with the abiraterone

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Risk of increase of the undesirable effects of the flecainide due to decrease of its hepatic metabolism by the bupropion
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Clinical monitoring. If needed, adjustment of the dosage of the flecainide during the treatment with the bupropion.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Increase of the plasma concentrations of flecanaide with risk of overdose, due to decrease of its hepatic metabolism by the cinacalcet
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Clinical monitoring and reduction of the dosage of the flecainide during the treatment with cinacalcet.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Increase of the plasma concentrations of flecainide, with risk of overdose, due to decrease of its hepatic metabolism by the darifenacin
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Clinical monitoring and reduction of the dosage of the flecainide during the treatment with darifenacin.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Increase of the plasma concentrations of flecainide with risk of overdose, due to decrease of its hepatic metabolism by the duloxetine
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Clinical monitoring and reduction of the dosage of the flecainide during the treatment with the duloxetine and after it is stopped.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Risk of increase of the undesirable effects of the flecainide, due to decrease of its hepatic metabolism by the terbinafine
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Clinical monitoring. If needed, adjustment of the dosage of the flecainide during the treatment with the terbinafine.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Increase of the opioid analgesic's effect of respiratory depression due to decrease of its hepatic metabolism
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Adjust the dosage of the alfentanil when administered with the fluconazole

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Increase of the effect of the vitamin K antagonist and of the risk of hemorrhage
INTERACTION.COMMENT: More frequent testing of the INR. Possible adjustment of the dosage of the vitamin K antagonist during the treatment with the fluconazole and a week after it is stopped.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: For doses of fluconazole >=200 mg per day: possible increase of the undesirable effects of the carbamazepine
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Adjust the dosage of carbamazepine, during the antifungal treatmentand after it is stopped.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Risk of increase of the blood concentrations of the immunosuppressant due to inhibition of its metabolism and of the creatinemia
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Blood concentration dosage of the immunosuppressant, testing of renal function, and adjustment of the immunosuppressant's dosage during the administration of the substances together and after it is stopped.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Increase of the concentrations of ivacaftor, with risks of increase of its undesirable effects
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Reduce the dose by half, that is 150 mg/day.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Risk of decrease of the effectiveness of the losartan, due to inhibition of the formation of its active metabolite by the fluconazole
Doubling of the concentrations of nevirapine with risk of increase of its undesirable effects
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Clinical monitoring and possible adjustment of the dosage of the nevirapine.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Increase of the plasma oncentrations of phenytoin that can reach toxic values. Mechanism proposed: inhibition of the hepatic metabolism of the phenytoin
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Strict clinical monitoring and laboratory tests.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Increased risk of disorders of ventricular rhythm, especially of torsades de pointes.
Risk of increase of the undesirable effects of the rifabutin (uveitis), due to increase of its concentrations and of those of its active metabolite
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Regular clinical monitoring and laboratory tests, especially at the beginning of the treatment with the two medications together.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Decrease of the plasma concentrations and of the effectiveness of the two anti-infectives (enzymatic induction by the rifampicin and decrease of the intestinal absorption by the azole antifungal)
Increase of the half life of the sulfonamide with possible onset of hypoglycemia
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Inform the patient, reinforce self-monitoring of blood glucose and possibly adjust the dosage of the sulfonamide during the treatment with the fluconazole.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Increase of the theophyllinemia with risk of overdose (decrease of the clearance of the theophylline)
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Clinical monitoring and possibly monitoring of the theophyllinemia; if there is reason for it, adjustment of the dosage of the theophylline during the treatment with the fluconazole and after it is stopped.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: With cimetidine used in doses greater than or equal to 800mg/day: increase of the opioid analgesic's effect of respiratory depression due to decrease of its hepatic metabolism
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Adjust the dosage of the alfentanil when administered with the cimetidine.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Increase of the opioid analgesic's effect of respiratory depression due to decrease of its hepatic metabolism
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Adjust the dosage of the alfentanil when administered with the diltiazem.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Increase of the opioid analgesic's effect of respiratory depression due to decrease of its hepatic metabolism
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Adjust the dosage of the alfentanil when administered with the erythromycin.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Increase of the opioid analgesic's effect of respiratory depression due to decrease of its hepatic metabolism
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Adjust the dosage of the alfentanil when administered with the fluconazole

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION:
Increase of the opioid analgesic's effect of respiratory depression due to decrease of its hepatic metabolism
.
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Clinical monitoring and adjustment of the dosage of the opioid analgesic when administered with a strong inhibitor of CYP3A4.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Increase of the hematological toxicity (addition of effects of bone marrow toxicity)
INTERACTION.COMMENT: More frequent CBC

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Increase of the risk of pulmonary toxicity that could be fatal.
Increase of the effect of the vitamin K antagonist and of the risk of hemorrhage
INTERACTION.COMMENT: More frequent testing of the INR. Possible adjustment of the dosage of the vitamin K antagonist during the treatment with the fluoroquinolone and after it is stopped.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Decrease of the digestive absorption of the fluoroquinolones
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Take the iron salts at a different time from the fluoroquinolones (more that 2 hours apart if possible).

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Possible increase of the risk of tendinitis, even of rupture of the tendon (exceptional), particularly in patients receiving prolonged corticotherapy
Decrease of the concentrations of the mycophenolic acid by about a third, with potential risk of reduction of effectiveness.
Decrease of the digestive absorption of the strontium
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Take the strontium at a different time from the fluoroquinolones (more than two hours apart if possible).

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Decrease of the digestive absorption of the fluoroquinolones
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Take the sucralfate at a different time from the fluoroquinolone (more than 2 hours apart if possible).

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Decrease of the digestive absorption of the fluoroquinolones
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Take the zinc salts at a different time from the fluoroquinlones (more than 2 hours apart if possible).

CLASS.name: FLUOROURACIL (AND BY EXTRAPOLATION, TEGAFUR AND CAPECITABINE)

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Strengthening of the effects, both cytostatic and undesirable, of the fluorouracil.

CLASS.name: FLUOROURACIL (AND BY EXTRAPOLATION, TEGAFUR AND CAPECITABINE)

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Large increase of the effect of the vitamin K antagonist and of the risk of hemorrhage
INTERACTION.COMMENT: If taking these medications together cannot be avoided, more frequent testing of the INR. Adjustment of the dosage of the vitamin K antagonist during the treatment with the cytotoxic and a week after it is stopped.

CLASS.name: FLUOROURACIL (AND BY EXTRAPOLATION, TEGAFUR AND CAPECITABINE)

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Increase of the gastrointestinal toxicity of the fluorouracil

CLASS.name: FLUOROURACIL (AND BY EXTRAPOLATION, TEGAFUR AND CAPECITABINE)

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Increase of the toxicity of the fluourouracil due to decrease of its clearance

CLASS.name: FLUOROURACIL (AND BY EXTRAPOLATION, TEGAFUR AND CAPECITABINE)

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Increase of the toxicity of the fluorouracil due to decrease of its clearance
Risk of increase of the undesirable effects of the atomoxetine, due to substantial decrease of its hepatic metabolism
INTERACTION.COMMENT: If administering the two together cannot be avoided, clinical monitoring and adjustment of the dosage of the atomoxetine during the treatment with the inhibitor and after it is stopped.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Increase of the plasma concentrations of carbamazepine with signs of overdose
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Clinical monitoring, testing of the plasma concentrations of carbamazepine, and possible reduction of the dosage of the carbamazepine during the treatment with the serotoninergic antidepressant and after it is stopped.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Risk of increase of the undesirable effects of the mequitazine, due to inhibition of its metabolism by the enzyme inhibitor
With the metoprolol used for heart failure: risk of increase of its undesirable effects, with especially excessive bradycardia, due to inhibition of its metabolism by the fluoxetine
Risk of increase of the undesirable effects of the nebivolol, with especially excessive bradycardia, due to inhibition of its metabolism by the antidepressant
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Increased clinical monitoring; if needed, adjustment of the dosage of the nebivolol during the length of the treatment with the antidepressant and after it is stopped.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Increase of the plasma concentrations of phenytoin with signs of overdose, due to inhibition of the metabolism of the phenytoin
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Clinical monitoring and possibly testing of the plasma concentrations of phenytoin. If needed, adjustment of the dosage during the treatment with fluoxetine and after it is stopped.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Increase of the active fraction of the risperidone due to decrease of its hepatic metabolism by the fluoxetine, with risk of increase of its undesirable effects
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Clinical monitoring, and, if needed, adjustment of the dosage of the risperidone.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Reduction of the effectiveness of the tamoxifen, due to inhibition of the formation of its active metabolite by the fluoxetine.
Increase of the concentrations of agomelatine, with risk of increase of the undesirable effects.
Increase of the plasma concentrations of carbamazepine with signs of overdose
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Clinical monitoring, testing of the plasma concentrations of carbamazepine and possible reduction of the dosage of the carbamazepine during the treatment with the serotoninergic antidepressant and after it is stopped.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Increase of the plasma concentrations of clozapine with signs of overdose
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Increased clinical monitoring; if needed, adjustment of the dosage of the clozapine during the treatment with the fluvoxamine and after it is stopped.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Risk of increase of the undesirable effects of the duloxetine due to decrease of its hepatic metabolism by the fluvoxamine
Increase of the plasma concentrations of the lidocaine with possibilities of undesirable neurological and cardiac effects (decrease of the hepatic clearance of the lidocaine)
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Clinical monitoring, EKG, and possibly testing of the plasma concentrations of the lidocaine during and after the administration of the two substances together. Adjustment, if needed, of the dosage of the lidocaine.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Increase of the plasma concentrations of methodone with overdose and increased risk of lengthening of the QT interval and of ventricular arrhythmias, especially of torsades de pointes
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Strengthen clinical monitoring and EKG; if needed, adjustment of the dosage of the methadone during the treatment with the fluvoxamine and after it is stopped.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Risk of increase of the undesirable effects of the mexiletine, due to inhibition of its metabolism by the fluvoxamine
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Clinical monitoring and EKG. Adjustment of the dosage of the mexiletine during the treatment with the fluvoxamine and after it is stopped.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Increase of the concentrations of the olanzapine, with risk of increase of the undesirable effects, due to decrease of its hepatic metabolism by the fluvoxamine
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Clinical monitoring and possible reduction of the dosage of the olanzapine during the treatment with fluvoxamine.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Increase of the plasma concentrations of phenytoin with signs of overdose, due to inhibition of the hepatic metabolism of the phenytoin.
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Clinical monitoring and possibly testing of the plasma concentrations of phenytoin. If needed, adjustment of the dosage of the phenytoin during the treatment with the fluvoxamine and after it is stopped.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Increase of the plasma concentrations of pirfenidone with signs of overdose
Increase of the plasma concentrations of propranolol due to inhibition of its hepatic metabolism, with increase of the activity and of the undesirable effects, for example: significant bradycardia
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Increased clinical monitoring, and, if needed, adjustment of the dosage of the propranolol during the treatment with the fluvoxamine and after it is stopped.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Increase of the plasma concentrations of ropinirole, with risk of overdose, due to decrease of its hepatic metabolism by the fluvoxamine
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Clinical monitoring and reduction of the dosage of the ropinirole during the treatment with fluvoxamine and after it is stopped.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Increase of the theophyllinemia with signs of overdose (decrease of the hepatic metabolism of the theophylline)
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Clinical monitoring and possibly monitoring of the theophyllinemia; if needed, adjustment of the dosage of the theophylline during the treatment with fluvoxamine and after it is stopped.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Decrease of the plasma concentrations of the phenobarbital, due to increase of its metabolism of which the folates represent one of the cofactors
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Clinical monitoring, testing of the plasma concentrations, and adjustment, if there is reason for it, of the dosage of the phenobarbital during the folic supplementation and after it is stopped.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Decrease of the plasma concentrations of phenytoin due to increase of its metabolism of which the folates represent one of the cofactors
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Clinical monitoring and testing of the plasma concentrations of phenytoin. Possible adjustment of the dosage of the phenytoin during the folic supplementation and after it is stopped.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Significant decrease of the concentrations of amprenavir that can lead to a loss of viralogical response
Risk of severe hypocalcemia
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Monitoring of the calcemia and supplementation if necessary.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: With the dacarbazine in large doses: risk of pulmonary toxicity (adult acute respiratory distress syndrome ).
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Do not use these medications simultaneously, but wait a week between the last administration of fotemustine and the first day of the treatment with dacarbazine.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION:
Risk of increase of the plasma concentrations of the alfuzosin and of its undesirable effects.
.
Increase of the plasma concentrations of the alfuzosin due to decrease of its hepatic metabolism by the therapy with the two medications.
Decrease of the diuretic effect which can reach 50%
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Possibly use higher doses of furosemide.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Risk of increase of the undesirable effects of the didanosine, and especially the mitochondrial toxicity, due to substantial increase of its concentrations. In addition, risk of decrease of the effectiveness of the ganciclovir due to decrease of its concentrations, if the two medications are ingested in an interval of less than 2 hours
Increased risk of onset of peripheral neuropathy due to addition of undesirable effects
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Regular clinical monitoring and laboratory tests, especially at the beginning of the administration of the two medications together.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Increase of the hematological toxicity (addition of effects of bone marrow toxicity)
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Stop the zidovudine temporarily; CBC, and, reintroduce, if possible, the zidovudine in small doses.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Risk of increase of the undesirable effects of the glitazone due to decrease of its hepatic metabolism by the gemfibrozil
INTERACTION.COMMENT: If administering the substances together cannot be avoided, strict clinical monitoring.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Risk of increase of the plasma concentrations of the dasabuvir by the gemfibrozil
Increase of the active fraction of the enzalutamide
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Reduce the dose of enzalutamide by half when administered with the gemfibrozil.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Risk of severe hypoglycemia, even coma, due to substantial increase of the plasma concentrations of repaglinide by the gemfiborzil

Risk of reduced effectiveness of the glibenclamide due to decrease of its plasma concentrations, because of the inducer effect of the bosentan. Furthermore, cases of hepatoxicity have been reported with these substances administered together.
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Monitoring of the glycemia, adjustment of the treatment if needed, and monitoring of the hepatic biological constants

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Risk of hypoglycemia due to increase of the absorption and of the plasma concentrations of the antidiabetic
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Inform the patient, strengthen self-monitoring of blood glucose, and possibly adjust the dosage of the blood glucose lowering sulfonamide as needed during the treatment with the clarithromycin

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Risk of hypoglycemia due to increase of the absorption and of the plasma concentrations of the antidiabetic
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Inform the patient, strengthen self-monitoring of blood glucose, and possibly adjust the dosage of the blood glucose lowering sulfonamide during the treatment with the erythromycin.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Risk of hypoglycemia due to increase of the absorption and of the plasma concentrations of the antidiabetic.
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Inform the patient, reinforce self-monitoring of blood glucose, and possibly adjust the dosage of the blood glucose lowering sulfonamide during the treatment with the clarithromycin

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Risk of hypoglycemia due to increase of the absorption and of the plasma concentrations of the antidiabetic
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Inform the patient, reinforce self-monitoring of blood glucose, and possibly adjust the dosage of the blood glucose lowering sulfonamide during the treatment with the erythromycin.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: All the beta-blocking agents can mask certain symptoms of hypoglycemia: palpitations and tachycardia
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Inform the patient, and, especially at the beginning of treatment, reinforce self-monitoring of blood glucose

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: All the beta-blocking agents can mask certain symptoms of hypoglycemia: palpitations and tachycardia
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Inform the patient, and reinforce, especially at the beginning of treatment, self-monitoring of blood glucose.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Risk of increase of the plasma concentrations of the glipizide at the origin of potentially severe hypoglycemia.
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Inform the patient, reinforce self-monitoring of blood glucose and possibly adjust the dosage of the blood glucose lowering sulfonamide during and after the treatment with voriconazole.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: All the beta-blocking agents can mask certain symptoms of hypoglycemia: palpitations and tachycardia
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Inform the patient and, especially at the beginning of treatment, reinforce self-monitoring of blood glucose

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Increase of the risk of the onset of angioedema, due to the reduction of the activity of the enzyme dipetidyl peptidase-4 (DDP-4) by the gliptin, in patients treated with the ACE inhibitor
Excessive immunodepression with risk of lymphoproliferative disorders (LPDs)
Risk of possibly fatal general illness. This risk is increased in older patients already immunodepressed by the underlying disease.
INTERACTION.COMMENT: In particular, use an inactive vaccine when one exists (poliomyelitis)

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Increase of the risk of hemorrhage
INTERACTION.COMMENT: -anti-inflammatory doses of acetylsalicylic acid (>=1gr per dose and/or >=3 gr per day)

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Glucocorticoids (general and rectal routes): possible impact of the corticotherapy on the metabolism of the Vitamin K antagonist and on that of the factors of coagulation. Risk of hemorrhage specific to the corticotherapy (digestive mucosa, vascular fragility) in large doses or in treatment prolonged beyond 10 days.
INTERACTION.COMMENT: When administering substances from these groups together is justified, strengthen monitoring: if the situation requires, with the vitamin K antagonists, laboratory tests on the 8th day, then every two weeks after that during the corticotherapy and after it is stopped.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Decrease of the plasma concentrations and of the effectiveness of the corticoids due to increase of their hepatic metabolism by the inducer: the consequences are particularly great with patients who have Addison's disease treated with hydrocortisone and in cases of organ transplants
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Clinical monitoring and laboratory tests; adjustment of the dosage of the corticoids during the treatment with the inducer and after it is stopped.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Increase of the risk of ulceration and of gastrointestinal hemorrhage
With the glucocorticoids by IV route: risk of severe myopathy, reversible after a possibly long period (several months).
Possible increase of the risk of tendinitis, even of rupture of the tendon (exceptional), particularly in patients receiving corticotherapy for a prolonged period

Described for prednisolone.
Decrease of the plasma concentrations of the isoniazide. Mechanism proposed: increase of the hepatic metabolism of the isoniazide and decrease of that of the glucocorticoides
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Clinical monitoring and laboratory tests.
