INTERACTION.COMMENT: Clinical monitoring and laboratory tests; adjustment of the dosage of the hydrocortisone during the time it is taken with the enzymatic inducer and after the enzymatic inducer is stopped.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Decrease of the blood concentrations and of the effectiveness of the immunosuppressant, due to increase of its hepatic metabolism by the inducer
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Increase the dosage of the immunosuppressant according to tests of the blood concentrations. Reduce the dosage after the inducer is stopped.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Probable decrease of the plasma concentrations of the active metabolite of the irinotecan, with risk of failure of the cytotoxic treatment
Decrease of the plasma concentrations of itraconazole, with risk of loss of effectiveness, due to increase of its hepatic metabolism by the inducer
Large decrease of the concentrations of the ivacaftor, with risk of loss of effectiveness
Decrease of the plasma concentrations of macitentan due to increase of its metabolism by the inducer
In the absence of co-administration with a strong inhibitor of CYP3A4, decrease of the concentrations of maraviroc by the inducer.
INTERACTION.COMMENT: The dose of maraviroc must be increased to 600mg twice a day in this situation.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Decrease of the plasma concentrations of methadone with risk of appearance of a withdrawal syndrome, due to increase of its hepatic metabolism
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Increase the frequency of the doses of methadone (2 to 3 times a day instead of a single dose per day).

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Risk of ineffectiveness of the mianserin
Decrease of the plasma concentrations of the bitherapy by increase of its hepatic metabolism by the inducer
Decrease of the contraceptive effectiveness of the hormonal contraceptive, due to increase of its hepatic metabolism by the inducer.
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Another method of contraception, in particular a barrier method or IUD, should be used during the length of time that the two substances are administered together and one cycle following.

CLASS.name: NON-CONTRACEPTIVE PROGESTOGENS, COMBINED WITH AN ESTROGEN OR NOT

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Decrease of the effectiveness of the progestogen
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Clinical monitoring and possible adjustment of the dosage of the hormonal treatment during the administration of the anticonvulsant inducer and after it is stopped.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Decrease of the plasma concentrations of the regorafenib due to increase of its metabolism by the inducer
Significant decrease of the plasma concentrations of rilpivirine due to increase of its hepatic metabolism by the inducer
Risk of ineffectiveness of the treatment by the antidepressant
Decrease of the plasma concentrations of simeprevir due to increase of its hepatic metabolism by the inducer
Risk of decrease of the plasma concentrations of sofosbuvir due to decrease of its intestinal absorption by the enzymatic inducer.
Risk of decrease of the concentrations of the vermurafenib, with lower effectiveness
Risk of decrease of the plasma concentrations of vismodegib due to increase of its hepatic metabolism by the inducer
With the vitamin E used in doses greater than or equal to 500 mg per day: increase of the effect of the vitamin K antagonist and of the risk of hemorrhage
INTERACTION.COMMENT: More frequent testing of the INR. Possible adjustment of the dosage of the vitamin K antagonist during the treatment with vitamin E and after it is stopped.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Increase of the pharmacological effects, and especially increase in blood pressure and contraction of the blood vessels by the catecholamines due to the combined inhibition of their metabolism
Risk of orthostatic hypotension, especially in older patients
INTERACTION.COMMENT: -with doxazosin

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Risk of orthostatic hypotension, especially with older patients
INTERACTION.COMMENT: -with the doxazosine

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Increase of the plasma concentrations of the inhibitor of PDE5, with risk of hypotension
INTERACTION.COMMENT: - with avanafil

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Risk of significant hypotension (synergic effect) capable of aggravating the state of myocardial ischemia and provoking an acute coronary accident
Increase of the plasma concentrations of the inhibitor of the PDE5, with risk of hypotension
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Start the treatment with the PDE5 inhibitor at the minimum dose when administered with one of these medications. [sic]

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Large increase of the plasma concentrations of the PDE5 inhibitor, with risk of severe hypotension
INTERACTION.COMMENT: -- with the sildenafilindicated for pulmonary artery hypertension

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Increase (very large for the avanafil and the vardenafil) of the plasma concentrations of the PDE5, with risk of hypotension (severe with the vardenafil)
INTERACTION.COMMENT: With the vardenafil

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Increase (very large for the avanafil and the verdenafil) of the plasma concentrations of the PDE5, with risk of hypotension (severe with the vardenafil)
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Contraindication

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Risk of large drop in blood pressure (synergic effect)
Large increase of the plasma concentrations of the PDE5 inhibitor, with risk of severe hypotension
INTERACTION.COMMENT: -in cases of pulmonary artery hypertension

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Increase of the plasma concentrations of the type 5 inhibiter of phosphodiesterase with risk of severe hypotension
INTERACTION.COMMENT: --with the avanafil

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Bone marrow suppression, possibly serious
Bone marrow suppression, reversible but possibly serious (overdose due to decrease of the hepatic metabolism of the mercaptopurine).
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Reinforced hematological monitoring and adjustment of the dosage of the mercaptopurine.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: With large doses of the inhibitor, increase of the plasma concentrations of theophylline due to inhibition of its metabolism.
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Clinical monitoring and testing of the theohyllinemia up to two or three weeks after the beginning of the treatment with the inhibitor; if there is reason for it, adjustment of the dosage during the treatment with these substances together.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION:
For anti-inflammatory doses of acetylsalicylic acid (>=1gr per dose and/or >=3gr per day) or for analgesic or antipyretic doses (>=500 mg per dose and/or <3 gr per day):
Acute renal insufficiency in dehydrated patients due to decreased glomerular filtration following a decrease of the synthesis of the renal prostaglandins. Furthermore, reduction of the antihypertensive effect.
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Hydrate the patient and monitor renal function at the beginning of treatment.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Risk of hyperkalemia, of renal insufficiency, of increase of mortality from cardiovascular disease
INTERACTION.COMMENT: -for patients with diabetes or renal insufficiency

CLASS.name: ANGIOTENSIN II RECEPTOR ANTAGONISTS or ANGIOTENSIN RECEPTOR BLOCKERS (ARBs)

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: In situations where the administration of these medications together is possible, increased risk of degradation of renal function, even acute renal insufficiency, and increase of the hyperkalemia as well as hypotension and fainting or loss of consciousness.

Acute renal insufficiency with patients at risk (older patients, dehydrated ones, those taking diuretics, or having altered renal function) due to decrease of the glomerular filtration (inhibition of the vasodilating prostaglandins due to the NSAIs). These effects are generally reversible. Furthermore, reduction of the antihypertensive effect.
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Hydrate the patient and monitor renal function at the beginning of treatment and regularly during the administration of these substances together.

CLASS.name: POTASSIUM SPARING DIURETICS (ALONE OR IN COMBINATION)

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Except for the eplerenone and the spironolactone at doses between 12.5 mg and 50 mg/day in the treatment of heart failure, as well as in cases of hypokalemia: Risk of hyperkalemia (potentially lethal) especially when there is renal insufficiency (addition of the hyperkalemia producing effects)
INTERACTION.COMMENT: If the administration of these medications together is justified, strict testing of the kalemia and of the renal function.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Risk of abrupt arterial hypotension and/or acute renal insufficiency at the start of or when there is an increase of the dosage of the treatment with the ACE inhibitor in cases of pre-existing fluid depletion
INTERACTION.COMMENT: In arterial hypertension, when there is fluid depletion from a previous treatment with a diuretic, it is necessary:

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Increase of the risk of hyperkalemia, especially with older patients.
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Strict testing of the kalemia and of renal function during the administration of these substances together.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Risk of increase of the undesirable effects of the angioneurotic edema type (angioedema)
Increase of the risk of the onset of angioedema, due to reduction of the activity of the enzyme dipetidyl peptidase-4 (DDP-4) by the gliptin, in patients treated with the ACE inhibitor

The use of an ACE inhibitor can lead to an increase of the hypoglycemic effect in a diabetic treated with insulin. The onset of hypoglycemic difficulties seems exceptional (improvement of the tolerance for glucose that would have the result of a reduction of the need for insulin).
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Reinforce self-monitoring of blood glucose

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Increase of the lithemia which can reach toxic values (decrease of the renal excretion of the lithium)
INTERACTION.COMMENT: If the use of an ACE inhibitor is indispensable, strict monitoring of the lithemia and adjustment of the dosage of the lithium.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: With the gold salts administered by IV route: risk of "nitritoid" reaction when the ACE inhibitor is introduced (nausea, vomiting, vasomotor effects of the flushing type, hypotension, possibly a drop in blood pressure)
Hyperkalemia (potentially lethal) especially when there is renal insufficiency (addition of the hyperkalemia inducing effects)
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Unless there is hypokalemia.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Risk of increase of the undesirable effects of the angioedema type.
INTERACTION.COMMENT: --in case of preceding angioedema with ACE inhibitors

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION:
With the spironolactone at dosages from 12.5 to 50 mg per day, and with low doses of ACE inhibitors
In the treatment of class III or IV heart failure (NYHA) with an ejection fraction <35% and previous treatment with an ACE inhibitor + a loop diuretic: risk of hyperkalemia, potentially lethal, in case of failure to follow the prescribed doses for this combination of medications.
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Verify the absence of pre-existing hyperkalemia and renal insufficiency. Strict laboratory testing of the kalemia and of the creatinemia (1 time per week during the first month, then one time per month thereafter).

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: The use of an ACE inhibitor can lead to an increase of the hypoglycemic effect in diabetic patients treated with glucose lowering sulfonamides. The onset of hypoglycemic difficulties seems exceptional (improvement of the tolerance for glucose that would have the result of a reduction of the need for the glucose lowering sulfonamides)
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Reinforce self-monitoring of blood glucose.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Increased risk of undesirable effects (concentration-dependent) of the rhabdomyolysis type.
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Stop the treatment with the HMG Co-A reductase inhibitor before starting a treatment with fusidic acid and use another antibiotic

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Increase of the effect of the vitamin K antagonist and of the risk of hemorrhage
INTERACTION.COMMENT: More frequent testing of the INR Possible adjustment of the dosage of the vitamin K antagonist

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Risk of increase of the undesirable muscular effects of these substances, and especially of rhabdomyolysis
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Clinical monitoring and laboratory tests, especially at the beginning of the administration of these substances together.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Risk of addition of the undesirable effects (dose dependent) of the rhabdomyolysis type.
INTERACTION.COMMENT: If the administration of these medications together cannot be avoided, reinforce laboratory testing (dosage of the CPK once a week) and strict clinical monitoring.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Risk of increase of the toxicity of the statins, due to inhibition of their hepatic recapture
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Clinical monitoring and possible adjustment of the dosage of the statin.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Risk of addition of undesirable effects (dose-dependent) of the rhabdomyolosis type. Furthermore, with the gemfibrozil, decrease of the metabolism of the simvastatin and of the rosuvastatin, which increases the muscular risk, as well as the nephrotoxicity of the rosuvastatin
INTERACTION.COMMENT: --for doses of 40mg of rosuvastatin

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Risk of increase of the plasma concentrations of the statin and of its undesirable effects of the rhabdomyolosis type.
INTERACTION.COMMENT: --with the rosuvastatin.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Increased risk of the appearance of rhabdomyolysis
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Reinforce clinical monitoring and laboratory tests, especially during the first weeks of treatment.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Increase of the plasma concentrations of afatinib due to increase of its absorption by the protease inhibitor
INTERACTION.COMMENT: It is recommended that that the protease inhibitor be administered as far from the afatinib as possible, preferably at an interval of 6 to 12 hours from the dose of afatinib.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Large decrease of the plasma concentrations of the albendazole and of its active metabolite by the ritonavir, with risk of reduction of its effectiveness.
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Clinical monitoring of the therapeutic response and possible adjustment of the dosage of the albendazole during the treatment with the enzymatic inducer and after it is stopped.

CLASS.name: VASOCONSTRICTOR ALKALOIDS OF ERGOT OF RYE

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Risk of constriction of coronary blood vessels or those of the extremities (ergotism), or of rapid elevation of blood pressure
Risk of reduction of the effectiveness of the protease inhibitor due to increase of its hepatic metabolism by the inducer
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Regular clinical monitoring and laboratory tests, especially at the beginning of the administration of these substances together.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Variation of the effect of the vitamin K antagonist, most often by decreasing it
INTERACTION.COMMENT: More frequent testing of the INR. Possible adjustment of the dosage of the vitamin K antagonist during the length of the treatment

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Increased risk of undesirable effects (concentration-dependant) of the rhabodmyolysis type (decrease of the hepatic metabolism of the atorvastatin)
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Use lower doses of atorvastatin. If the therapeutic objective is not reached, use another statin not affected by this type of interaction.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Decrease, possibly very large, of the plasma concentrations of the atovaquone due to increase of its metabolism

In case of prolonged use by oral or inhaled route: increase of the plasma concentrations of the corticoid due to decrease of its hepatic metabolism by the protease inhibitor, with risk of appearance of Cushings syndrome, even of adrenal insufficiency
Decrease of the concentrations of the boceprevir and of the lopinavir (or darunavir or fosamprenavir), with risk of therapeutic failure
Risk of increase or decrease of the effects of the buprenorphine, due to both inhibition and acceleration of its metabolism by the protease inhibitor
Increase of the concentrations of the clarithromycin and of its active metabolite due to decrease of its hepatic metabolism by the protease inhibitor
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Regular clinical monitoring and laboratory tests, especially at the beginning of treatment with these medications together.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Increase of the undesirable effects of the colchicine, with potentially fatal consequences
Increase of the concentrations of darifenacin, with risk of increase of its undesirable effects
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Clinical monitoring and possible adjustment of the dosage of darifenacin.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Increase of the plasma concentrations of the dexamethasone due to decrease of its hepatic metabolism by the protease inhibitor, with risk of appearance of Cushings syndrome
Increase of the digoxinemia, more marked for IV route, due to increase of the absorption of the digoxin or decrease of its renal clearance.
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Clinical monitoring and, if there is reason for them, EKG and monitoring of the digoxinemia, with possible adjustment of the dosage of digoxin.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Increase of the plasma concentrations of eribuline by the ritonavir
Risk of decrease of the contraceptive effectiveness due to decrease of the concentrations of the hormonal contraceptive, because of the increase of its hepatic metabolism by the ritonavir.
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Another method of contraception, in particular a barrier method (condom or IUD), should be used during the length of the treatment with these medications together and a cycle following.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Increase of the concentrations of fesoterodine with patients who are slow metabolizers, with risk of overdose
Increased risk of ventricular arrhythmias, especially of torsades de pointes
Risk of reduction of the effectiveness of the thyroid hormones due to increase of their hepatic metabolism by the ritonavir
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Clinical monitoring and laboratory tests and possible adjustment of the dosage of the thyroid hormones.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Very large increase of the blood concentrations of the immunosuppressant due to inhibition of its hepatic metabolism
INTERACTION.COMMENT: If these substances are administered together, strict testing of renal function, blood concentration dosages of the immunosuppressant, and adjustment of its dosage.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Large increase of the plasma concentrations of the PDE5 inhibitor, with risk of severe hypotension
INTERACTION.COMMENT: - with the sildenafil in the indication for pulmonary arterial hypertension

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Risk of decrease of the concentrations and of the effectiveness of the lamotrigine due to increase of its hepatic metabolism by the ritonavir
INTERACTION.COMMENT: -avoid beginning the treatment with ritonavir during the period of adjustment of the dosage of lamotrigine

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Increased risk of ventricular arrhythmias, especially of torsades de pointes
Decrease of the plasma concentrations of methadone with risk of appearance of a withdrawal syndrome due to increase of its hepatic metabolism by the ritonavir
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Regular clinical monitoring and possible adjustment of the dosage of methadone.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Increase of the plasma concentrations of midazolam due to decrease of its hepatic metabolism, with increase of sedation
INTERACTION.COMMENT: -midazolam by IV route

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Decrease of the plasma concentrations of the protease inhibitor, due to the enzymatic inducer effect of the St Johns wort, with risk of reduction of the effectiveness, even complete loss of the effect, which can have possibly serious consequences (reduction of the antiretroviral effectiveness)
INTERACTION.COMMENT: In the case of the substances being taken together by accident, do not stop the St Johns wort abruptly, but test the plasma concentrations (or the effectiveness) of the protease inhibitor before and then after the St Johns wort is stopped.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Risk of ventricular arrhythmias, especially of torsades de pointes
Risk of decrease of the contraceptive effectiveness because of decrease of the concentrations of hormonal contraceptive, due to the increase of its hepatic metabolism by the ritonavir
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Another method of contraception, in particular a barrier method (condom or IUD), should be used during the time the substances are administered together and one cycle following.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Increased risk of ventricular arrhythmias, especially of torsades de pointes

Risk of reduction of the effectiveness of the protease inhibitor (even more so when the dosage of the rifabutin is large) for one thing, and risk of increase of the undesirable effects (uveitis) of the rifabutin, for another thing.
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Regular clinical monitoring and laboratory tests, especially at the beginning of the administration of the substances together.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION:
Very large decrease of the plasma concentrations of the protease inhibitor, due to increase of its hepatic metabolism by the rifampicin.
For the combination (saquinavir + ritonavir):
risk of severe hepatocellular toxicity
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Until additional information about the ritonavir boosted protease inhibitors is available.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Increase of the plasma concentrations of the rosuvastatin due to increase of its absorption
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Clinical monitoring and laboratory tests.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Increased risk of undesirable effects (concentration-dependent) of the rhabdomyolisis type (decrease of the hepatic metoblism of the simvastatin).
Increase of the concentrations of solifenacin, with risk of overdose
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Clinical monitoring and possible adjustment of the dosage of solifenacin.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Decrease of the concentrations of the telaprevir and of the darunavir or of the fosamprenavir, with risk of therapeutic failure.
Decrease of the plasma concentrations of the theophylline, due to increase of its hepatic metabolism
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Clinical monitoring and possibly monitoring of the theophyllinemia; if there is reason for it, adjustment of the dosage of the theophylline during the treatment with the protease inhibitor and after it is stopped.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Increase of the concentrations of tolterodine in patients who are slow metabolizers, with risk of overdose.
Risk of decrease of the effect of the ulipristal, due to increase of its hepatic metabolism by the ritonavir
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Choose a therapeutic alternative that is little or not at all metabolized.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Increase of the concentrations of venlafaxine with risk of overdose
Increase of the toxicity of the antimitotic, due to decrease of its hepatic metabolism by the protease inhibitor.
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Strict clinical monitoring and possible adjustment of the dosage of the antimitotic.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Very large reduction of the concentrations of the antifungal due to increase of its metabolism by the ritonavir, with risk of failure of the treatment
Slight increase of the sedative effects of the zolpidem
Slight increase of the sedative effects of the zopiclone
Decrease of the plasma concentrations and of the effectiveness of the tyrosine kinase inhibitor, due to increase of its metabolism by the enzymatic inducer
Risk of decrease of the bioavailability of the tyrosine-kinase inhibitor, by reason of its pH dependent absorption
INTERACTION.COMMENT: -except with the vandetanib.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Risk of decrease of the bioavailability of the tyrosine-kinase inhibitor, by reason of its pH dependent absorption
INTERACTION.COMMENT: -except with the vandetanib

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Risk of increase of the undesirable effects of the tyrosine kinase inhibitor due to decrease of its metabolism
INTERACTION.COMMENT: --with the bosutinib

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Decrease of the plasma concentrations and of the effectiveness of the tyrosine-kinase inhibitor, due to increase of its metabolism by the St Johns wort
Decrease of the plasma concentrations and of the effectiveness of the tyrosine kinase inhibitor, due to increase of its metabolism by the inducer

Increase of the opioid analgesic's effect of respiratory depression due to decrease of its hepatic metabolism
.
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Clinical monitoring and adjustment of the dosage of the opioid analgesic when administered with a strong inhibitor of CYP3A4

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Risk of increase of the plasma concentrations of the alfuzosin and of its undesirable effects
Increase of the undesirable effects of the calcium channel blockers, most often of the hypotension type, especially in older patients.
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Clinical monitoring and dosage adjustment during the treatment with the enzyme inhibitor and after it is stopped

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Increase of the plasma concentrations of the apixaban by the inhibitor, with increased risk of bleeding
Increase of the plasma concentrations of bedaquiline due to decrease of its hepatic metabolism by the inhibitor.
INTERACTION.COMMENT: If taking these medications together is necessary, more frequent EKG and monitoring of the transaminases are recommended.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Risk of increase of the undesirable effects, especially neurological, of the bortezomib due to decrease of its metabolism.
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Clinical monitoring and possible adjustment of the dosage of the bortezomib during the length of the treatment with the enzyme inhibitor.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Risk of increase of the undesirable dose dependent effects of the cabazitaxel due to inhibition of its metabolism by the enzyme inhibitor
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Clinical monitoring and possible adjustment of the dosage of the cabazitaxel during the treatment with the enzyme inhibitor

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Increase of the concentrations of daclatasvir by the inhibitor
INTERACTION.COMMENT: The dose of daclatasvir should be decreased to 30mg once a day when it is administered with the inhibitor.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Risk of increase of the undesirable effects, especially of the vertigo or syncope type.
Risk of increase of the undesirable dose-dependent effects of the docetaxel due to inhibition of its metabolism by the enzyme inhibitor
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Clinical monitoring and possible adjustment of the dosage of the docetaxel during the treatment with the enzyme inhibitor.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Large increase of the concentrations of dronedarone due to decrease of its metabolism
Risk of increase of the plasma concentrations of the eplerenone by the inhibitor and of its undesirable effects, especially hyperkalemia
Increase of the opioid analgesic's effect of respiratory depression due to decrease of its hepatic metabolism
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Clinical monitoring and adjustment of the dosage of the opioid analgesic when there is also treatment with a strong inhibitor of CYP3A4.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Increaese of the plasma concentrations of idelalisib due to decrease of its hepatic metabolism by the inhibitor
Risk of increase of the undesirable effects of the tyrosine kinase inhibitor due to decrease of its metabolism
INTERACTION.COMMENT: -with the bosutinib

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Risk of increase of the undesirable effects of the irinotecan due to increase of the plasma concentrations of its active metabolite
Increase of the plasma concentrations of the ivabradine and consequently of its undesirable effects (inhibition of its hepatic metabolism by the inhibitor).
Large increase of the concentrations of ivacaftor, with risks of increase of its undesirable effects
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Reduce the dose by a fourth, that is 150 mg every other day.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Increase of the plasma concentrations of the lomitapide due to decrease of its hepatic metabolism by the inhibitor
Increase of the concentrations of maraviroc by the inhibitor.
INTERACTION.COMMENT: The dose of maravirocmust be decreased to 150 mg twice a day when administered with this inhibitor.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Increase of the plasma concentrations of the ombitsavir + paritaprevir due to decrease of the hepatic metabolism by the inhibitor.
INTERACTION.COMMENT: --except with ritonavir

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Increase of the plasma concentrations of the oxycodone
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Clinical monitoring and possible adjustment of the dosage of oxycodone during the length of the treatment with the enzyme inhibitor.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Risk of increased difficulty with ventricular rhythm, especially of torsades de pointes
Large increase of the concentrations of quetiapine, with risk of overdose
Risk of increase of the undesirable effects of the quinine, especially ventricular arrhythmias and neurosensory disorders (cinchonism).
INTERACTION.COMMENT: -with the protease inhibitors

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Increase of the concentrations of ranolazine due to decrease of its metabolism by the inhibitor
Increase of the plasma concentrations of regorafenib due to decrease of its hepatic metabolism by the inhibitor
Increase of the plasma concentrations of riociquat due to decrease of its hepatic metabolism by the inhibitor
Increase of the plasma concentrations of rivaroxaban, with increase of the risk of bleeding
Risk of increase of the plasma concentrations of simeprevir due to decrease of its hepatic metabolism by the inhibitor
Increase of the undesirable effects specific to each substrate, with frequently severe consequences
Increase of the opioid analgesic's effect of respiratory depression due to decrease of its hepatic metabolism
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Clinical monitoring and adjustment of the dosage of the opioid analgesic when there is also treatment with a strong inhibitor of CYP3A4.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Risk of increase of the undesirable effects of the tamsulosine, due to inhibition of its hepatic metabolism
Increase of the plasma concentrations of ticagrelor due to decrease of its hepatic metabolism by the inhibitor
Bradycardia and/or disorders of atrioventricular conduction, due to decrease of the hepatic metabolism of the verapamil by the inhibitor
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Clinical monitoring and EKG. If there is reason for it, adjustment of the dosage of the verapamil during the treatment with the inhibitor, and after it is stopped, as the situation requires.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Increase of the risk of hemorrhage
Increase of the risk of hemorrhage
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Clinical monitoring and, if the situation requires, more frequent testing of the INR. Possible adjustment of the dosage of the oral anticoagulant during the administration with the SSRI and after it is stopped.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Increase of the plasma concentrations of the tricyclic antidepressant with risk of convulsions and increase of the undesirable effects
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Increased clinical monitoring and, if necessary, adjustment of the dosage

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Increase of the risk of hemorrhage
Risk of decrease of the effectiveness of the antidepressant
Risk of appearance of a serotonin syndrome: diarrhea, tachycardia, sweats, trembling, confusion, even coma
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Wait at least two weeks between the discontinuation of the irreversible MAOI and the start of treatment with the SSRI, and at least a week between the end of treatment with the SSRI (except fluoxetine: five weeks) and the beginning [sic].

CLASS.name: REVERSIBLE MAOI-A, INCLUDING LINEZOLIDE AND METHYLENE BLUE

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Risk of appearance of a serotonin syndrome: diarrhea, tachycardia, sweats, trembling, confusion, even coma
INTERACTION.COMMENT: If administering these substances together cannot be avoided, very strict clinical monitoring. Begin the administration with minimum recommended dosages.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Risk of appearance of a serotonin syndrome
Risk of appearance of a serotonin syndrome
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Regular clinical monitoring and laboratory tests, especially at the beginning of the administration of the substances together.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Risk of appearance of a serotonin syndrome
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Regular clinical monitoring and laboratory tests, especially at the beginning of the administration of the substances together.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Risk of therapeutic failure when there is concomitant treatment with orlistat
Risk of appearance of convulsions and/or a serotonin syndrome
Risk of appearance of serotonin syndrome
Increase of the hypoglycemic reaction (inhibition of the compensation reactions which can facilitate the onset of hypoglycemic coma)
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Avoid taking alcoholic beverages and medications containing alcohol.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Risk of hypoglycemia or hyperglycemia: decrease or increase of the needs for insulin, due to decrease or increase of the secretion of endogenous glucagon
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Inform the patient of the risk of hypoglycemia or hyperglycemia, strengthen self-monitoring of blood glucose, and adjust the dosage of insulin if needed during the treatment with the somatostatin analog.

CLASS.name: BETA-2 MIMETICS or BETA2 ADRENERGIC AGONISTS

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Elevation of the glycemia by the beta-2 mimetic
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Strengthen blood and urine monitoring

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: All the beta-blocking agents can mask certain symptoms of hypoglycemia: palpitations and tachycardia
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Inform the patient and, especially at the start of treatment, strengthen self-monitoring of blood glucose.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: All the beta-blocking agents can mask certain symptoms of hypoglycemia: palpitations and tachycardia
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Inform the patient and, especially at the start of treatment, strengthen self-monitoring of blood glucose

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: With large dosages (100 mg/day of chlorpromazine): elevation of the glycemia (decrease of the freeing of the insulin)
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Inform the patient and strengthen self-monitoring of blood glucose. Possibly adjust the dosage of the insulin during the treatment with the neuroleptic and after it is stopped.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Diabetes inducing effect of the danazol
INTERACTION.COMMENT: If administering these substances together cannot be avoided, inform the patient and strengthen self-monitoring of blood glucose. Possibly adjust the dosage of the insulin during the treatment with the danazol and after it is stopped.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: The use of an ACE inhibitor can lead to an increase of the hypoglycemic effect in a diabetic treated with insulin. The onset of hypoglycemic difficulties seems exceptional (improvement of the tolerance for glucose that would have the result of a reduction of the need for insulin).
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Strengthen self-monitoring of blood glucose

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Risk of facilitating systemic uptake of the aluminum salts especially when there is altered renal function
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Take aluminum based gastrointestinal medications at a different time (more than 2 hours apart if possible) from the citrates, including the natural ones such as citrus fruits.

CLASS.name: FLUOROURACIL (AND BY EXTRAPOLATION, TEGAFUR AND CAPECITABINE)

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Increase of the gastrointestinal toxicity of the fluorouracil
Probable decrease of the plasma concentrations of the active metabolite of the irinotecan, with risk of failure of the cytotoxic treatment
Risk of increase of the undesirable effects of the irinotecan due to increase of the plasma concentrations of its active metabolite
Decrease of the plasma concentrations of the active metabolite of the irinotecan, with risk of failure of the cytotoxic treatment

Increase of the hepatotoxic effect of the isoniazid, with increased formation of its toxic metabolites.
.
INTERACTION.COMMENT: In case of a scheduled intervention, it is prudent to stop the treatment with the isoniazid a week before the surgery and only restart it two weeks after.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Increase of the plasma concentrations of carbamazepine with signs of overdose due to inhibition of its hepatic metabolism
Disorders of behavior and of coordination

Described for the prednisolone. Decrease of the plasma concentrations of the isoniazide. Mechanism proposed: increase of the hepatic metabolism of the isoniazide and decrease of that of the glucocorticoides
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Clinical monitoring and laboratory tests.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Decrease of the plasma concentrations of ketoconazole
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Space the doses of the two anti-infectives at lease 12 hours apart. Monitor the plasma concentrations of the ketoconazole and possibly adjust its dosage.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Overdose of phenytoin (decrease of its metabolism)
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Strict clinical monitoring, plasma concentration dosage of phenytoin and possible adjustment of its dosage during the treatment with the isoniazid and after it is stopped.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Addition of the hepatotoxic effects.
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Clinical monitoring and laboratory tests.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Increase of the hepatoxicity of the isoniazid (increase of the formation of toxic metabolites of the isoniazid)
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Clinical monitoring and laboratory tests of this classic combination. In case of hepatitis, stop the isoniazid.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Increased risk of onset of peripheral neuropathy due to addition of undesirable effects.
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Regular clinical monitoring and laboratory tests, especially at the beginning of the administration of the substances together.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION:
Serious ventricular arrhythmias due to increase of cardiac sensitization
.
Increase of the plasma concentrations of afatinib due to increase of its absorption by the itraconazole.
INTERACTION.COMMENT: It is recommended to administer the itraconazole as far distant from the afatinib as possible, preferably at an interval of 6 to 12 hours away from the afatinib.

CLASS.name: VASOCONSTRICTOR ALKALOIDS OF ERGOT OF RYE

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Risk of constriction of coronary blood vessels or those of the extremities (ergotism), or of rapid elevation of blood pressure
Increase by nearly six times of the plasma concentrations of aliskiren and increase of the risk of its undesirable effects
Decrease of the absorption of the azole antifungal due to increase of the gastric pH by the antisecretory
Decrease of the absorption of the azole antifungal due to increase of the intragastric pH by the antisecretory
Increase of the effect of the vitamin K antagonist and of the risk of hemorrhage
INTERACTION.COMMENT: More frequent testing of the INR. Possible adjustment of the dosage of the vitamin K antagonist during the treatment with the itraconazole and a week after it is stopped

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Increase of the concentrations of aprepitant due to decrease of its hepatic metabolism by the intraconazole.
Increased risk of undesirable effects (concentration-dependant) of the rhabodmyolysis type (decrease of the hepatic metabolism of the atorvastatin)

In case of prolonged use by oral or inhaled route: increase of the plasma concentrations of the corticoid due to decrease of its hepatic metabolism by the itraconazole, with risk of appearance of Cushings syndrome, even adrenal insufficiency
Increase of the concentrations of buprenorphine due to decrease of its hepatic metabolism, with risk of increase of its undesirable effects
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Clinical monitoring and adjustment of the dosage of the buprenorphine during the treatment with the inhibitor and, if the situation requires, after it is ended.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Increase of the plasma concentrations of the buspirone due to decrease of its hepatic metabolism, with substantial increase of sedation
With the busulfan in large doses: doubling of the concentrations of busulfan by the itraconazole
Increase of more than double of the plasma concentrations of dabigatran, with increase of the risk of bleeding
Increase of the concentrations of darifenacin, with risk of increase of its undesirable effects
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Clinical monitoring and possible adjustment of the dosage of darifenacin.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Increase of the plasma concentrations of the dexamethasone due to decrease of its hepatic metabolism by the enzyme inhibitor, with risk of appearance of Cushing's syndrome
Increase of the digoxinemia with nausea, vomiting, arrhythmias
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Clinical monitoring, and, if there is reason for them, EKG and monitoring of the digoxinemia with adjustment of the dosage of the digoxin during the treatment with the itraconazole and after it is stopped.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Increased risk of ventricular arrhythmias in predisposed patients (congenital long QT syndrome)
Increase of the concentrations of fesoterodine with patients who are slow metabolizers, with risk of overdose
Risk of tinnitis and/or loss of hearing acuity: cinchonism linked to a decrease of the hepatic metabolism of the antiarrythmic by the itraconazole
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Monitoring of the plasma concentrations of the antiarrythmic and possible decrease of its dosage if necessary.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Very large increase of the blood concentrations of the immusuppressant due to inhibition of its hepatic metabolism
INTERACTION.COMMENT: If these substances are administered together, strict testing of the renal function, blood concentration dosage of the immunosuppressant and possible adjustment of the dosage.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Decrease of the plasma concentrations of itraconazole, with risk of loss of effectiveness, due to increase of its hepatic metabolism by the inducer.
Increase (very large for the avanafil and the verdenafil) of the plasma concentrations of the type 5 phosphodiesterase inhibitorwith risk of hypotension (severe with the vardenafil)
INTERACTION.COMMENT: contraindication

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Increased risk of undesirable effects, especially edema, due to decrease of the hepatic metabolism of the dihydorpyridine
Increased risk of ventricular arrhythmias, especially of torsades de pointes
INTERACTION.COMMENT: If this is possible, interrupt the torsadegenic medication. If administering these two together cannot be avoided, testing of the QT beforehand and EKG monitoring.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Risk of large decrease of the plasma concentrations of itraconazole, with risk of loss of effectiveness, due to increase of its hepatic metabolism by the St Johns wort
Risk of ventricular arrhythmias, especially of torsades de pointes

Increased risk of ventricular arrhythmias, especially of torsades de pointes, as well as tinnitis and/or decrease of auditory acuity (cinchonism), due to decrease of the hepatic metabolism of the quinidine
INTERACTION.COMMENT: If administering the two substances together cannot be avoided, strict clinical monitoring and EKG.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Large increase of the concentrations of salmeterol due to decrease of its hepatic metabolism by the itraconazole
Increased risk of undesirable effects (concentration-dependent) of the rhabdomyolosis type (decrease of the hepatic metabolism of the simvastatin)
Increase of the concentrations of the solfenacin with risk of overdose
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Clinical monitoring and possible adjustment of the dosage of the solifenacin.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Increase of the concentrations of tolterodine in patients who are slow metabolizers, with risk of overdose
Risk of increase of the plasma concentrations of the trabectedine by the itraconazole.
INTERACTION.COMMENT: It administering these two medications together is necessary, clinical monitoring and possible adjustment of the dosage of the trabectedine during the length of the treatment with itraconazole.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Increase of the concentrations of venlafaxine with risk of overdose
Increase of the neurotoxicity of the antimitotic, due to decrease of its hepatic metabolism by the itraconazole
Slight increase of the sedative effects of the zolpidem
Slight increase of the sedative effects of the zopiclone
Increase of the plasma concentrations of the ivabradine and of its undesirable effects (inhibition of its intestinal metabolism by the grapefruit juice)

Risk of decrease of the effectiveness of the ivabradine, due to increase of its metabolism by the inducer
.
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Clinical monitoring and adjustment of the dosage of the ivabradine during the administration of these substances together and after the inducer is stopped.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Increase of the plasma concentrations of the ivabradine and of its undesirable effects, especially cardiac ones (inhibition of its hepatic metabolism by the diltiazem), that add to the bradycardia inducing effects of these molecules
Increase of the plasma concentrations of the ivabradine and consequently of its undesirable effects (inhibition of its hepatic metabolism by the inhibitor).
Increase of the plasma concentrations of the ivabradine and consequently of its undesirable effects (inhibition of its hepatic metabolism by the josamycin).
Risk of decrease of the effectiveness of the ivabradine, due to increase of its metabolism by the St Johns wort
Risk of decrease of the effectiveness of the ivabradine, due to increase of its metabolism by the rifampicin
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Clinical monitoring and adjustment of the dosage of the ivabradine during the administration of the two substances together and after it is stopped.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Increase of the plasma concentrations of the ivabradine and of its undesirable effects, especially cardiac ones (inhibition of its hepatic metabolism by the verapamil), that add to the bradycardia inducing effects of these molecules
Increase of the concentrations of ivacaftor, with risks of increase of its undesirable effects
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Reduce the dose by half, that is 150 mg/day.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Large decrease of the concentrations of the ivacaftor, with risk of loss of effectiveness
Large increase of the concentrations of ivacaftor, with risks of increase of its undesirable effects
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Reduce the dose by a fourth, that is 150 mg every other day.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Increase of the plasma concentrations of carbamazepine with signs of overdose, due to decrease of its hepatic metabolism
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Clinical monitoring and. if needed, plasma dosage and possible reduction of the dosage of the carbamazepine.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Risk of increase of the blood concentrations of ciclosporin and of the creatinemia
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Blood concentration dosage of the ciclosporin, testing of renal function, and adjustment of the dosage during the administration with the macrolide and after it is stopped.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Risk of increase of the undesirable effects of the disopyramide: severe hypoglyclemia, lengthening of the QT interval, and serious ventricular arrhythmias, especially of the torsades de pointes type
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Regular clinical monitoring, laboratory tests, and EKG

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Increased risk of ventricular arrhythmias in predisposed patients (congenital long QT syndrome)
Increased risk of ventricular arrhythmias, especially of torsades de pointes
INTERACTION.COMMENT: If this is possible, interrupt the macrolide. If administering these substances together cannot be avoided, testing before hand of the QT and EKG monitoring.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Increase of the plasma concentrations of the ivabradine and consequently of its undesirable effects (inhibition of its hepatic metabolism by the josamycin).
Increased risk of ventricular arrhythmias, especially of torsades de pointes
Increase of the plasma concentrations of sildenafil, with risk of hypotension
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Start the treatment with sildenafil at the minimun dose when it is administered with josamycin.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Increase of the blood concentrations of tacrolimus and of the creatinemia, due to inhibition of the hepatic metabolism of the tacrolimus by the josamycin
Risk of increase of the theophyllinemia, particularly with children
Increase of the plasma concentrations of afatinib due to increase of its absorption by the ketoconazole.
INTERACTION.COMMENT: It is recommended that the ketoconazole be administered as far from the afatinib as possible, preferably at an interval of 6 or 12 hours away from doses of the afatinib

CLASS.name: VASOCONSTRICTOR ALKALOIDS OF ERGOT OF RYE

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Risk of constriction of coronary blood vessels or those of the extremities (ergotism), or of rapid elevation of blood pressure

Decrease of the absorption of the azole antifungal due to increase
of the gastric pH by the antisecretory
Decrease of the absorption of the azole antifungal due to increase of the gastric pH by the anitsecretory

Increase of the concentrations of buprenorphine due to decrease of its hepatic metabolism, with risk of increase of its undesirable effects

Increase of the concentrations of darifenacin, with risk of increase of its undesirable effects

Increased risk of ventricular arrhythmias with predisposed patients (congenital long QT syndrome)
Increase of the concentrations of fesoterodine with patients who are slow metabolizers, with risk of overdose
Increase of the plasma concentrations of the fidaxomicine
Very large increase of the blood concentrations of the immunosuppressant due to inhibition of its hepatic metabolism.

Increased risk of ventricular arrhythmias, especially of torsades de pointes

Increase of the plasma concentrations of nevirapine due to decrease of its hepatic metabolism by the ketoconazole for one thing, and decrease of the plasma concentrations of the ketoconazole due to increase of its hepatic metabolism by the nevirapine, for another thing
Decrease of the plasma concentrations and of the effectiveness of the two anti-infectives (enzymatic induction by the rifampicin and decrease of the intestinal absorption by the azole antifungal)
Large increase of the concentrations of salmeterol due to decrease of its hepatic metabolism by the ketoconazole
Increased risk of undesirable effects (concentration-dependent) of the rhabdomyolisis type (decrease of the hepatic metabolism of the cholesterol lowering substance)
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Use a statin not affected by this type of interaction.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Increase of the concentrations of solifenacin, with risk of overdose
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Clinical monitoring and possible adjustment of the dosage of solifenacin

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Increase of the concentrations of tolterodine in patients who are slow metabolizers, with risk of overdose
Increase of the concentrations of vanlafaxine with risk of overdose
Increase of the neurotoxicity of the antimitotic, due to decrease of its hepatic metabolism by the ketoconazole
Slight increase of the sedative effects of the zolpidem
Slight increase of the sedative effects of the zolpiclone
Risk of decrease of the effectiveness of the cladribine by the lamivudine
Risk of decrease of the effectiveness of each antiviral due to reciprocal inhibition of the phosphorylation reaction at the origin of the active metabolites
Doubling of the concentrations of ambrisentan, with increase of its vasodilator effect (severe headaches )
Significant decrease of the plasma concentrations of the abiraterone, with risk of lower effectiveness
Risk of increase of the undesirable effects of the flecainide, due to decrease of its hepatic metabolism by the abiratarone.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Risk of increase of the undesirable effects of the propafenone, due to decrease of its hepatic metabolism by the abiraterone
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Clinical monitoring. If needed, adjustment of the dosage of the propafenone during the treatment with the abiraterone

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Significant decrease of the plasma concentrations of the abiraterone, with risk of lower effectiveness
Risk of increase of the neurological effects (vertigo, ataxia, diplopia) of the carbamazepine when the lamotrigine is introduced
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Clinical monitoring and possible reduction of the dosage of the carbamazepine.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Risk of decrease of the concentrations and of the effectiveness of the lamotrigine due to increase of its hepatic metabolism
INTERACTION.COMMENT: -avoid starting an oral contraceptive during the period of adjustment of the dosage of the lamotrigine.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Risk of decrease of the concentrations and of the effectiveness of the lamotrigine due to increase of its hepatic metabolism by the ritonavir
INTERACTION.COMMENT: -Avoid beginning the treatment with ritonavir during the period of adjustment of the dosage of the lamotrigine

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Decrease of the concentrations of the lamotrigine with risk of lower effectiveness, due to increase of its hepatic metabolism by the oxcarbazepine
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Clinical monitoring and testing of the plasma concentrations, with adjustment of the dosage of the lamotrigine if needed.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Increased risk of serious cutaneous reactions (Lyell's syndrome). In addition, increase of the plasma concentrations of lamotrigine (decrease of its hepatic metabolism by the sodium valproate)
INTERACTION.COMMENT: If this combination of medications is judged necessary, strict clinical monitoring.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Increase of the blood concentrations of the tacrolimus
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Blood concentration dosage of the tacrolimus, testingof the renal function, and adjustment of the dosage during the administration of these medications together and after it is stopped.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Only when ledipasvir is combined with sofosbuvir, appearance of bradycardia, possibly abruptly, which can have fatal consequences.
INTERACTION.COMMENT: If administering these together cannot be avoided, strictmonitoring of patients is recommended, in particular during the first weeks of treatment with the ledipasvir/sofosbuvir combination (clinical monitoring and EKG).

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Large decrease of the plasma concentrations of the ledipasvir due to increase of its hepatic metabolism by the anticonvulsant enzymatic inducer.
Decrease of the concentrations of the ledipasvir when the proton pump is administered before the ledipasvir
INTERACTION.COMMENT: It is recommended that the proton pump inhibitor and the ledipasvir be administered simultaneously

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Risk of increase of the plasma concentrations of the statin and of its undesirable effects of the rhabdomyolysis type
INTERACTION.COMMENT: --with the rosuvastatin

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Risk of large decrease of the plasma concentrations of ledipasvir due to increase of its hepatic metabolism by the St Johns wort
Large decrease of the plasma concentrations of the ledipasvir due to increase of its hepatic metabolism by the ripampicin
When administered with a protease inhibitor, increase of the plasma concentrations of the tenofovir by the ledipasvit
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Clinical monitoring and laboratory tests, especially of the renal function

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Increased risk of onset of rhabdomyolysis
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Strengthen clinical monitoring and laboratory tests, especially during the first weeks of treatment.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Increased risk of undesirable effects, especially edema, due to decrease of the intestinal metabolism of the dihyropyridine
Moderate increase of the blood concentrations of the immunosuppressant and more notable increase of the concentrations of the lercanidipine
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Separate the time when the two medications are taken. Blood concentration dosage of the immunosuppressant, and adjustment if necessary of its dosage during the administration of the medications together and after it is stopped

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Increased risk of undesirable effects, especially edema, due to decrease of the hepatic metabolism of the dihydorpyridine
Increased risk of undesirable effects, especially edema, due to decrease of the hepatic metabolism of the dihydropyridine
Risk of aggravation of the Parkinsonian syndrome or of undesirable central effects (visual hallucinations, confusion, headaches)
Decrease of the digestive absorption of the levodopa
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Take the iron salts at a different time from the levodopa (more than 2 hours apart if possible).

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: [no text on ANSM document]
Increase of the risk of orthostatic hypotension
Increase of the effects of the levodopa but equally of its undesirable effects. Increase of the antihypertensive effect of the methyldopa
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Clinical monitoring and possibly decrease of the doses of levodopa.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Reciprocal antagonism between the levodopa and the neuroleptic
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Use an antiemitic without extrapyramidal effects.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Reciprocal antagonism between the levodopa and the neuroleptics
INTERACTION.COMMENT: With a parkinsons patient, use the minimum effective dosees of each of the medications.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Inhibition of the effects of the levodopa
When administered with the carbidopa: inhibition of the absorption of the carbidopa with decrease of the plasma concentrations of the levodopa
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Clinical monitoring and possible adjustment of the dosage of the levodopa.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Reciprocal antagonism between the levodopa and the tetrabenazine

CLASS.name: MEDICATIONS THAT TEND TO INDUCE TORSADES DE POINTES

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Increased risk of ventricular arrhythmia, especially of torsades de pointes
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Clinical monitoring and EKG during the administrations of these substances together.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Risk of increase of the plasma concentrations of lidocaine, with possibility of undesirable neurological and cardiac effects, due to decrease of its hepatic metabolism by the amiodarone
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Clinical monitoring, EKG, and possibly testing of the plasma concentrations of lidocaine. If needed, adjustment of the dosage of the lidocaine during the treatment with amiodarone and after it is stopped.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: With the lidocaine administered by IV route: increase of the plasma concentrations of lidocaine with possibility of undesirable neurological and cardiac effects (decrease of the hepatic clearance of the lidocaine)
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Clinical monitoring, EKG, and, possibly testing of the plasma concentrations of lidocaine during the administration of the substances together and after the beta-blocking agent is stopped. Adjustment, if needed, of the dosage of the lidocaine

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Negative inotropic effect with risk of acute decompensated heart failure

With the cimetidine used in doses greater than or equal to 800 mg/day: increase of the plasma concentrations of lidocaine with risk of undesirable neurological and cardiac effects (inhibition of the hepatic metabolism of the lidocaine)
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Clinical monitoring, EKG, and possibly monitoring of the plasma concentrations of the lidocaine; if there is reason for it, adjustment of the dosage of the lidocaine during the treatment with the cimetidine and after it is stopped.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Increase of the plasma concentrations of the lidocaine with possibilities of undesirable neurological and cardiac effects (decrease of the hepatic clearance of the lidocaine)
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Clinical monitoring, EKG and possibly testing of the plasma concentrations of the lidocaine during and after the administration of the two substances together. Adjustment, if needed, of the dosage of the lidocaine.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Increase of the effects of the curares when the antibiotic is administered by parenteral and/or peritoneal route before, during, or after the curarizing agent
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Monitor the degree of curarisation at the end of anesthesia.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Risk of increase of the undesirable effects of the linezolide by the clarithromycin, due to increase of its absorption
Risk of decrease of the effectiveness of the linezolide due to increase of its hepatic metabolism by the rifampicin.
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Clinical monitoring and possible increase of the dosage of the linezolide during the treatment with the rifampicin.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION:
Described for warfarin and acenocoumarol.
Decrease of the effect of the vitamin K antagonist, due to increase of its hepatic metabolism by the aminoglutethimide
.
INTERACTION.COMMENT: More frequent testing of the INR. Possible adjustment of the dosage of the Vitamin K antagonist during the treatment with aminoglutethimide and two weeks after it is stopped.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Decrease of the effectiveness of the dexamethasone, due to increase of its hepatic metabolism
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Adjustment of the dosage of the dexamethasone.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Decrease of the lithemia with risk of reduction of the therapeutic effectiveness
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Strict monitoring of the lithemia and possible adjustment of the dosage of lithium.

Increase of the lithemia that can attain toxic values (decrease of the renal excretion of the lithium)
.

Risk of reduction of the effectiveness of the lithium due to increase of its renal elimination by the calcitonin

Increase of the lithemia with signs of overdose of lithium as with a low sodium regimen (decrease of the urinary excretion of the lithium)
INTERACTION.COMMENT: If administering these substances together cannot be avoided, strict monitoring of the lithemia and adjustment of the dosage of lithium.

INTERACTION.COMMENT: The dose of maraviroc must be reduced to 150 mg twice a day if it is taken with this inhibitor.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Risk of decrease of the plasma concentrations of maraviroc that could lead to a loss of the virological response
In case of co-administered with foramprenavir, significant decrease of the concentratioins of ritonavir that could lead to a loss of the virological response
Risk of appearance or of increased severity of a serotonin syndrome in case of administering any of these medications with any of the others.
Increased risk of nephrotoxicity and ototoxicity (the ototoxicity is cumulative in cases of successive administrations).
INTERACTION.COMMENT: -in case of simultaneous administration

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION:
With the amphotericin B administered intravenously:
increased risk of nephrotoxicity
Risk of increase of renal toxicity of the aminoglycoside.
Risk of increase of the effects of the botulinum toxin with the aminoglycosides (by extrapolation from the effects observed during the course of the botulism)
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Use another antibiotic

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Increase of the nephrotoxicity of the aminoglycosides by the cefalotin is under discussion
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Monitoring of renal function

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Larger increase of the creatinemia than with ciclosporin alone, with increase of the nephrotoxic risk
Increase of the effects of the curares when the antibiotic is administered by parenteral and/or peritoneal route before, during, or after the curarizing agent.
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Monitor the degree of curarization at the end of anesthesia

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Increase of the nephrotoxic and ototoxic risks of the aminoglycoside (functional renal insufficiency linked to the dehydration caused by the diuretic)
INTERACTION.COMMENT: The two medications may be taken together when there is monitoring of the state of hydration, of the renal and cochleovestibulary functions, and, possibly, of the plasma concentrations of the aminoglycoside.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Addition of the nephrotoxic and/or ototoxic effects, especially in the case of pre-existing renal insufficiency

Addition of the nephrotoxic effects
.

Risk of increase of the undesirable effects, especially of the vertigo and fainting type

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Risk of increase of hypotension, especially orthostatic

CLASS.name: MEDICATIONS AT RISK WHEN WITHDRAWING FROM TOBACCO

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Risk of overdose when replacing tobacco by the replacement therapy
Increase of the risk of hypotension, especially orthostatic
Risk of increase of hypotension, especially orthostatic

MEDICATIONS THAT LOWER THE EPILEPTIC THRESHOLD

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Accrued risk of convulsions
Addition of the undesirable atropinic effects such as urinary retention, constipation, dry mouth, ...
Risk of addition of the effects of the methomoglobinizing agents.
Risk of addition of the effects of the methomoglobinizing agents.
Serious ventricular arrhythmias due to increased cardiac sensitization.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Risk of appearance of a serotonin syndrome: diarrhea, tachycardia, sweats, trembling, confusion, even coma.
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Wait two weeks between stopping the MAOI and the start of the other treatment, and at least a week between the end of that treatment and the start of the MAOI.

CLASS.name: REVERSIBLE MAOI-A, INCLUDING LINEZOLIDE AND METHYLENE BLUE

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Risk of appearance of a serotonin syndrome: diarrhea, tachycardia, sweats, confusion, even coma
INTERACTION.COMMENT: If administering these substances together cannot be avoided, very strict clinical monitoring. Begin the administration of the substances together with minimum recommended dosages.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Risk of therapeutic failure when there is concomitant treatment with orlistat

CLASS.name: ALPHA AND BETA SYMPATHOMIMETICS (IM AND IV ROUTES)

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Paroxysmal hypertension with possibility of ventricular arrhythmias (inhibition of the entry of the sympathomimetic into the sympathic fiber)
Risk of increase of the nephrotoxicity
Increase of the ototoxicity
Increase by the alcohol of the sedative effect of these substances. The alteration of alertness can make driving vehicles or using machines dangerous
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Avoid taking alcoholic beverages or medications containing alcohol.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Increase of central nervous center depression. The alteration of alertness can make driving vehicles or using machines dangerous
Increase of central nervous center depression. The alteration of alertness can made driving vehicles or using machines dangerous
Increase of the plasma concentrations of afatinib due to increase of its absorption by the amiodarone.
INTERACTION.COMMENT: It is recommended that the amiodarone be administered as far away from the afatinib as possible, preferably at an interval of six to twelve hours from the administration of the amiodorone.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Increase of the effect of the Vitamin K antagonist and of the risk of hemorrhage
INTERACTION.COMMENT: More frequent testing of the INR. Possible adjustment of the dosage of the vitamin K antagonist during the treatment with the amiodarone and a week after it is stopped.

CLASS.name: BETA BLOCKING AGENTS (EXCEPT ESMOLOL AND SOTALOL)

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Disorders of autoregulation and conduction (suppression of the compensatory sympathetic mechanisms)
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Clinical monitoring and EKG

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Disorders of autoregulation and of cardiac conduction with risk of excessive bradycardia
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Clinical monitoring and regular EKG

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Increase of the blood concentrations of ciclosporin, due to decrease of its hepatic metabolism, with risk of nephrotoxic effects
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Blood concentration dosage of ciclosporin, testing of the renal function, and adjustment of the dosage of the ciclosporin during the treatment with the amiodarone

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Risk of increase of the undesirable effects of the amiodarone due to decrease of its metabolism by the cobicistat
Increase of the plasma concentrations of dabigatran, with increase of the risk of bleeding
INTERACTION.COMMENT: In post surgical indications:

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION:
Only when daclatasvir is combined with sofosbuvir:
Onset of bradycardia, possibly abrupt, that can have fatal consequences.
INTERACTION.COMMENT: If the administration of these two medications together cannot be avoided, strict clinical monitoring and EKG, in particular during the first weeks of treatment with the daclatsavir/sofosbuvir combination.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Depression of autoregulation (excessive bradycardia) and disorders of atrioventricular conduction. When digoxin is used, increase of the digoxinemia due to decrease of the renal clearance of the digoxin.
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Clinical monitoring, EKG, and, if there is reason to, test the digoxinemia and adjust the dosage of the digoxin.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION:
For diltiazem by injection: risk of bradycardia and of atrioventricular block
For diltiazem by mouth: risk of bradycardia or of atrioventricular block, especially in older persons.
INTERACTION.COMMENT: -with deltiazem administered intravenously

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Disorders of contractility, autoregulation, and electrical conduction (suppression of the compensatory sympathetic mechanisms)
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Clinical monitoring and EKG

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Increase of the plasma concentrations of the fidaxomicin
Increase of the plasma concentrations of ibrutinib due to decrease of its hepatic metabolism by the amiodarone.
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Strict clinical monitoring and reduction of the dose of ibrutinib to 140 mg per day during the length of the administration of these two drugs together.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Only when ledipasvir is combined with sofosbuvir, appearance of bradycardia, posssibly abrupt, that can have fatal consequences.
INTERACTION.COMMENT: If the administration ofthese drugs together cannot be avoided, it is recommended that patients be closely monitored, in particular during the first weeks of the treatment with the ledipasvir-sofosbuvir bitherapy (clinical monitoring and EKG).

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Risk of increase of the plasma concentrations of lidocaine, with possibility of undesirable neurological and cardiac effects, due to decrease of its hepatic metabolism by the amiodarone
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Clinical monitoring, EKG, and possibly testing of the plasma concentrations of lidocaine. If needed, adjustment of the dosage of the lidocaine during the treatment with amiodarone and after it is stopped.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Increase of the plasma concentrations of the amiodarone due to decrease of its hepatice metabolism by the bitherapy.
Risk of decrease of the plasma concentrations of the amiodarone and of its active metabolite
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Clinical monitoring and, if needed, EKG

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Increase of the plasma concentrations of the phenytoin with signs of overdose, in particular neurological ones (decrease of the hepatic metabolism of the phenytoin)
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Clinical monitoring, testing of the plasma concentrations of phenytoin and possible adjustment of its dosage

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Increased risk of undesirable effects (concentration dependent) of the rhabdomyolysis type (decrease of the hepatic metabolism of the simvastatin).
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Do not exceed the dosage of 20mg/day of simvastatin or use another statin not affected by this type of interaction

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION:
Only for the combinations dalatasvir/sofosbuvir or ledipasvir/sofosbuvir:
Appearance of bradycardia, possibly abrupt, that can have fatal consequences.
INTERACTION.COMMENT: If the administration of these medications together cannot be avoided, strict clinical monitoring and EKG, in particular during the first weeks of the treatment with the drug combinations containing sofosbuvir.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Increase of the blood concentrations of tacrolimus due to inhibition of its metabolism by the amiodarone.
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Blood concentration dosage of tacrolimus, testing of the renal function, and adjustment of the dosage of tacrolimus during the administration of it and the amiodarone together and when the amiodarone is stopped.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Risk of increase of the undesirable effects of the tamsulosin due to inhibition of its hepatic metabolism
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Clinical monitoring and adjustment of the dosage of the tamsulosin during the treatment with the enzyme inhibitor and after it is stopped, as the situation requires.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Disorders of autoregulation and of cardiac conduction with risk of excessive bradycardia

-risk of bradycardia or of atrioventricular block.

-risk of bradycardia or of atrioventricular block, especially with older patients

Risk of increase of the undesirable effects of the mequitazine, due to inhibition of its metabolism by the enzyme inhibitor

INTERACTION.COMMENT: Avoid taking alcoholic beverages and medications containing alcohol.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Lactic acidosis due to the metformin, set into action by a possible functional renal insufficiency, linked to the loop diuretics
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Do not use metformin when the creatinemia is greater than 15mg/l (135 umol/l) with men, and 12 mg/l (110umol/l) for women.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Lactic acidosis linked to elevated concentrations of metformin in relation to the functional renal insufficiency induced by the radiological exam.
INTERACTION.COMMENT: The treatment with metformin should be suspended at the time of the radiological exam and only started again 2 days later.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Decrease of the plasma concentrations of methadone with risk of appearance of a withdrawal syndrome due to increase of its hepatic metabolism by the amprenavir.
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Regular clinical monitoring and possible adjustment of the dosage of the methadone.

Increased risk of respiratory depression which can be fatal in case of overdose
Decrease of the plasma concentrations of methadone, with risk of appearance of a withdrawal syndrome, due to increase of its hepatic metabolism by the boceprevir
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Regular clinical monitoring and possible adjustment of the dosage of methadone.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Increase of the plasma concentrations of methadone with overdose and increased risk of lengthening of the QT interval and of ventricular arrhythmias, especially of torsades de pointes.
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Strengthen clinical and electrocardiographic monitoring; if needed, adjustment of the dosage of the methadone during treatment with the cimetidine and after it is stopped.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Increase of the plasma concentrations of methadone with overdose and increased risk of lengthening of the QT interval and of ventricular arrhythmias, especially of torsades de pointes
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Strengthen clinical monitoring and EKG; if needed, adjustment of the dosage of the methadone during the treatment with the fluvoxamine and after it is stopped.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Decrease of the plasma concentrations of methadone with risk of appearance of a withdrawal syndrome, due to increase of its hepatic metabolism
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Increase the frequency of doses of methadone (2 to 3 times a day instead of a single dose per day).

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Decrease of the plasma concentrations of methadone with risk of appearance of a withdrawal syndrome due to increase of its hepatic metabolism by the ritonavir
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Regular clinical monitoring and possible adjustment of the dosage of methadone.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Precipitation of crystals in the urinary tract (due to the acidification of the urine)

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Risk of increase of the hepatoxicity of the methotrexate
INTERACTION.COMMENT: If administering these substances together is judged necessary, strengthen liver function testing

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Increase of the hematological toxicity of the methotrexate (decrease of the renal clearance of the methotrexate by the NSAIs).
