INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Risk of increase of the toxicity of the methotrexate due to decrease of its elimination
INTERACTION.COMMENT: --with the methotrexate in doses > 20mg /week

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Increase of the toxicity of the methotrexate and of the ciclosporin with increase of the creatinemia: reciprocal decrease of the clearances of the two medications
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Blood concentration dosages of ciclosporin and of methotrexate. Adjustment of the dosage if necessary during the administration of the two together and after it is stopped.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Increase of the toxicity of the methotrexate due to inhibition of its renal tubular secretion by the ciprofloxacin
Increase of the effects and of the hematological toxicity of the methothrexate: inhibition of the renal tubular secretion of the methotrexate by the penicillins
Increase of the toxicity of the methotrexate: inhibition of the renal tubular secretion of the methotrexate by the probenecid
Increase of the hematological toxicity of the methotrexate
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Concentration dosage of methotrexate. Adjustment of the dosage if necessary during the time of the administration of the substances together and after it is stopped.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Increase of the hematological toxicity of the methotrexate (decrease of its renal excretion as well as inhibition of the dihydrofolate reductase)
Decrease of the digestive absorption of the methyldopa (formation of complexes)
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Take the iron salts at a different time from the methyldopa (more than two hours apart, if possible).

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Increase of the effects of the levodopa but equally of its undesirable effects. Increase of the antihypertensive effect of the methyldopa
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Clinical monitoring and possible decrease of the doses of levodopa.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Increase of the lithemia which can attain toxic values, with signs of overdose of lithium
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Clinical monitoring and adjustment of the dosage of lithium.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Risk of constriction of coronary blood vessels which can be fatal
Increased risk of undesirable effects (dose dependent) of the rhabdomyolysis type (decrease of the hepatic metabolism of the cholesterol lowering medication).
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Do not exceed the dosage of 40 mg/day of simvastatin or use another statin not affected by this type of interaction

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: For doses of 0.5g to 1 g of methylprednisolone administered in bolus: increase of the effect of the vitamin K antagonist and of the risk of hemorrhage
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Testing of the INR 2 to 4 days after the bolus of mythyl-prednisolone or in the presence of signs of hemorrhage

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: With the methylprednisolone administered by IV route: possible increase of the blood concentrations of ciclosporin and of the creatinemia Mecanism proposed: decrease of the hepatic elimination of the ciclosporin
With the patient having heart failure, risk of increase of the undesirable effects of the metoprolol due to decrease of its hepatic metabolism by the abiraterone.
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Clinical monitoring. If needed, adjustment of the dosage of the metropolol during the treatment with the abiraterone

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: With the metoprolol used for heart failure: risk of increase of the undesirable effects of the metoprolol due to decrease of its hepatic metabolism by the bupropion
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Clinical monitoring. If needed, adjustment of the dosage of the metoprolol during the treatment with the bupropion

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: With the metoprolol used for heart failure, and the cimetidine used at dosages greater than or equal to 800 mg/day: increase of the concentrations of the metoprolol, which can be dangerous in the case of treatment for heart failure, due to decrease of its hepatic metabolism by the cimetadine
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Use another H2receptor antagonist

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Increase of the plasma concentrations of metoprolol with risk of overdose, due to decrease of its hepatic metabolism by the cinacalcet
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Clinical monitoring and reduction of the dosage of the metopolol during the treatment with cinacalcet.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Increase of the plasma concentrations of the metoprolol, with risk of overdose, due to decrease of its hepatic metabolism by the darifenacin
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Clinical monitoring and reduction of the dosage of the metoprolol during the treatment with darifenacin.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Increase of the plasma concentrations of metoprolol with risk of overdose, due to decrease of its hepatic metabolism by the duloxetine
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Clinical monitoring and reduction of the dosage of the metoprolol during the treatment with the duloxetine and after it is stopped.

Risk of increase of the undesirable effects of the metoprolol, with notably excessive bradycardia, due to inhibition of its metabolism by the paroxetine

Decrease of the plasma concentrations and of the effectiveness of the beta-blocking agent (increase of its hepatic metabolism)
With the patient having heart failure, risk of increase of the undesirable effects of the metoprolol, due to decrease of its hepatic metabolism by the terbinafine

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Decrease of the plasma concentrations of the metronidazole due to increase of its hepatic metabolism by the inducer

Risk of episodes of acute psychosis or of confused state, reversible upon stopping the administration of the two substances together

With the amphotericin B administered intravenously:
greater increase of the creatinemia than with ciclosporin alone (synergy of the nephrotoxic effects of the two substances).
With the amphotericin B administered by IV route: greater increase of the creatinemia than with tacrolimus alone (synergy of the nephrotoxic effects of the two substances).

With the amphotericin B administered intravenously:
increase of the hematological toxicity (addition of effects of bone marrow toxicity)

Risk of decrease of the plasma concentrations and of the effectiveness of the anticonvulsant

Increase of the theophyllinemia with risk of overdose (decrease of the metabolism of the theophylline)
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Clinical monitoring and possibly monitoring of the theophyllinemia.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Increased risk of peripheral neuropathy
Risk of increase of the toxicity of the pemetrexed (decrease of its renal clearance by the acetylsalicylic acid in anti-inflammatory doses).
INTERACTION.COMMENT: -with patients having weak to moderate renal function (clearance of the creatinine between 45 ml/min and 80 ml/min).

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Risk of increase of the toxicity of the pemetrexed (decrease of its renal clearance by the NSAIs)
INTERACTION.COMMENT: with patients having weak to moderate renal function (clearance of the creatinine between 45 ml/min and 80 ml.min)

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Risk of onset of convulsive crises, due to rapid decrease of the plasma concentrations of the valproic acid, that can become undetectable.
Decrease of the digestive absorption of the penicillamine
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Take the iron salts at a different time from the penicillamine (more than 2 hours apart if possible).

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Increase of the effects and of the hematological toxicity of the methothrexate: inhibition of the renal tubular secretion of the methotrexate by the penicillins
Increased risk of cutaneous reactions
Decrease of the concentrations of the mycophenolic acid by about a third, with potential risk of reduction of effectiveness
Increased risk of onset of pancreatitis due to addition of undesirable effects
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Monitoring of the blood amylase level. Do not use these two medications together if the blood amylase level is at the high range of normal.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Risk of severe hypocalcemia
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Monitoring of the calcemia and supplementation if necessary.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Increased risk of onset of peripheral neuropathy due to addition of undesirable effects
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Regular clinical monitoring and laboratory tests, especially at the beginning of the administration of these substances together

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Increased risk of peripheral neuropathy due to addition of undesirable effects
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Regular clinical monitoring and laboratory tests, especially at the beginning of the administration of these substances together

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Decrease of the antalgic effect due to competitive blocking of the receptors, with risk of appearance of a withdrawal syndrome
Risk of decrease of the antalgic effect
Increase of the plasma concentrations of carbamazepine with signs of overdose
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Clinical monitoring, and, if needed, testing of the plasma concentrations of carbamazepine and possible reduction of its dosage.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Decrease of the lithemia with risk of reduction of the therapeutic effectiveness
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Strict monitoring of the lithemia and possible adjustment of the dosage of the lithium.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Increase of the risk of pulmonary toxicity which could be fatal
Increase of the risk of pulmonary toxicity which could be fatal
Increase of the hemorrhagic risk
INTERACTION.COMMENT: More frequent testing of the INR. Possible adjustment of the dosage of the vitamin K antagonist during the treatment with the pentoxifylline and a week after it is stopped.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Increase of the theophyllinemia with risk of overdose (competition at the level of the hepatic metabolism of the theophylline)
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Clinical monitoring and possibly monitoring of the theophyllinemia; if there is reason for it, adjustment of the dosage of the theophylline during the treatment with the pentoxifylline and after it is stopped.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Large decrease (up to two thirds) of the concentrations of perampanel
Decrease by half of the concentrations of perampanel and slight increase of those of the oxcarbazepine.
For doses of perampanel >=12 mg/day: Risk of decrease of the contraceptive effectiveness
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Another method of contraception, in particular a barrier method or IUD, should be used.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Large decrease (up to two thirds) of the concentrations of perampanel
Risk of appearance of a serotonin syndrome: diarrhea, tachycardia, sweats, trembling, confusion, even coma

CLASS.name: REVERSIBLE MAOI-A, INCLUDING LINEZOLIDE AND METHYLENE BLUE

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Risk of appearance of a serotonin syndrome: diarrhea, tachycardia, sweats, trembling, confusion, even coma.
Symptoms of central nervous system excitability, evoking a serotonin syndrome: diarrhea, tachycardia, sweats, trembling, confusion, even coma
Antagonist effect of the phenobarbital
Progressive decrease of the plasma concentrations of carbamazepine and of its active metabolite without apparent modification of its anticonvulsive effectiveness
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Use prudence with respect to the interpretation of the plasma concentrations.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Decrease of the plasma concentrations and of the effectiveness of the digotoxin (increase of its hepatic metabolism)
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Clinical monitoring, EKG, and, possibly, monitoring of the digitoxinemia. If there is reason for it, adjustment of the dosage of the digitoxin during the administration of these substances together and after the phenobarbital is stopped, or choose digoxin, less metabolized by the liver.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Decrease of the plasma concentrations and of the effectiveness of the felbamate and increase of the plasma concentrations of the phenobarbital, with risk of overdose.
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Clinical monitoring and testing of the plasma concentrations of phenobarbital with adjustment of the dosage if needed.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Decrease of the plasma concentrations of the phenobarbital, due to increase of its metabolism of which the folates represent one of the cofactors
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Clinical monitoring, testing of the plasma concentrations, and adjustment, if there is reason for it, of the dosage of the phenobarbital during the folic supplementation and after it is stopped.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Risk of increase of the neurotoxicity of the ifosfamide due to increase of its hepatic metabolism by the phenobarbital
Decrease of the plasma concentrations of the metoprolol with reduction of its clinical effects (increase of its hepatic metabolism)

In cases of previous treatment with the phenobarbital or the primidone, and the addition of phenytoin, increase of the plasma concentrations of phenobarbital that can lead to toxic signs (inhibition of the metabolism by competition)
In cases of previous treatment with the pheyntoin and the addition of phenobarbital or of primidone, unpredictable changes:
--the plasma concentrations of phenytoin are most often decreased (increase of the metabolism) without this decrease affecting the anticonvulsant activity unfavorably. When the phenobarbital or the primidone is stopped, possibility of toxic effects of the phenytoin.
--it can happen that the concentrations of phenytoin are increased (inhibition of the metabolism due to competition)
Decrease of the plasma concentrations of the propranolol with reduction of its clinical effects (increase of its hepatic metabolism)

Increase of the plasma concentrations of the phenobarbital, with signs of overdose, due to inhibition of the hepatic metabolism, most often with children. In addition, decrease of the plasma concentrations of valproic acid due to increase of its hepatic metabolism by the phenobarbital
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Clinical monitoring during the first two weeks of the administration of these substances together and immediate reduction of the doses of phenobarbital at the appearance of the signs of sedation, test especially the plasma concentrations of the two anticonvulsants.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: For all the forms of phenylbutazone, including topical: increase of the risk of hemorrhage (inhibition of the platelet function and irritation of the gastroduodenal mucosa by the NSAI)
For all the forms of phenylbutazone, including topical: increase of the risk of aplastic anemia.
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Another NSAI that is less interactive should be used.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: For all the forms of phenylbutazone, including topical: increase of the hypoglycemic effect of the sulfonamides due to decrease of their hepatic metabolism
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Another anti-inflammatory that is less interactive should be used: if not, inform the patient and reinforce self-monitoring of blood glucose; possibly adjust the dosage during the treatment with the anti-inflammatory and after it is stopped.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Increase of the plasma concentrations of the phenytoin with signs of overdose, in particular neurological ones (decrease of the hepatic metabolism of the phenytoin)
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Clinical monitoring, testing of plasma concentrations of phenytoin, and possible adjustment of its dosage

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Reciprocal reduction of the plasma concentrations (increase of the metabolism without apparent modification of the anticonvulsive effectiveness)
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Use prudence in the interpretation of the plasma concentrations.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: With the cimetidine used in doses greater than or equal to 800 mg/day: increase of the plasma concentrations of phenytoin with the possibility of appearance of the usual signs of overdose
INTERACTION.COMMENT: If administering the substances together cannot be avoided, strict clinical monitoring, plasma concentration dosages of phenytoin, and possible adjustment of its dosage during the treatment with the cimetidine and after it is stopped.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Variation, possibly large, of the concentrations of phenytoin in the case of treatment with the ciprofloxacin
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Clinical monitoring and testing of the plasma concentrations of the anticonvulsant during the treatment with ciprofloacin and after it is stopped.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Increase of the plasma concentrations of phenytoin with signs of overdose (inhibition of the metabolism of the phenytoin)
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Clinical monitoring and testing of the plasma concentrations of phenytoin.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Risk of ineffectiveness of the antipsychotic treatment (decrease of the plasma concentrations of clozapine due to increase of its hepatic metabolism)
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Clinical monitoring and possible increase of the dosage of the clozapine during the treatment with the phenytoin.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Risk of onset of convulsions due to decrease of the digestive absorption of the phenytoin only [not the fosphenytoin] by the cytotoxic, or risk of increase of the toxicity or loss of the effectiveness of the cytotoxic due to the increase of its hepatic metabolism by the phenytoin or the fosphenytoin
Unpredictable variations: the plasma concentrations of phenytoin can increase, with signs of overdose, but also decrease or remain stable.
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Clinical monitoring and testing of the plasma concentrations of phenytoin.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Large and rapid increase of the plasma concentrations of phenytoin with signs of toxicity (inhibition of its metabolism)
INTERACTION.COMMENT: If the administration of these substances together cannot be avoided, clinical monitoring and monitoring of the plasma concentrations of phentoin during the treatment with the disulfiram and after it is stopped.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Increase of the plasma concentrations of phenytoin with risk of overdose, due to inhibition of its metabolism by the felbamate
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Clinical monitoring, testing of the plasma concentrations of phentoin, and if needed adjustment of its dosage during the treatment with the felbamate.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Increase of the plasma concentrations of phenytoin that can reach toxic values. Mechanism proposed: inhibition of the hepatic metabolism of the phenytoin
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Strict clinical monitoring and laboratory tests.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Increase of the plasma concentrations of phenytoin with signs of overdose, due to inhibition of the metabolism of the phenytoin
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Clinical monitoring and possibly testing of the plasma concentrations of phenytoin. If needed, adjustment of the dosage during the treatment with fluoxetine and after it is stopped.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Increase of the plasma concentrations of phenytoin with signs of overdosage, due to inhibition of the hepatic metabolism of the phenytoin.
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Cinical monitoring and possibly testing of the plasmatic concentrations of phenytoin. If needed, adjustment of the dosage of the phenytoin during the treatment with the fluvoxamine and after it is stopped.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Decrease of the plasma concentrations of phenytoin due to increase of its metabolism of which the folates represent one of the cofactors
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Clinical monitoring and testing of the plasma concentrations of phenytoin. Possible adjustment of the dosage of the phenytoin during the folic supplementation and after it is stopped.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Decrease of the diuretic effect which can reach 50%
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Possibly use higher doses of furosemide.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Overdose of phenytoin (decrease of its metabolism)
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Strict clinical monitoring, plasma concentration dosage of phenytoin and possible adjustment of its dosage during the treatment with the isoniazid and after it is stopped.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Risk of false negative results of the test with metyrapone, due to a decrease of its plasma concentrations, because of the increase of its hepatic metabolism by the phenytoin.
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Double the dosage of the metyrapone.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Decrease of the antiarrythmic activity, of the plasma concentrations, and of the half life of the mexiletine (increase of its hepatic metabolism)
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Clinical monitoring, EKG, and, possibly monitoring of the plasma concentrations of the mexiletine; if there is reason for it, adjustment of the dosage of the mexiletine during the treatment with the phenytoin and after it is stopped.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Increase of the plasma concentrations of phenytoin which can reach toxic values. Mechanism proposed: inhibition of the hepatic metabolism of the phenytoin.
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Strict clinical monitoring.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Risk of decrease of the plasma concentrations of the phenytoin due to increase of its hepatic metabolism by the nelfinavir
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Clinical monitoring and laboratory tests. Possible adjustment of the dosage of the phenytoin during the treatment with nelfinavir.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION:
In cases of previous treatment with the phenobarbital or the primidone, and the addition of phenytoin, increase of the plasma concentrations of phenobarbital that can lead to toxic signs (inhibition of the metabolism by competition)
In cases of previous treatment with the phenytoin and the addition of phenobarbital or of primidone, unpredictable changes:
--the plasma concentrations of phenytoin are most often decreased (increase of the metabolism) without this decrease affecting the anticonvulsant activity unfavorably. When the phenobarbital or the primidone is stopped, possibility of toxic effects of the phenytoin.
--it can happen that the concentrations of phenytoin are increased (inhibition of the metabolism due to competition)
Decrease of the digestive absorption of the phenytoin.
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Take the sucralfate at a different time from the phenytoin (more than 2 hours apart if possible).

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Increase of the plasma concentrations of phenytoin up to toxic values (inhibition of its metabolism)
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Another class of anti-infective should be used; if not, strict clinical monitoring, concentration dosage of phenytoin, and possible adjustment of its dosage during the treatment with the sulfonamide antibiotic and after it is stopped.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Increase of the plasma concentrations of phenytoin up to toxic values (inhibition of its metabolism)
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Another class of antibiotic should be used; if not, strict clinical monitoring, concentration dosage of phenytoin, and possible adjustment of its dosage during the treatment with the sulfonamide antibiotic and after it is stopped.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Increase of the plasma concentrations of phenytoin up to toxic values (inhibition of its metabolism).
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Another class of antibiotic should be used; if not, strict clinical monitoring, concentration dosage of phenytoin, and possible adjustment of its dosage during the treatment with the sulfonamide antibiotic and after it is stopped.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Increase of the plasma concentrations of phenytoin with signs of overdose (inhibition of the metabolism of the phenytoin).
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Clinical monitoring and testing of the plasma concentrations of phenytoin.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Variation of the plasma concentrations of phenytoin. In addition, risk of decrease of the plasma concentrations of valproic acid due to increase of its hepatic metabolism by the phenytoin.
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Clinical monitoring, plasma dosages, and possible adjustment of the dosage of the two anticonvulsants.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Risk of addition of the undesirable cholinergic effects, especially digestive
Increased risk of ventricular arrhythmias, especially of torsades de pointes
Increased risk of ventricular arrhythmias, especially of torsades de pointes
Increased risk of ventricular arrhythmias, especially of torsades de pointes
Increased risk of ventricular arrhythmias, especially of torsades de pointes
Increased risk of ventricular arrhythmias, especially of torsades de pointes
Increased risk of ventricular arrhythmias, especially of torsades de pointes
Increased risk of ventricular arrhythmias, especially of torsades de pointes
Increased risk of ventricular arrhythmias, especially of torsades de pointes
Increase of the plasma concentrations of the pimozide due to decrease of its hepatic metabolism by the combination ombitasvir + paritaprevir
Increased risk of ventricular arrhythmias, especially of torsades de pointes
Increased risk of ventricular arrhythmias, especially of torsades de pointes
Increased risk of ventricular arrhythmias, especially of torsades de pointes
Increased risk of ventricular arrhythmias, especially of torsades de pointes
Increased risk of ventricular arrhythmias, especially of torsades de pointes (inhibition of the hepatic metabolism of the medication that tends to produce torsades de pointes).
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Wait 24 hours between the end of the triclabendazole and the administration of the medication that tends to produce torsades de pointes and vice versa.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Decrease of the antalgic effect due to competitive blocking of the receptors, with risk of appearance of a withdrawal syndrome
Risk of decrease of the antalgic effect
Increase of the plasma concentrations of pirfenidone with signs of overdose
Increased risk of undesirable effects (concentration-dependant) of the rhabdomyolysis type, or of nephrotoxicity, due to decrease of the metabolism of the pitavastatin

Addition of the nephrotoxic effects
.
INTERACTION.COMMENT: If administering these substances together cannot be avoided, strict monitoring with an indisputable bacteriological justification

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Increase of the effects of the curares when the antibiotic is administered by parenteral and/or peritoneal route before, during, or after the curarizing agent.
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Monitor the degree of curarization at the end of anesthesia

CLASS.name: VASOCONSTRICTOR ALKALOIDS OF ERGOT OF RYE

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Risk of constriction of coronary blood vessels or those of the extremities (ergotism), or of rapid elevation of blood pressure
Decrease of the plasma concentrations and of the effectiveness of the posaconazole
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Clinical monitoring. If possible, plasma dosages of the posaconazole and possible adjustment of its dosage.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Decrease of the absorption of the azole antifungal due to increase of the gastric pH by the H2 receptor antagonist
Decrease of the absorption of the azole antifungal, due to increase of the gastric pH by the inhibitor
Increased risk of undesirable effects (concentration-dependant) of the rhabodmyolysis type (decrease of the hepatic metabolism of the HMG-CoA reductase inhibitor)
Increase of the concentrations of darifenacin, with risk of increase of its undesirable effects
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Clinical monitoring and possible adjustment of the dosage of darifenacin.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Increase of the plasma concentrations of the dexamethasone due to decrease of its hepatic metabolism by the enzyme inhibitor, with risk of appearance of Cushing's syndrome
Increase of the digoxinemia with nausea, vomiting, arrhythmias.
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Clinical monitoring, and, if there is reason for them, EKG and monitoring of the digoxinemia, with adjustment of the dosage of the digoxin during the treatment with the posaconazole and after it is stopped.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Very large increase of the blood concentrations of the immunosuppressant due to inhibition of its hepatic metabolism
INTERACTION.COMMENT: If these medications are administered together, strict testing of renal function, blood concentration dosages of the immunosuppressant, and possible adjustment of the dosage.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Risk of increase of the undesirable effects of the rifabutin (uveitis), due to increase of its concentrations and of those of its active metabolite
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Regular clinical monitoring and laboratory tests, especially at the beginning of the administration of the medications together.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Decrease of the plasma concentrations and of the effectiveness of the two anti-infectives (enzymatic induction by the rifampicin and decrease of the intestinal absorption by the azole antifungal)
Increased risk of undesirable effects (concentration-dependent) of the rhabdomyolysis type (decrease of the hepatic metabolism of the HMG-CoA reductase inhibitor)
Increase of the concentrations of solifenacin, with risk of overdose
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Clinical monitoring and possible adjustment of the dosage of solifenacin.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Increase of the neurotoxicity of the antimitotic, due to decrease of its hepatic metabolism by the posaconazole

CLASS.name: ANGIOTENSIN II RECEPTOR ANTAGONISTS or ANGIOTENSIN RECEPTOR BLOCKERS (ARBs)

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Hyperkalemia (potentially lethal) especially when there is renal insufficiency (addition of the hyperkalemia inducing effects).
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Avoid administering these substances together unless there is pre-existing hypokalemia.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Potentially lethal hyperkalemia, especially when there is renal insufficiency (addition of the hyperkalemia inducing effects)
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Avoid the administration of these two substances together unless there is a pre-existing hypokalemia.

CLASS.name: POTASSIUM SPARING DIURETICS (ALONE OR IN COMBINATION)

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Potentially lethal hyperkalemia, especially with renal insufficiency (addition of the hyperkaliemia producing effects)
INTERACTION.COMMENT: -aside from hypokalemia or in case of parenteral use of the potassium salts

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Hyperkalemia (potentially lethal) especially when there is renal insufficiency (addition of the hyperkalemia inducing effects)
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Unless there is hypokalemia.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Essentially lethal hyperkalemia, especially when there is renal insufficiency (addition of the hyperkalemia producing effects)
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Avoid administering these substances together unless there is a preexisting hypokalemia.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Erythema, blisters, even necrosis of skin and mucosa (formation of a caustic complex in the case of concomitant use of mercurials and iodine antiseptics). The interaction depends on the stability of the organo-mercurial at the cutaneous level and on individual sensitivity.
Increase of the plasma concentration of the pravastatin by the clarithromycin
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Clinical monitoring and laboratory tests during the treatment with the antibiotic

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: With the erythromycin administered by oral route: increase of the plasma concentration of the pravastatin by the erythromycin
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Clinical monitoring and laboratory tests during the treatment with the antibiotic.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Very large decrease of the plasma concentrations of the praziquantel, with risk of failure of the treatment due to increase of its hepatic metabolism by the inducer
Decrease of the plasma concentrations of the praziquantel, with risk of failure of the treatment, due to increase of the hepatic metabolism of the praziquantel by the dexamethasone.
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Separate the administration of the two medications by at least a week.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Very large decrease of the plasma concentrations of the praziquantal, with risk of failure of the treatment, due to increase of the hepatic metabolism of the praziquantel by the rifampicin
Increase of the effects of the prednisolone: characteristic Cushing's appearance, reduction of tolerance of carbohydrates (decrease of the clearance of the prednisolone)
Risk of rupture of the condom when used with lubricants containing mineral oils (paraffin oil, silicone oil, etc...)
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Use a hydrosoluble lubricant (glycerin, polyacrylamide...).

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION:
Risk of hypoglycemia or hyperglycemia:
decrease or increase of the needs for glitazone due to decrease or increase of the secretion of endogenous glucagon
.
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Strengthen self- monitoring of blood glucose and adjust the dosage of the glitazone if needed during the treatment with the somatostatin analog.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION:
With the ciclosporin administered orally:
reduction of the blood concentrations of ciclosporin (decrease of its intestinal absorption).
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Increase the doses of ciclosporin according to testing of the plasma concentrations and reduction of the dosage after the treatment with the somatostatin analogue is stopped.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION:
Risk of hypoglycemia or hyperglycemia:
decrease or increase of the needs for insulin, due to decrease or increase of the secretion of endogenous glucagon
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Inform the patient of the risk of hypoglycemia or hyperclycemia, strengthen self- monitoring of blood glucose, and adjust the dosage of insulin if needed during the treatment with the somatostatin analog.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION:
Risk of hypoglycemia or hyperglycemia:
decrease or increase of the needs for repaglinde due to decrease or increase of the secretion of endogenous glucagon .
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Strengthen self-monitoring of blood glucose, and adjust the dosage of the repaglinide if needed during the treatment with the somatostatin analog.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION:
Risk of hypoglycemia or hyperglycemia:
decrease or increase of the needs for the blood glucose lowering sufonamide, due to decrease or increase of the secretion of endogenous glucagon
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Strengthen self-monitoring of blood glucose, and adjust the dosage of the sulfonamide if needed during the treatment with the somatostatin analog.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Increase of the effect of the vitamin K antagonist and of the risk of hemorrhage
INTERACTION.COMMENT: More frequent testing of the INR. Possible adjustment of the dosage of the vitamin K antagonist during the treatment with the pristinamycin and after it is stopped

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Increase of the undesirable effects of the colchicine with potentially fatal consequences
Increase of the blood concentrations of the immunosuppressant due to inhibition of its hepatic metabolism
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Blood concentration dosage of the immunosuppressant, testing of renal function, and adjustment of its dosage during the administration of the medications together and after it is stopped.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Risk of overdose due to increase of the plasma concentrations of diprophylline (inhibition of its renal tubular secretion)
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Reduce the dosage of diprophylline during the treatment with the probenicid

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Increase of the toxicity of the methotrexate: inhibition of the renal tubular secretion of the methotrexate by the probenecid
Increase of the hypersensitivity reactions (hypereosinophilia, rash), due to increase of the metabolism of the procarbazine by the inducer

Increase of the risk of reaction to the contrast media in cases of previous treatment with interleukin2:
skin rash or more rarely low blood pressure, oliguria, or even renal failure
In case of dehydration caused by the diuretics, increased risk of acute functional renal insufficiency, in particular when large doses of the contrast media are used
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Rehydrate before administration of the iodinated product

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Lactic acidosis linked to elevated concentrations of metformin in relation to functional renal insufficiency induced by the radiological exam.
INTERACTION.COMMENT: The treatment with metformin should be suspended at the time of the radiological exam and only started again 2 days later.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: (Except IUD), decrease of the progestin, with risk of lower contraceptive effectiveness
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Use another method of contraception, in particular a barrier method or IUD, during the length of time that these are administered togetherand one cycle after.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Aside from the combination ethinylestradiol (0.035mg)/norethisterone (1 mg), risk of decrease of the contraceptive effectiveness due to increase of the hepatic metabolism of the hormonal contraceptive by the boceprevir
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Use an additional or alternative, reliable contraceptive method during the administration of these medications together.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Risk of decrease of the effectiveness of the hormonal contraceptive due to increase of its hepatic metabolism
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Use an additional or alternative, reliable contraceptive method during the administration of these medications together and a cycle after.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Risk of decrease of the effectiveness of the hormonal contraceptive due to increase of its hepatic metabolism
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Use an additional or alternative, reliable contraceptive method during the administration of these medications together and a cycle after.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Decrease of the contraceptive effectiveness of the hormonal contraceptive, due to increase of its metabolism by the inducer
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Use an additional or alternative, reliable contraceptive method, in particular a barrier type, during the administration of these medications together and a cycle after.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Risk of decrease of the contraceptive effectiveness because of decrease of the concentrations of hormonal contraceptive, due to the increase of its hepatic metabolism by the ritonavir
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Another method of contraception, in particular a condom or IUD, should be used during the time the substances are administered together and one cycle following.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Decrease of the plasma concentrations of the hormonal contraceptive, by reason of the enzymatic inducer effect of the St Johns wort, with risk of reduction of effectiveness, even complete loss of the effect, which can have possibly serious consequences (pregnancy)
Risk of decrease of the contraceptive effectiveness due to decrease of the concentrations of hormonal contraceptive
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Another contraceptive method, in particular of the barrier type (condom or IUD), should be used during the length of the administration of the substances together and one cycle following.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: For doses of perampanel >=12 mg/day: Risk of decrease of the contraceptive effectiveness
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Another method of contraception, in particular a barrier method or IUD, should be used.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Risk of antagonism of the effects of the progestin contraceptive
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Do not restart the progestin contraceptive treatment fewer than 12 days after stopping the ulipristal.

CLASS.name: NON-CONTRACEPTIVE PROGESTOGENS, COMBINED WITH AN ESTROGEN OR NOT

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Decrease of the effectiveness of the progestogen
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Clinical monitoring and possible adjustment of the dosage of the hormonal treatment during the administration of the anticonvulsant inducer and after it is stopped.

CLASS.name: NON-CONTRACEPTIVE PROGESTOGENS, COMBINED WITH AN ESTROGEN OR NOT

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Risk of antagonism of the effects of the progestogen
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Do not restart a progestogen treatment fewer than 12 days after stopping the ulipristal.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Risk of increase of the effect of the vitamin K antagonist and of the risk of hemorrhage
INTERACTION.COMMENT: More frequent testing of the INR. Possible adjustment of the dosage of the vitamin K antagonist during the treatment with the proguanil and after it is stopped.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Risk of clinically low thyroid with patients having thyroid replacement therapy
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Monitoring of the serum concentrations of T3 and T4 and adjustment, if needed, of the dosage of the thyroid hormone during the treatment with the antimalarial and after it is stopped.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Risk of increase of the undesirable effects of the propafenone, due to decrease of its hepatic metabolism by the abiraterone
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Clinical monitoring. If needed, adjustment of the dosage of the propafenone during the treatment with the abiraterone

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Decrease of the plasma concentrations of the propafenone due to increase of its hepatic metabolism by the inducer
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Clinical monitoring and EKG. If there is reason for it, adjustment of the dosage of the propafenone during the administration of it and the inducer together and after the inducer is stopped.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Increase of the anticoagulant effect and of the risk of hemorrhage. Mechanism proposed: inhibition of the metabolism of the vitamin K antagonist
INTERACTION.COMMENT: More frequent testing of the INR. Possible adjustment of the dosage of the vitamin K antagonist during the treatment with the propafenone and after it is stopped.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Disorders of contractility, autoregulation, and conduction (suppression of the compensatory sympathetic mechanisms)
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Clinical monitoring and EKG.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Risk of increase of the undesirable effects of the propafenone due to decrease of its hepatic metabolism by the bupropion
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Clinical monitoring. If needed, adjustment of the dosage of the propafenone during the treatment with the bupropion.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Increase of the plasma concentrations of propafenone with risk of overdose, due to decrease of its hepatic metabolism by the cinacalcet
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Clinical monitoring and reduction of the dosage of the propafenone during the treatment with cinacalcet.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Increase of the plasma concentrations of propafenone, with risk of overdose, due to decrease of its hepatic metabolism by the darifenacin
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Clinical monitoring and reduction of the dosage of the propafenone during the treatment with darifenacin.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Risk of increase of the digoxinemia, especially with older patients
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Clinical monitoring and possibly monitoring of the digoxinemia during the treatment with propafenone and after it is stopped.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Increase of the plasma concentrations of propafenone with risk of overdosage due to decrease of its hepatic metabolism by the duloxetine
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Clinical monitoring and reduction of the dosage of the propafenone during the treatment with the duloxetine and after it is stopped.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Disorders of contractility, autoregulation and conduction (suppression of the compensatory sympathetic mechanisms)
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Clinical monitoring and EKG.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Decrease of the plasma concentrations of the propafenone due to increase of its hepatic metabolism by the St Johns wort
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Clinical monitoring and EKG. If there is reason for it, adjustment of the dosage of the propafenone during the time the substances are administered together and after the St Johns wort is stopped.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Decrease of the plasma concentrations of the propafanone, due to increase of its hepatic metabolism by the rifampicin
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Clinical monitoring and EKG. If there is reason for it, adjustment of the dosage of the propafenone during the administration of the substances together and after the rifampicin is stopped.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Risk of increase of the undesirable effects of the propafenone, due to decrease of its hepatic metabolism by the terbinafine
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Clinical monitoring. If needed, adjustment of the dosage of the propafenone during the treatment with the terbinafine.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Risk of increase of the theophyllinemia due to decrease of its hepatic metabolism by the propafenone.
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Clinical monitoring and possibly monitoring of the theophyllinemia.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Ergotism: some cases of arterial spasm with ischemia of the extremities have been observed (addition of vascular effects)
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Reinforce clinical monitoring, in particular during the first weeks of the administration of these medications together.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Increase of the plasma concentrations of propranolol due to inhibition of its hepatic metabolism, with increase of the activity and of the undesirable effects, for example: significant bradycardia
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Increased clinical monitoring, and, if needed, adjustment of the dosage of the propranolol during the treatment with the fluvoxamine and after it is stopped.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Decrease of the plasma concentrations of the propranolol with reduction of its clinical effects (increase of its hepatic metabolism)
Decrease of the plasma concentrations and of the effectiveness of the beta-blocking agent (increase of its hepatic metabolism)
Addition of the hepatotoxic effects.
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Clinical monitoring and laboratory tests.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Increase of the risk of hemorrhage due to the direct effect on coagulation and/or the fibrinolytic systems.
INTERACTION.COMMENT: More frequent testing of the INR. Adjustment of the dosage of the Vitamin K antagonist during the treatment with the androgen and after it is stopped.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Risk of decrease of the plasma concentrations of the androgen and consequently of its effectiveness, due to increase of its hepatic metabolism by the inducer
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Clinical monitoring and laboratory tests during the administration of these substances together and 1 to 2 weeks after the inducer is stopped.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Megaloblastic anemia, more particularly with large doses of the two products (deficit of folic acid due to the combination of two 2-4 diaminopyrimidines)
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Regular CBC and addition of a treatment with folic acid (regular IM injections).

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Very large decrease of the plasma concentrations of quetiapine due to increase of its hepatic metabolism by the inducer, with risk of ineffectiveness.
Large increase of the concentrations of quetiapine, with risk of overdose
Very large decrease of the plasma concentrations of quetiapine due to increase of its hepatic metabolism by the inducer, with risk of ineffectiveness
Increase of the plasma concentrations of the quetiapine due to decrease of its hepatic metabolism by the ombitasvir+paritaprevir combination
Very large decrease of the plasma concentrations of quetiapine due to increase of its hepatic metabolism by the inducer, with risk of ineffectiveness.
Increase of the plasma concentrations of the quinidine and risk of overdose (decrease of the renal excretion of the quinidine by alkalinizing of the urine).
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Clinical monitoring, EKG, and possibly testing of the quinidinemia; if there is reason for it, adjustment of the dosage during the alkalinizing treatment and after it is stopped.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Increase of the plasma concentrations of aliskiren and increase of the risk of its undesirable effects.
Risk of increase of the undesirable effects of the atomoxetine, due to substantial decrease of its hepatic metabolism
INTERACTION.COMMENT: If administering the two substances together cannot be avoided, clinical monitoring and adjustment of the dosage of the atomoxetine during the treatment with the inhibitor and after it is stopped

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Risk of increase of the undesirable effects of the quinidine due to decrease of its metabolism by the cobicistat
Increase of the plasma concentrations of dabigatran, with increase of the risk of bleeding
INTERACTION.COMMENT: In a post surgical indication: clinical monitoring and adjustment of the dosage of the dabigatran to 150 mg/day in one dose.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Increase of the digoxinemia due to decrease of the renal clearance of the digoxin. In addition, disorders of autoregulation (excessive bradycardia and disorders of atrioventricular conduction)
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Clinical monitoring and EKG. In the case of an unexpected result, test the digoxinemia and adjust the dosage.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Risk of bradycardia or of atrioventricular block especially with older patients. Furthermore, slight increase of the concentrations of dronedarone due to decrease of its metabolism by the quinidine
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Start the treatment with quinidine at minimum recommended dosages, and adjust the doses according to the EKG.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Increased risk of ventricular arrhythmias, especially of torsades de pointes

Increased risk of ventricular arrhythmias, especially of torsades de pointes, as well as tinnitis and/or decrease of auditory acuity (cinchonism), due to decrease of the hepatic metabolism of the quinidine
INTERACTION.COMMENT: If administering the two substances together cannot be avoided, strict clinical monitoring and EKG.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Increase of the plasma concentrations of the quidinine due to decrease of its hepatic metabolism by the ombitasvir+paritaprevir combination
Increased risk of ventricular arrhythmias, especially of torsades de pointes
Risk of reduction of the effectiveness of the tamoxifen, due to inhibition of the formation of its active metabolite by the quinidine
Increased risk of ventricular arrhythmias, especially of torsades de pointes (inhibition of the hepatic metabolism of the torsade inducing medication)
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Wait 24 hours between stopping the triclabendazole and taking the torsade inducing medication, and the reverse.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Risk of large increase of the hemodynamic effects of the verapamil, with severe hypotension and bradycardia
Increased risk of ventricular arrhythmias, especially of torsades de pointes
Risk of loss of the effectiveness of the quinine due to increase of its hepatic metabolism by the inducer.
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Clinical monitoring and adjustment of the dosage of the quinine during the treatment with the inducer and after it is stopped.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Moderate increase of the digoxinemia
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Clinical monitoring and EKG, if needed, with possible adjustment of the doses of digoxin.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Risk of increase of the undesirable effects of the quinine, especially ventricular arrhythmias and neurosensory difficulties (cinchonism)
INTERACTION.COMMENT: -with the protease inhibitors

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: For the quinine administered by IV route: increased risk of onset of epileptic crises due to addition of the convulsion producing effects
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Wait at least 12 hours between the end of the administration via IV of the quinine and the beginning of the administration of the mefloquine.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Risk of loss of the effectiveness of the quinine due to increase of its hepatic metabolism by the inducer
Ergotism with possibility of necrosis of the extremities (inhibition of the hepatic metabolism of the alkaloid of ergot of rye).
Ergotism with possibility of necrosis of the extremities (inhibition of the hepatic metabolism of the alkaloid of ergot of rye).
Increase of the blood concentrations of the immunosuppressant due to inhibition of its hepatic metabolism
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Blood concentration dosage of the immunosuppressant, testing of the renal function, and adjustment of the dosage during the administration of the substances together and after it is stopped.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Increased risk of ventricular arrhythmias, especially of torsades de pointes
Risk of increase of the undesirable effects of the angioedema type.
INTERACTION.COMMENT: -when there was previous angioedema with ACE inhibitors

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Decrease of the concentrations of the raltegravir by the rifampicin
INTERACTION.COMMENT: If administering these medications together cannot be avoided, doubling the dose of raltegravir can be considered

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Risk of large decrease of the concentrations of ranolazine
Increased risk of undesirable effects (concentration-dependant) of the rhabodmyolysis type due to inhibition of the metabolism of the atorvastatin by the ranolazine
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Use weaker doses of the cholesterol lowering agent or another statin not affected by this type of interaction.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Increase of the digoxinemia
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Clinical monitoring, laboratory tests, and, possibly EKG. Adjustment of the dosage of the digoxin if needed.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Increase of the blood concentrations of the immunosuppressant due to inhibition of its metabolism by the ranolazine
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Clinical monitoring, laboratory tests, and possible adjustment of the dosage of the immunosuppressant.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Increase of the concentrations of ranolazine due to decrease of its metabolism by the inhibitor
Very large decrease of the concentrations of ranolazine.
Increased risk of undesirable effects (concentration-dependent) of the rhabdomyolysis type due to inhibition of the metabolism of the simvastatin by the ranolazine
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Do not exceed the dosage of 20 mg/day of simvastatin or use another statin not affected by this type of interaction.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Increase of the plasma concentrations of regorafenib due to decrease of its hepatic metabolism by the grapefruit juice
Decrease of the plasma concentrations of regorafenib due to increase of its metabolism by the inducer
Increase of the plasma concentrations of regorafenib due to decrease of its hepatic metabolism by the inhibitor
Decrease of the plasma concentrations of regorafenib due to increase of its metabolism by the St Johns wort

Risk of hypoglycemia or hyperglycemia:
decrease or increase of the need for repaglinde due to decrease or increase of the secretion of endogenous glucagon .
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Strengthen self-monitoring of blood glucose, and adjust the dosage of the repaglinide if needed during the treatment with the somatostatin analog

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: The concentrations of repaglinide more than doubled due to increase of its absorption
Risk of hypoglycemia due to increase of the plasma concentrations of the repaglinide
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Inform the patient, reinforce self-monitoring of blood glucose, and possibly adjust the dosage of the blood glucose lowering agent during the treatment with the clarithromycin.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Risk of increase of the plasma concentrations of repaglinide, due to inhibition of its hepatic metabolism by the deferasirox
INTERACTION.COMMENT: If administering these medications together cannot be avoided, strict clinical monitoring and laboratory tests.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Risk of severe hypoglycemia, even coma, due to substantial increase of the plasma concentrations of repaglinide by the gemfibrozil
Risk of increase of the plasma concentrations of repaglinide due to inhibition of its hepatic metabolism by the trimethoprim
INTERACTION.COMMENT: If the administration of these together cannot be avoided, strict clinical monitoring and laboratory tests.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Serious ventricular arrhythmias due to increased cardiac sensitization
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Limit the amount of adrenaline, for example: less then 0.1 mg of adrenaline in 10 minutes or 0.3 mg per hour for an adult

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Reduction of the compensatory cardiovascular reactions by the beta blocking agents. The beta-andrenergic inhibition can be elevated by the beta-mimetics during surgery.
INTERACTION.COMMENT: As a general rule, do not stop the treatment with the beta-blocking agent and, in any event, avoid stopping it abruptly. Inform the anesthesiologist of this treatment.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Reduction of the compensatory cardiovascular reactions by the beta blocking agents. The beta-adrenergic inhibition can be elevated during the surgery by the beta-stimulants.
INTERACTION.COMMENT: As a general rule, do not stop the treatment with the beta blocking agent and, in any case, avoid stopping it abruptly. Inform the anesthesiologist of this treatment.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION:
Increase of the hepatotoxic effect of the isoniazid, with increased formation of its toxic metabolites.
.
INTERACTION.COMMENT: In case of a scheduled intervention, it is prudent to stop the treatment with the isoniazid a week before the surgery and only restart it two weeks after.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Serious ventricular arrhythmias due to increase of cardiac sensitization

CLASS.name: ALPHA AND BETA SYMPATHOMIMETICS (IM AND IV ROUTES)

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Serious ventricular arrhythmias due to increase of cardiac sensitization
Perioperative hypertension
INTERACTION.COMMENT: In the case of scheduled surgery, it is preferable to stop the treatment several days before surgery.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Psychomotor agitation, convulsions, hypertension
Inhibition of the effects of the levodopa
Taking chelating resins can decrease the intestinal absorption and, potentially, the effectiveness of other medications taken simultaneously
INTERACTION.COMMENT: As a general rule, the doses of the resin should be taken at a different time from that of other medications, at an interval of more than 2 hours apart, if possible

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Decrease of the digestive absorption of the thyroid hormones
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Take the thyroid hormones at a different time from the resin (more than 2 hours apart, if possible).

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Risk of symptoms evocative of hypervitaminosis A
Risk of intracranial hypertension
Risk of symptoms evocative of hypervitaminosis A
Increased risk of serious undesirable hematological effects due to inhibition of the metabolism of the azothioprine by the ribavirin
Risk of increase of the mitochrondrial toxicity of the didanosine due to increase of its active metabolite
Risk of decrease of the effectiveness of each antiviral, due to reciprocal inhibition of the phosphorylation reaction at the origin of the active metabolites
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Regular clinical monitoring and laboratory tests, especially at the beginning of the administration of the substances together.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Risk of decrease of the effectiveness of each antiviral, due to reciprocal inhibition of the phosphorylation reaction at the origin of the active metabolites
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Regular clinical monitoring and laboratory tests, especially at the beginning of the administration of the substances together.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Moderate decrease of the plasma concentrations of atovaquone by the enzymatic inducer

Risk of increase of the undesirable effects of the rifabutin (uveitis) due to increase of its concentrations and of those of its active metabolite by the clarithromycin. In addition, increase of the metabolism of the clarithromycin by the rifabutin, with increase of the concentrations of its active metabolite
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Regular clinical monitoring and laboratory tests, especially at the beginning of the administration of the two medications together.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Very large increase of the metabolite of the rifabutin, with risk of increase of its toxicity (uveitis, neutropenia). Furthermore, possible decrease of the concentrations of cobicistat
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Adjustment of the dosage of the rifabutin (in principle, reduction of the doses by half).

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Decrease by about half of the concentrations of rifabutin, due to increase of its hepatic metabolism by the efavirenz
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Adjustment of the dosage of the rifabutin during the treatment with efavirenz.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Decrease of the minimal concentrations of elvitegravir
Risk of increase of the undesirable effects of the rifabutin (uveitis), due to increase of its concentrations and of those of its active metabolite
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Regular clinical monitoring and laboratory tests, especially at the beginning of the treatment with the two medications together.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION:
Described for phenytoin, rifampicin, and carbamazepine.
Risk of clinical hypothyroidism in patients with low thyroid, due to increase of the metabolism of the T3 and T4
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Monitoring of serum concentrations of T3 and of T4 and adjustment, if needed, of the dosage of the thyroid hormones during the treatment with rifabutin and after it is stopped.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Risk of reduction of the effectiveness of the protease inhibitor (even more so when the dosage of the rifabutin is large) for one thing, and risk of increase of the undesirable effects (uveitis) of the rifabutin for another.
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Regular clinical monitoring and laboratory tests, especially at the beginning of the administration of the substances together.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Risk of increase of the undesirable effects of the rifabutin (uveitis), due to increase of its concentrations and of those of its active metabolite
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Regular clinical monitoring and laboratory tests, especially at the beginning of the administration of the medications together.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Decrease of the plasma concentrations of the voriconazole with risk of loss of effectiveness, due to increase of its hepatic metabolism by the rifabutin for one thing; and risk of increase of the undesirable effects (uveitis) of the rifabutin for another
INTERACTION.COMMENT: If the administration of these substances together is judged necessary, clinical monitoring and adjustment of the dosage of the voriconazole (generally doubled) during the treatment with the rifabutin.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Large decrease of the plasma concentrations of the abiraterone, with risk of lower effectiveness
Large decrease of the plasma concentrations of the albendazole and of its active metabolite by the inducer, with risk of reduction of its effectiveness
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Clinical monitoring of the therapeutic response and possible adjustment of the dosage of the albendazole during the treatment with the enzymatic inducer and after it is stopped.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Decrease of the plasma concentrations of the calcium channel blocker due to increase of its hepatic metabolism
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Precaution for use

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Decrease of the plasma concentrations and of the effectiveness of the antiarrythmic (increase of its hepatic metabolism).
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Clinical monitoring, EKG, and possibly monitoring of the plasma concentration of the antiarrythmic. If needed, adjustment of the dosage of the antiarrythmic during the treatment with the rifampicin and after it is stopped (risk of overdose of the antiarrythmic)

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Decrease of the plasma concentrations of the glitazone due to increase of its metabolism by the rifampicin
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Clinical monitoring and laboratory tests; adjustment of the dosage of the glitazone during the treatment with the rifampicin and after it is stopped.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Decrease of the effect of the vitamin K antagonist due to increase of its hepatic metabolism by the rifampicin.
INTERACTION.COMMENT: More frequent testing of the INR. Possible adjustment of the dosage of the vitamin K antagonist during the treatment with the rifampicin and a week after it is stopped.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Decrease of the plasma concentrations of the apixaban by the rifampicin, with risk of decrease of the therapeutic effect.
Very large decrease of the concentrations of aprepitant
Very large decrease of the plasma concentrations of atorvastastatin, due to increase of its hepatic metabolism by the rifampicin
Decrease of the plasma concentrations of atorvaquone by the enzymatic inducer
Risk of decrease of the plasma concentrations of boceprevir
INTERACTION.COMMENT: If administering these together cannot be avoided, regular clinical monitoring and laboratory tests, especially at the beginning of treatment with the two medications together.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Risk of decrease, large for the rifampicin, of the plasma concentrations of bosentan
Decrease of the plasma concentrations of the buspirone due to increase of its hepatic metabolism by the rifampicin
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Clinical monitoring and possible adjustment of the dosage of the buspirone during the treatment with rifampicin and after it is stopped.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Decrease of the plasma concentrations and of the effectiveness of the carbamazepine due to increase of its hepatic metabolism by the rifampicin
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Clinical monitoring, testing of the plasma concentrations and adjustment of the dosage of the carbamazepine during the treatment with the refampicin and after it is stopped.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Large decrease of the plasma concentrations of the carvedilol, due to increase of its hepatic metabolism by the rifampicin
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Regular clinical monitoring and adjustment of the dosage of the carvedilol during the treatment with the rifampicin. When the rifampicin is stopped, risk of large increase of the plasma concentrations of carvedilol imposing a reduction of the dosage and strict clinical monitoring.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Risk of ineffectiveness of the antipsychotic treatment (decrease of the plasma concentrations of clozapine due to increase of its hepatic metabolism)
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Clinical monitoring and possible increase of the dosage of the clozapine during the treatment with the rifampicin.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Risk of decrease of the effectiveness of the cobicistat due to increase of its metabolism by the inducer
Decrease of the plasma concentrations of dabigatran, with risk of decrease of the therapeutic effect
Risk of decrease of the plasma concentrations of deferasirox
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Monitor the ferritinemia during and after the treatment with the enzymatic inducer. If needed, adjustment of the dosage of deferasirox.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Decrease of the plasma concentrations of delamanid due to increase of its hepatic metabolism by the inducer
Decrease of the plasma concentrations and of the effectiveness of the digitoxin due to increase of its hepatic metabolism.
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Clinical monitoring, EKG, and, possibly, monitoring of the digitoxinemia. If there is reason for it, adjustment of the dosage of the digitoxin during the administration of these substances together and after the rifampicin is stopped, or choose digoxin, less metabolized by the liver.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Decrease of the plasma concentrations of dolutegravir due to increase of its metabolism by the inducer
INTERACTION.COMMENT: --in case of resistance to the class of integrase inhibitors

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Large decrease of the concentrations of dronedarone due to increase of its metabolism, without significant modification of the active metabolite.
Decrease of the plasma concentrations and of the effectiveness of the efavirenz due to increase of its hepatic metabolism by the rifampicin
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Regular clinical monitoring and laboratory tests, especially at the beginning of the administration of the substances together.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Risk of decrease of the effectiveness of the exemestane due to increase of its hepatic metabolism by the enzymatic inducer
Decrease of the plasma concentrations of fentanyl due to increase of its hepatic metabolism by the rifampicin.
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Choose another opioid.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Decrease of the plasma concentrations and of the effectiveness of the two anti-infectives (enzymatic induction by the rifampicin and decrease of the intestinal absorption by the azole antifungal)

Decrease of the plasma concentrations and of the effectiveness of the corticoids due to increase of their hepatic metabolism by the rifampicin; the consequences are particularly great in patients with Addisons disease treated with hydrocortisone and in cases of transplants
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Clinical monitoring and laboratory tests; adjustment of the dosage of the corticoids during the treatment with the rifampicin and after it is stopped.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Risk of decrease of the plasma concentrations of the haloperidol and of its therapeutic effectiveness, due to increase of its hepatic metabolism by the rifampicin
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Clinical monitoring, and, if needed, adjustment of the dosage during the treatment with the rifampicin and after it is stopped.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Risk of clinically low thyroid in patients with already low thyroid, due to increase of the metabolism of the T3 and of the T4.
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Monitoring of serum concentrations of T3 and T4 and adjustment, if needed, of the dosage of the thyroid hormones during the treatment with the rifampicin and after it is stopped.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Decrease of the plasma concentrations of idelalisib due to increase of its hepatic metabolism by the inducer

Very large decrease of the plasma concentrations of the protease inhibitor, due to increase of its hepatic metabolism by the rifampicin.
For the combination (saquinavir + ritonavir):
risk of severe hepatocellular toxicity
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Until additional data about the ritonavir boosted inhibitors is available.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Decrease of the plasma concentrations and of the effectiveness of the tyrosine kinase inhibitor, due to increase of its metabolism by the inducer
Increase of the hepatoxicity of the isoniazid (increase of the formation of toxic metabolites of the isoniazid)
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Clinical monitoring and laboratory tests of this classic combination. In case of hepatitis, stop the isoniazid.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Risk of decrease of the effectiveness of the ivabradine, due to increase of its metabolism by the rifampicin
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Clinical monitoring and adjustment of the dosage of the ivabradine during the administration of the two substances together and after the rifampicin is stopped.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Decrease of the plasma concentrations and of the effectiveness of the two anti-infectives (enzymatic induction by the rifampicin and decrease of the intestinal absorption by the azole antifungal)
Large decrease of the plasma concentrations of ledipasvir due to increase of its hepatic metabolism by the rifampicin
Risk of decrease of the effectiveness of the linezolide due to increase of its hepatic metabolism by the rifampicin.
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Clinical monitoring and possible increase of the dosage of the linezolide during the treatment with the rifampicin.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Decrease of the plasma concentrations and of the effectiveness of the beta blocking agent (increase of its hepatic metabolism)
Decrease of the plasma concentrations of the metronidazole due to increase of its hepatic metabolism by the rifampicin
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Clinical monitoring and possible adjustment of the dosage of metronidazole during the treatment with the rifampicin and after it is stopped.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Risk of absence of effect of the midazolam, with very large decrease of its plasma concentrations, due to increase of its hepatic metabolism

Decrease of the plasma concentrations and of the effectiveness of the corticoids due to increase of their hepatic metabolism by the rifampicin; the consequences are particularly great in persons with Addison's disease treated with the hydrocortisone and in cases of organ transplants
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Clinical monitoring and laboratory tests; adjustment of the dosage of the corticoids during the treatment with the rifampicin and after it is stopped.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Risk of reduction of the effectiveness of the montelukast due to increase of its hepatic metabolism by the rifampicin
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Clinical monitoring and possible adjustment of the dosage of the antiasthmatic during the treatment with the rifampicin and after it is stopped.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Decrease of the plasma concentrations and of the effectiveness of the morphine and of its active metabolite
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Clinical monitoring and possible adjustment of the dosage of the morphine during the treatment with the rifampicin and after it is stopped.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Decrease of the plasma concentrations of the nevirapine due to increase of its hepatic metabolism by the rifampicin
Decrease of the plasma concentrations of the calcium channel blocker due to increase of its hepatic metabolism
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Clinical monitoring and possible adjustment of the dosage of the calcium channel blocker during the treatment with the rifampicin and after it is stopped.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Large decrease (up to two thirds) of the concentrations of perampanel
Decrease of the plasma concentrations and of the effectiveness of the two anti-infectives (enzymatic induction by the rifampicin and decrease of the intestinal absorption by the azole antifungal)
Very large decrease of the plasma concentrations of the praziquantal, with risk of failure of the treatment, due to increase of the hepatic metabolism of the praziquantel by the rifampicin
Decrease of the plasma concentrations of the propafanone, due to increase of its hepatic metabolism by the rifampicin
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Clinical monitoring and EKG. If there is reason for it, adjustment of the dosage of the propafenone during the administration of the two substances together and after the rifampicin is stopped.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Decrease of the plasma concentrations and of the effectiveness of the beta-blocking agent (increase of its hepatic metabolism)
Very large decrease of the plasma concentrations of quetiapine due to increase of its hepatic metabolism by the inducer, with risk of ineffectiveness
Risk of loss of the effectiveness of the quinine due to increase of its hepatic metabolism by the inducer
Decrease of the concentrations of the raltegravir by the rifampicin
INTERACTION.COMMENT: If administering these together cannot be avoided, doubling the dose of raltegravir can be considered

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Very large decrease of the concentrations of ranolazine.
Decrease of the plasma concentrations of rivaroxaban, with risk of decrease of the therapeutic effect
Very large decrease of the plasma concentrations of simvastatin, due to increase of its hepatic metabolism by the rifampicin.
Very large decrease of the concentrations of telaprevir

Very large decrease of the plasma concentrations of the telithromycin, with risk of failure of the anti-infective treatment, due to increase of the hepatic metabolism of the telithromycin by the rifampicin.
Decrease of the plasma concentrations and of the effectiveness of the terbinafine, due to increase of its hepatic metabolism by the rifampicin
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Clinical monitoring. If needed, adjustment of the dosage of the terbinafine during the treatment with the rifampicin.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Decrease of the plasma concentrations and of the effectiveness of the theophylline (increase of its metabolism by enzymatic induction)
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Clinical monitoring and, if needed, monitoring of the theophyllinemia. Adjust, if there is reason to, the dosage of the theophylline during the treatment with the rifampicin and after it is stopped.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Decrease of the plasma concentrations of the tiagabine due to increase of its hepatic metabolism
INTERACTION.COMMENT: An increase of the dosage of the tiagabine can prove necessary in cases where it is administered with the rifampicin.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Large decrease of the plasma concentrations of ticagrelor due to increase of its hepatic metabolism by the rifampicin, with risk of decrease of the therapeutic effect.
Risk of decrease of the effect of the ulipristal, due to increase of its hepatic metabolism by the inducer.
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Choose a therapeutic alternative that is little or not at all metabolized.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Risk of onset of convulsive crises, due to increase of the hepatic metabolism of the valproate by the rifampicin
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Clinical monitoring and laboratory tests, and possible adjustment of the dosage of the anticonvulsant during the treatment with the rifampicin and after it is stopped.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Large decrease of the plasma concentrations of the voriconazole with risk of loss of effectiveness, due to increase of its hepatic metabolism by the rifampicin
Decrease of the plasma concentrations and of the effectiveness of the zolpidem due to increase of its hepatic metabolism by the rifampicin
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Clinical monitoring. Possibly use another hypnotic.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Decrease of the plasma concentrations and of the effectiveness of the zopiclone due to increase of its hepatic metabolism by the rifampicin
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Clinical monitoring. Possibly use another hypnotic.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Decrease of the plasma concentrations of rilpivirine by the proton pump inhibitor (decreased absorption because of increase of the gastric pH)
With the dexamethasone for systemic use, risk of decrease of the plasma concentrations of rilpivirine due to increase of its hepatic metabolism by the dexamethasone
INTERACTION.COMMENT: With the exception of dexamethasone administered in a single dose

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Large decrease of the plasma concentrations of rilpivirine due to increase of its hepatic metabolism by the inducer
Risk of decrease of the plasma concentratons of rilpivirine due to increase of its hepatic metabolism by the St Johns wort
Risk of serious hypotension (synergic effect)
Risk of serious hypotension (synergic effect)
Increase of the plasma concentrations of riociguat due to decrease of its hepatic metabolism by the inhibitor
Risk of decrease of the active fraction of the risperidone and of its therapeutic effectiveness due to increase of its hepatic metabolism by the carbamazepine
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Clinical monitoring, and, if needed, adjustment of the dosage of the risperidone.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Increase of the active fraction of the risperidone due to decrease of its hepatic metabolism by the fluoxetine, with risk of increase of the undesirable effects
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Clinical monitoring, and, if needed, adjustment of the dosage of the risperidone.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Increase of the active fraction of the risperidone due to decrease of its hepatic metabolism by the paroxetine, with risk of increase of the undesirable effects.
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Clinical monitoring and, if needed, adjustment of the dosage of the risperidone.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: In the case of administration with fosamprenavir, significant decrease of the concentrations of ritonavir which can lead to a loss of the virological response
