CLASS.name: ANGIOTENSIN II RECEPTOR ANTAGONISTS or ANGIOTENSIN RECEPTOR BLOCKERS (ARBs)

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION:
For anti-inflammatory doses of acetylsalicylic acid (>=1 g per dose and/or >= 3 g per day) or for analgesic or antipyretic doses (>= 500 mg per dose and/or <=3 gr per day):
Acute renal insufficiency with dehydrated patients, due to decrease of the glomerular filtration following a decrease of the synthesis of the renal prostaglandins.
Furthermore, reduction of the antihypertensive effect.
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Hydrate the patient and monitor renal function at the beginning of treatment.

CLASS.name: ANGIOTENSIN II RECEPTOR ANTAGONISTS or ANGIOTENSIN RECEPTOR BLOCKERS (ARBs)

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Risk of hyperkalemia, of renal insufficiency, of increase of mortality from cardiovascular disease
INTERACTION.COMMENT: - for patients with diabetes or renal insufficiency

CLASS.name: ANGIOTENSIN II RECEPTOR ANTAGONISTS or ANGIOTENSIN RECEPTOR BLOCKERS (ARBs)

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Acute renal insufficiency with patients at risk (older patient, dehydration, treatment with diuretics, changes in renal function), due to decrease of the glomerular filtration (inhibition of the vasodilater prostaglandins due to the non steroidal anti-inflammatories.) These effects are generally reversible. In addition, reduction of the antihypertensive effect.
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Hydrate the patient and monitor renal function at the beginning of treatment and regularly while these substances are administered together.

CLASS.name: ANGIOTENSIN II RECEPTOR ANTAGONISTS or ANGIOTENSIN RECEPTOR BLOCKERS (ARBs)
POTASSIUM SPARING DIURETICS (ALONE OR IN COMBINATION)

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION:
Except for the eplerenone and the spironolactone in doses between 12.5mg and 50mg/day for the treatment of heart failure as well as in cases of hypokalemia:
Risk of hyperkalemia (possibly lethal) especially when there is renal insufficiency (addition of the effects of the hyperkalemia inducing substances).
INTERACTION.COMMENT: If administering these medications together is justified, strict testing of the kalemia and of the renal function.

CLASS.name: ANGIOTENSIN II RECEPTOR ANTAGONISTS or ANGIOTENSIN RECEPTOR BLOCKERS (ARBs)

CLASS.name: BETA-2 MIMETICS or BETA2 ADRENERGIC AGONISTS

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Elevation of the glycemia by the beta-2 mimetic
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Reinforce blood and urine monitoring. Possibly change to insulin if the situation requires.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: All the beta blocking agents can mask certain symptoms of hypoglycemia: palpitations and tachycardia
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Inform the patient and reinforce self-monitoring of blood glucose, especially at the beginning of treatment.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: All the beta blocking agents can mask certain symptoms of hypoglycemia: palpitations and tachycardia

INTERACTION.COMMENT: Inform the patient and reinforce self-monitoring of blood glucose. Possibly adjust the dosage of the neuroleptic during the treatment and after it is stopped.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Risk of hypoglycemia due to increase of the plasma concentrations of the antidiabetique
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Inform the patient, reinforce self-monitoring of blood glucose and possibly adjust the dosage of the blood glucose lowering sulfonamide during the treatment with the clarithromycin.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Diabetes inducing effect of the danazol
INTERACTION.COMMENT: If the administration of the substances together cannot be avoided, inform the patient and reinforce self-monitoring of blood glucose. Possibly adjust the dosage of the antidiabetic during the treatment with the danazol and after it is stopped.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Increase of the half life of the sulfonamide with possible onset of hypoglymemia
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Inform the patient, reinforce self-monitoring of blood glucose and possibly adjust the dosage of the sulfonamide during the treatment with the fluconazole.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: The use of an ACE inhibitor can lead to an increase of the hypoglycemic effect in diabetic patients treated with glucose lowering sulfonamides. The onset of hypoglycemic difficulties seems exceptional (improvement of the tolerance for glucose that would have the result of a reduction of the need for the glucose lowering sulfonamides)
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Reinforce self -monitoring of blood glucose.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: With the miconazole by general route or oral gel: increase of the hypoglycemic effect with possible onset of hypoglycemic manifestations, even coma
For all the forms of phenylbutazone, including topical: increase of the hypoglycemic effect of the sulfonamides due to decrease of their hepatic metabolism
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Choose another anti-inflammatory that is less interactive; if not, inform the patient, reinforce self-monitoring of blood glucose; possibly adjust the dosage during the treatment with the anti-inflammatoryand after it is stopped.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Decrease of the digoxinemia that can reach 50%
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Clinical monitoring, EKG, and, possibly, monitoring of the digoxinemia. If there is reason for it, adjustment of the dosage of the digoxin during the treatment with the sulfasalazine and after it is stopped.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Decrease of the blood concentrations of ciclosporin due to increase of its metabolism by the sulfinpyrazone
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Testing of blood concentrations of ciclosporin and possible adjustment of its dosage during the treatment with sulfinpyrazone and after it is stopped.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Decrease of the digestive absorption of the sulpiride
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Take the sucralfate at a different time from the sulpiride (more than 2 hours apart, if possible).

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Risk of constriction of coronary blood vessels which can be fatal
Risk of reduction of the effectiveness of the thyroid hormones
Risk of lengthening of the motor block, increased in the case of partial deficit of pseudo-cholinesterase

CLASS.name: DOPAMINERGIC ALKALOIDS OF ERGOT OF RYE

CLASS.name: VASOCONSTRICTOR ALKALOIDS OF ERGOT OF RYE

Hypertensive crises (inhibition of the metabolism of the pressor amines). Because of the length of action of the MAOI, this interaction is still possible two weeks after the MAOI is stopped
Risk of constriction of blood vessels and/or rapid elevation of blood pressure

CLASS.name: ALPHA AND BETA SYMPATHOMIMETICS (IM AND IV ROUTES)

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Serious ventricular arrhythmias due to increase of cardiac sensitization

CLASS.name: ALPHA AND BETA SYMPATHOMIMETICS (IM AND IV ROUTES)

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Paroxysmal hypertension with the possibility of arrhythmias (inhibition of the entry of the sympathomimetic into the sympathic fiber)

CLASS.name: ALPHA AND BETA SYMPATHOMIMETICS (IM AND IV ROUTES)

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Increase of the pressor action of the sympathomimetic, most often moderate.
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Only use under strict medical monitoring.

CLASS.name: ALPHA AND BETA SYMPATHOMIMETICS (IM AND IV ROUTES)
REVERSIBLE MAOI-A, INCLUDING LINEZOLIDE AND METHYLENE BLUE

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: By extrapolation from the non selective MAOIs: risk of increase of heart activation.
INTERACTION.COMMENT: To be used only under strict medical monitoring.

CLASS.name: ALPHA AND BETA SYMPATHOMIMETICS (IM AND IV ROUTES)

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Paroxysmal hypertension with possibility of arrhythmias (inhibition of the entry of the sympathomimetic into the sympathic fiber)
The combination of two antiarrhythmic agents is very delicate. In the majority of cases, it is contraindicated or not recommended.
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Not recommended

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Risk of constriction of blood vessels and/or of hypertensive crises.

CLASS.name: DOPAMINERGIC ALKALOIDS OF ERGOT OF RYE

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Risk of constriction of blood vessels and/or of rapid elevation of blood pressure

CLASS.name: VASOCONSTRICTOR ALKALOIDS OF ERGOT OF RYE

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Risk of constriction of blood vessels and/or of rapid elevation of blood pressure
Perioperative hypertension
INTERACTION.COMMENT: In the case of scheduled surgery, it is preferable to stop the treatment several days before surgery.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Paroxystic hypertension, hyperthermia that can be fatal. Because of the length of action of the MAOI, this interaction is still possible two weeks after the MAOI has been stopped

CLASS.name: REVERSIBLE MAOI-A, INCLUDING LINEZOLIDE AND METHYLENE BLUE

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Risk of constriction of blood vessels and/or rapid elevation of blood pressure
Risk of constriction of blood vessels and/or rapid elevation of blood pressure
Greater increase of the creatinemia than with tacrolimus alone (synergy of the nephrotoxic effects of the two substances)
Increase of the blood concentrations of tacrolimus due to inhibition of its metabolism by the amiodarone
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Blood concentration dosage of tacrolimus, testing of the renal function, and adjustment of the dosage of tacrolimus during its administration with the amiodarone and when the amiodarone is stopped.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: With the amphotericin B administered by IV route: greater increase of the creatinemia than with tacrolimus alone (synergy of the nephrotoxic effects of the two substances)
Risk of addition of the nephrotoxic effects, especially with older patients
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Monitor renal function at the beginning of treatment with the NSAI.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Decrease of the blood concentrations of the immunosuppressant, with risk of loss of immunosuppressive activity.
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Reinforced testing of the blood dosages of tacrolimus and possible increase of its dosage.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Increase of more than double of the plasma concentrations of dabigatran, with increase of the risk of bleeding
Increase of the blood concentrations of the tacrolimus due to inhibition of its hepatic metabolism
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Blood concentration dosage of the tacrolimus and adjustment of its dosage during the administration with the danazol and after it is stopped, with testing of the renal function.

CLASS.name: POTASSIUM SPARING DIURETICS (ALONE OR IN COMBINATION)

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Potentially lethal hyperkalemia, especially when there is renal insufficiency (addition of the hyperkalemia inducing effects)
Increase of the blood concentrations of tacrolimus and of the creatinemia, due to inhibition of the hepatic metabolism of the tacrolimus by the josamycin
Increase of the blood concentrations of the tacrolimus
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Blood concentration dosage of the tacrolimus, testing of the renal function, and adjustment of the dosage during the administration of the two substances together and after it is stopped.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Increase of the blood concentrations of the tacrolimus
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Blood concentration dosage of the tacrolimus, testing of the renal function, and adjustment of the dosage during the administration of the substances together and after it is stopped.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Essentially lethal hyperkalemia, especially when there is renal insufficiency (addition of the hyperkalemia inducing effects)
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Avoid administering these substances together unless there is preexisting hypokalemia.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Increase of the blood concentrations of the tacrolimus (decrease of its hepatic metabolism by the verapamil)
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Blood concentration dosage of the immunosuppressant, testing of the renal function, and adjustment of the dosage during the administration of the medications together and after it is stopped.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Risk of increase of the effect of the vitamin K antagonist and of the risk of hemorrhage
INTERACTION.COMMENT: More frequent testing of the INR. Possible adjustment of the dosage of the vitamin K antagonist.

Risk of reduction of the effectiveness of the tamoxifen, due to inhibition of the formation of its active metabolite by the duloxetine
Reduction of the effectiveness of the tamoxifen, due to inhibition of the formation of its active metabolite by the fluoxetine

Risk of reduction of the effectiveness of the tamoxifen, due to inhibition of the formation of its active metabolite by the terbinafine
Risk of increase of the undesirable effects of the tamsulosine, due to inhibition of its hepatic metabolism
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Clinical monitoring and adjustment of the dosage of the tamsulosine during the treatment with the enzyme inhibitor and after it is stopped, as the situation requires.

INTERACTION.COMMENT: Clinical monitoring and adjustment of the dosage of the tamsulosine during the treatment with the enzyme inhibitor and after it is stopped, as the situation requires.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Risk of increase of the undesirable effects of the tamsulosine, due to inhibition of its hepatic metabolism
Risk of increase of the undesirable effects of the tamsulosine, due to inhibition of its hepatic metabolism
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Clinical monitoring and adjustment of the dosage of the tamsulosine during the treatment with the enzyme inhibitor and after it is stopped, as the situation requires.

CLASS.name: VASOCONSTRICTOR ALKALOIDS OF ERGOT OF RYE

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Ergotism with possibility of necrosis of the extremities (inhibition of the hepatic metabolism of the alkaloid of ergot of rye)
Disorders of autoregulation and of cardiac conduction with risk of excessive bradycardia
Risk of very large decrease of the concentrations of telaprevir.
Increased risk of undesirable effects (concentration dependant) of the rhabdomyolysis type (decrease of the hepatic metabolism of the atorvastatin)
Risk of increase of the undesirable effects of the colchicine, due to decrease of its metabolism

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Decrease of the effectiveness of the estrogen
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Clinical monitoring and possible adjustment of the dosage of the hormonal treatment during the administration of the telaprevir and after it is stopped.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Risk of decrease of the contraceptive effectiveness due to increase of the hepatic metabolism of the hormonal contraceptive by the telaprevir
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Use an additional or alternative, reliable contraceptive method during the administration of the substances together and two cycles after.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Increase of the plasma concentrations of the immunosuppressant due to inhibition of its hepatic metabolism by the telaprevir
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Blood concentration dosage of the immunosuppressant, testing of the renal function, and adjustment of its dosage during the administration of the substances together and afterit is stopped.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Large increase of the plasma concentrations of the PDE5 inhibitor, with risk of severe hypotension
INTERACTION.COMMENT: -in cases of pulmonary artery hypertension

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Decrease of the concentrations of the telaprevir and of the darunavir or of the fosamprenavir, with risk of therapeutic failure
Increase of the plasma concentrations of medazolam due to decrease of its hepatic metabolism, with increase of sedation
INTERACTION.COMMENT: -with the midazolam by mouth

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Risk of very large decrease of the concentrations of telaprevir
Very large decrease of the concentrations of telaprevir
Increased risk of undesirable effects (concentration dependant) of the rhabdomyolysis type (decrease of the hepatic metabolism of the simvastatin
Increased risk of peripheral neuropathy

CLASS.name: VASOCONSTRICTOR ALKALOIDS OF ERGOT OF RYE

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Risk of constriction of the coronary arteries or of the extremities (ergotism), or of rapid elevation of blood pressure
Decrease of the plasma concentrations of telithromycin, with risk of failure of the antibiotic treatment, due to increase of its hepatic metabolism by the inducerr
Risk of increase of undesirable effects (dose dependent) of the rhabdomyolysis type (decrease of the hepatic metabolism of the cholesterol lowering medication
Increase of the concentrations of darifenacin, with risk of increase of its undesirable effects
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Clinical monitoring and possible adjustment of the dosage of darifenacin

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Increase of the plasma concentrations of the dexamethasone due to decrease of its hepatic metabolism by the enzyme inhibitor, with risk of appearance of Cushings syndrome
Increase of the digoxinemia due to increase of its absorption

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Very large increase of the blood concentrations of the immunosuppressant due to inhibition of its hepatic metabolism
INTERACTION.COMMENT: In case these are taken together, strict testing of the renal function, blood concentration dosage of the immunosuppressant and possible adjustment of the dosage.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Increase of the plasma concentrations of the inhibitor of type 5 phosphodiesterase with risk of severe hypotension

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Decrease of the plasma concentrations of the telithromycin, with risk of failure of the antibiotic treatment, due to increase of the hepatic metabolism of the telithromycin by the St Johns wort
Increased risk of ventricular arrhythmia, especially of torsades de pointes
Very large decrease of the plasma concentrations of the telithromycin, with risk of failure of the antibiotic treatment, due to increase of its hepatic metabolism by the telithromycin
Increased risk of undesirable effects (dose dependent) of the rhabdomyolysis type (decrease of the hepatic metabolism of the cholesterol lowering drug).
Increase of the concentrations of solifenacin, with risk of overdose

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Increase of the concentrations of venlafaxine with risk of overdose
Risk of increase of the toxicity of the antimitotic due to decrease of its hepatic metabolism by the telithromycin

Slight increase of the sedative effects of the zopiclone.
Risk of increase of the nephrotoxicity of the tenofovir

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Decrease by about a third of the exposure to the atazanavir in patients who are also taking tenofovir, compared to a healthy subject receiving the same substances together
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Do not administer the atazanavir with the tenofovir without ritonavir.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Risk of failure of the antiretroviral treatment, even emergence of resistance. In addition, increase of the risk of the mitochondrial toxicity of the didanosine
When co-administered with a protease inhibitor, increase of the plasma concentrations of the tenofovir by the ledipasvir
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Clinical monitoring and laboratory tests, especially of the renal function.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Risk of increase of the undesirable effects of the atomoxetine, due to large decrease of its hepatic metabolism
INTERACTION.COMMENT: If the administration of the two substances together cannot be avoided, clinical monitoring and adjustment of the dosage of the atomoxetine during the treatment with the inhibitor and after it is stopped.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Decrease of the blood concentrations of ciclosporin
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Testing of the blood concentrations of ciclosporin and possible adjustment of its dosage during the treatment with terbinafine and after it is stopped.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Risk of increase of the undesirable effects of the flecainide, due to decrease of its hepatic metabolism by the terbinafine
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Clinical monitoring. If needed, adjustment of the dosage of the flecaidine during the treatment with the terbinafine.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Risk of increase of the undesirable effects of the mequitazine, due to inhibition of its metabolism by the enzyme inhibitor
With the patient having heart failure, risk of increase of the undesirable effects of the metoprolol, due to decrease of its hepatic metabolism by the terbinafine.
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Clinical monitoring. If needed, adjustment of the dosage of the metoprolol during the treatment with the terbinafine.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Risk of increase of the undesirable effects of the propafenone, due to decrease of its hepatic metabolism by the terbinafine
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Clinical monitoring. If needed, adjustment of the dosage of the propafenone during the treatment with the terbinafine.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Decrease of the plasma concentrations and of the effectiveness of the terbinafine, due to increase of its hepatic metabolism by the rifampicin.
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Clinical monitoring. If needed, adjustment of the dosage of the terbinafine during the treatment with the rifampicin.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Risk of reduction of the effectiveness of the tamoxifen, due to inhibition of the formation of its active metabolite by the terbinafine.
Risk of general vaccine disease, possible fatal

CLASS.name: BETA BLOCKING AGENTS (EXCEPT ESMOLOL AND SOTALOL)

Decrease of the digestive absorption of these two medications due to chelation of the iron
Reciprocal antagonism between the dopaminergic and the tetrabenazine
Risk of hypertensive crises. Because of the duration of the action of the MAOI, this interaction is still theoretically possible two weeks after it is stopped
Reciprocal antagonism between the levodopa and the tetrabenazine
Increased risk of onset of peripheral neuropathy due to addition of undesirable effects

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Large increase of the concentrations of theophylline, with risks of increase of its undesirable effects.

INTERACTION.COMMENT: Clinical monitoring and possibly monitoring of the theophyllinemia. If there is reason for it, adjustment of the theophylline during the treatment with the cimetidine and after it is stopped.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Increase of the theophyllinemia with risk of overdose, due to decrease of its hepatic metabolism by the ciprofloxacin.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Risk of increase of the theophyllinemia, particularly with children
With the dipyridamole by injection: reduction of the vasodilator effect of the dipyridamole by the theophylline

Overdose of theophylline due to decrease of its hepatic elimination, more particularly dangerous in children

However, in the case of legionnaires' disease, erythromycin remains the antibiotic of choice; clinical monitoring, with testing of the plasma concentrations of theophylline, is thus desirable in this special instance.

CLASS.name: GASTRO-INTESTINAL TARGETED MEDICATIONS, ANTACIDS, AND ABSORBANTS

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Decrease of the absorption of certain other medications ingested simultaneously
INTERACTION.COMMENT: As a precaution, it is preferable to take these gastrointestinal targeted medications, antacids, and absorbent medications at a different time from any other medication (more than 2 hours apart, if possible).

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Decrease of the concentrations of the topiramate with risk of lower effectiveness, due to increase of its hepatic metabolism by the carbamazepine
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Clinical monitoring, and if needed, adjustment of the dosage of the toprimate during the treatment with the carbamazepine and after it is stopped.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: For doses of topiramate >= 200 mg/day: Risk of decrease of the contraceptive effectiveness due to decrease of the concontrations of estrogen
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Another method of contraception, in particular a barrier method or IUD, should be used.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: For doses of topiramate >=200mg/day: increase of the lithemia that can reach toxic levels, with signs of overdose of lithium
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Clinical monitoring and laboratory tests. Adjustment of the dosage of lithium.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Risk of decrease of the concentrations of the topiramate with risk of lower effectiveness, due to increase of its hepatic metabolism by the oxcarbazepine
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Clinical monitoring, and if needed, adjustment of the dosage of topiramate during the treatment with the oxcarbazepine and after it is stopped.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Risk of onset of hyperammonemia or encephalopathy, generally attributed to the valproic acid, when it is taken at the same time as the topiramate
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Reinforced clinical monitoring at the beginning of treatment and laboratory tests in case of suggestive symptoms.

CLASS.name: TORSADES DE POINTES INDUCING MEDICATIONS (EXCEPT ANTIPARASITICS, NEUROLEPTICS, METHADONE)
MEDICATIONS THAT TEND TO INDUCE TORSADES DE POINTES

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Increased risk of ventricular arrhythmias, especially of torsades de pointes

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Risk of increase of the plasma concentrations of the itraconazole
INTERACTION.COMMENT: If administering these medications together is necessary, clinical monitoring and adjustment of the dosage of the trabectedine during the length of the treatment with the itraconazole

CLASS.name: MEDICATIONS AT RISK WHEN WITHDRAWING FROM TOBACCO

Risk of increase of the effect of the vitamin K antagonist and of the risk of hemorrhage

Risk of appearance of a serotonin syndrome: diarrhea, sweats, trembling, confusion, even coma

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Ergotism with possibility of necrosis of the extremities (inhibition of the hepatic metabolism of the alkaloid of ergot of rye)
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Wait 24 hours between stopping the thiclabendazole and the ergotamine, and the reverse.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Increased risk of ventricular arrhythmias, especially of torsades de pointes (inhibition of the hepatic metabolism of the torsade inducing medication)
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Wait 24 hours between stopping the triclabendazole and taking the torsade inducing medication, and the reverse.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Increased risk of ventricular arrhythmias, especially of torsades de pointes (inhibition of the hepatic metabolism of the torsade inducing medication)
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Wait 24 hours between stopping the triclabendazole and taking the torsade inducing medication, and the reverse.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION:
With the trimethoprim (alone or in combination) by oral route: increase of the creatinemia with possible decrease of the blood concentrations of ciclosporin
With trimethoprime (alone or in combination) by IV route: the decrease of the blood concentrations of ciclosporin can be very large with possible loss of all immunosuppressant capacity
Increase of the hematological toxicity of the methotrexate (decrease of its renal excretion as well as inhibition of the dihydrofolate reductase).

Megaloblastic anemia, more particularly with large doses of the two products (deficit of folic acid due to the combination of the two 2-4
diaminopyrimidines
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Regular CBC and addition of a treatment with folic acid (regular IM injections).

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Risk of increase of the plasma concentrations of repaglinide due to inhibition of its hepatic metabolism by the trimethoprim
INTERACTION.COMMENT: If administering these medications together cannot be avoided, strict clinical monitoring and laboratory tests.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Risk of excessive bradycardia (addition of the bradycardia inducing effects)
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Regular clinical monitoring, especially at the beginning of the administration of the substances together

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Risk of addition of the undesirable cholinergic effects, especially digestive ones
Risk of lengthening of the motor block, increased in the case of partial deficit of pseudocholinesterase

CLASS.name: VASOCONSTRICTOR ALKALOIDS OF ERGOT OF RYE

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Risk of arterial hypertension, of constriction of coronary arteries
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Wait 6 to 24 hours, depending on the triptan, between taking it and the ergot alkaloid.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Risk of appearance of serotonin syndrome
Risk of arterial hypertension, of constriction of the coronary arteries

Risk of arterial hypertension, of constriction of the coronary arteries

Risk of decrease of the effect of the ulipristal, due to increase of its hepatic metabolism by the inducer
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Choose a therapeutic alternative that is little or not metabolized.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Risk of decrease of the effect of the ulipristal, due to decrease of its absorption
Risk of decrease of the effect of the ulipristal, due to decrease of its absorption
Risk of decrease of the effect of the ulipristal, due to increase of its hepatic metabolism by the ritonavir

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Risk of decrease of the effect of the ulipristal, due to increase of its hepatic metabolism by the inducer

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Risk of antagonism of the effects of the progestin contraceptive
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Do not restart a progestin treatment fewer than 12 days after stopping the ulipristal.

CLASS.name: NON-CONTRACEPTIVE PROGESTOGENS, COMBINED WITH AN ESTROGEN OR NOT

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Risk of antagonism of the effects of the progestogen
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Do not restart a progestogen treatment fewer than 12 days after stopping the ulipristal.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Risk of decrease of the effect of the ulipristal, due to increase of its hepatic metabolism by the inducer
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Chose a therapeutic alternative that is little or not metabolized.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Decrease of the effect of the uricosuric due to competition of the elimination of the uric acid at the level of the renal tubules
Risk of possibly fatal general vaccine disease
INTERACTION.COMMENT: as well as during the 3 months following the treatment

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Risk of possibly fatal general vaccine disease
INTERACTION.COMMENT: -And during the 3 months following the end of the treatment

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Risk of possibly fatal general vaccine disease
INTERACTION.COMMENT: --And during the 6 months following the end of the chemotherapy

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Risk of possibly fatal general vaccine disease. This risk is increased in older patients already immunodepressed by the underlying disease.
INTERACTION.COMMENT: In particular, use an inactive vaccine when one exists (poliomyelitis).

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION:
With the exception of inhaled and local routes and for dosages greater than 10mg/day of prednisone equivalent (or >2mg/kg/day[sic] with children or >20 mg/day for children weighing more than 10 kg) for more than two weeks and for administration in "bolus" of the corticoids:
Risk of general vaccine disease, possibly fatal
INTERACTION.COMMENT: And during the 3 months following the end of the corticotherapy

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: In an indication for the patient with drepanocytosis, risk of general fatal vaccine disease.
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Administering these medications together should only be considered if the benefits are estimated to be superior to this risk.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Risk of general vaccine disease, possibly fatal.
INTERACTION.COMMENT: And during the 3 months following the treatment

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Risk of possibly fatal general vaccine disease
INTERACTION.COMMENT: And during the 3 months following the end of the treatment.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Risk of possibly fatal general vaccine disease
INTERACTION.COMMENT: And during the 3 months after the end of the treatment.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Risk of possibly fatal general vaccine disease
Risk of onset of convulsive crises, due to decrease of the plasma concentrations of the valproic acid
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Clinical monitoring, plasma dosages, and possible adjustment of the dosage of the anticonvulsant during the treatment with the antibiotic and after it is stopped.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Increase of the plasma concentrations of the active metabolite of the carbamazepine with signs of overdose. In addition, decrease of the plasma concentrations of valproic acid due to increase of its hepatic metabolism by the carbamazepine
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Clinical monitoring, plasma dosages and adjustment of the dosage of the two anticonvulsants.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Increase of the plasma concentrations of the valproic acid, with risk of overdose.
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Clinical monitoring, laboratory tests, and possible adjustment of the dosage of the valproic acid or of the valpromide during the treatment with the felbamate and after it is stopped.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Increased risk of serious cutaneous reactions (Lyell's syndorme). In addition, increase of the plasma concentrations of lamotrigine (decrease of its hepatic metabolism by the sodium valproate)
INTERACTION.COMMENT: If this combination of medications is judged necessary, strict clinical monitoring.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Risk of onset of epileptic crises due to increase of the metabolism of the sodium valproate and the convulsion producing effect of the mefloquine

With the nimodipine by oral route, and by extrapolation, by injection: risk of increase of the hypotensive effect of the nimodipine due to increase of its plasma concentrations (decrease of its metabolism by the valproic acid)
Risk of onset of convulsive crises, due to rapid decrease of the plasma concentrations of the valproic acid, that can become undetectable

Increase of the plasma concentrations of the phenobarbital, with signs of overdose, due to inhibition of the hepatic metabolism, most often with children. In addition, decrease of the plasma concentrations of valproic acid due to increase of its hepatic metabolism by the phenobarbital
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Clinical monitoring during the first two weeks of the administration of these substances together and immediate reduction of the doses of phenobarbital at the appearance of signs of sedation, test especially the plasma concentrations of the two anticonvulsants.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Variation of the plasma concentrations of phenytoin. In addition, risk of decrease of the plasma concentrations of the valproic acid due to increase of its hepatic metabolism by the phenytoin.
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Clinical monitoring, plasma dosages, and possible adjustment of the dosage of the two anticonvulsants.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Risk of onset of convulsive crises, due to increase of the hepatic metabolism of the valproate by the rifampicin
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Clinical monitoring and laboratory tests and possible adjustment of the dosage of the anticonvulsant during the treatment with the rifampicin and after it is stopped.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Possible increase of the concentrations of rufinamide, especially with children who weigh less than 30 kg
INTERACTION.COMMENT: With children weighing less than 30kg: do not exceed the total dose of 600 mg/day after the period of titration.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Risk of onset of hyperammonemia or encephalopathy, generally attributed to the valproic acid, when it is taken at the same time as the topiramate
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Reinforced clinical monitoring at the beginning of treatment and laboratory tests in case of suggestive symptoms.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Risk of increase of the undesirable effects, especially hematological ones, of the zidovudine due to decrease of its metabolism by the valproic acid.
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Regular clinical monitoring and laboratory tests. A CBC checking for anemia should be done during the course of the first months of the administration of these substances together.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Increase of the plasma concentrations of the vardenafil, with risk of hypotension.
Risk of decrease of the concentrations of the bupropion, with increase of its active metabolite and increased toxicity
Risk of decrease of the concentrations of the combined estrogen-progestin contraceptive with the consequence of a risk of ineffectiveness
Risk of decrease of the concentrations of the ifosfamide, with increase of its active metabolite and increased toxicity
Risk of decrease of the concentrations of the immunosuppressants, with the consequence of a risk of ineffectiveness
Risk of decrease of the concentrations of the vemurafenib, with lower effectiveness
Large increase of the concentrations of theophylline, with risks of increase of its undesirable effects
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Clinical monitoring and adjustment of the dosage of the theophylline during the treatment with vemurafenib and after it is stopped.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Increase of the concentrations of venlafaxine with risk of overdose
Increase of the concentrations of venlafaxine with risk of overdose
Increase of the concentrations of venlafaxine with risk of overdose.
Increase of the concentrations of venlafaxine with risk of overdose
Increase of the concentrations of venlafaxine with risk of overdose
Increase of the concentrations of venlafaxine with risk of overdose
Increase of the concentrations of venlafaxine with risk of overdose
Risk of appearance of convulsions and/or a serotonin syndrome
Increase of the concentrations of venlafaxine with risk of overdose
Increase of the risk of hemorrhage, especially in cases with a previous gastroduodenal ulcer
INTERACTION.COMMENT: - with anti--inflammatory does of acetylsalicylic acid (>=1g per dose and/or >=3g per day)

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Increase of the risk of hemorrhage
Increase of the oral anticoagulant's risk of hemorrhage (irritation of the gastroduodenal mucosa by the non-steroidal anti-inflammatories)
INTERACTION.COMMENT: - with phenylbutazone

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Increased risk of hemorrhage

Glucocorticoids (general and rectal routes): possible impact of the corticotherapy on the metabolism of the antivitamin K and on that of the factors of coagulation. Risk of hemorrhage specific to the corticotherapy (digestive mucosa, vascular fragility) with large doses or in treatment prolonged beyond
10 days.
INTERACTION.COMMENT: When administering substances from these groups together is justified, strengthen monitoring: if the situation requires, with the antivitamines K, laboratory tests on the 8th day, then every two weeks after that during the corticotherapy and after it is stopped.

CLASS.name: LOW MOLECULAR WEIGHT HEPARINS AND RELATED DRUGS (CURATIVE DOSES AND/OR OLDER PATIENT)

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Increase of the risk of hemorrhage
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Strengthen clinical monitoring and, if the situation requires, laboratory tests.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Increase of the risk of hemorrhage
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Clinical monitoring and, if the situation requires, more frequent testing of the INR. Possible adjustment of the dosage of the oral anticoagulant during the administration with the SSRI and after it is stopped.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Increase of the plasma concentrations of verapamil, with risk of onset of undesirable effects
Increase of the plasma concentrations of afatinib due to increase of its absorption by the verapamil
INTERACTION.COMMENT: It is recommended that the verapamil be administered as far as possible from the afatinib, preferably at an interval of 6 to 12 hours distant from the afatinib.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Increase of the plasma concentrations of aliskiren and increase of the risk of its undesirable effects
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Clinical monitoring.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION:
For verapamil by injection:
-risk of bradycardia or of atrioventricular block
For verapamil by mouth:
-risk of bradycardia or of atrioventricular block, especially with older persons
INTERACTION.COMMENT: -the verapamil via IV

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Increased risk of undesirable effects (concentration dependant) of the rhabdomyolysis type, due to decrease of the hepatic metabolism of the cholesterol lowering medication
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Use weaker doses of the cholesterol lowering medication. If the therapeutic objective is not reached, use another statin not affected by this type of interaction.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Disorders of autoregulation (excessive bradycardia, sinus arrest), disorders of sinoatrial and atrioventricular conduction, and cardiac failure
INTERACTION.COMMENT: The administration of these medications together should only be undertaken under clinical monitoring and strict EKG, in particular with older patients or at the beginning of treatment.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Negative inotropic effect with risk of acute decompensated heart failure, disorders of autoregulation (bradycardia, sinus arrest) and disorders of sinoatrial and atrioventricular conduction
Increase of the plasma concentrations of the buspirone due to decrease of its hepatic metabolism by the verapamil, with increase of its undesirable effects
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Clinical monitoring and adjustment of the dosage of the buspirone if necessary.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Increase of the blood concentrations of the ciclosporin (decrease of its hepatic metabolism), and increase of the risk of gum disorders.
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Blood concentration dosage of the ciclosporin, testing of the renal function, and adjustment of the dosage during the administration of the medications together and after it is stopped.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Disorders of autoregulation (disorders of atrioventricular conduction due to addition of the negative effects on conduction)
Risk of increase of the undesirable effects of the colchicine, due to increase of its plasma concentrations by the verapamil
Increase of the plasma concentrations of dabigatran, with increase of the risk of bleeding
INTERACTION.COMMENT: In a post surgical indication: clinical monitoring and adjustment of the dosage of the dabigatran to 150 mg/day in one dose, or even 75 mg/day in case of moderate renal insufficiency

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: With the dantrolene administered by IV: with animals, fatal cases of ventricular fibrillations are constantly observed when verapamil and dantrolene are administered by IV route. The administration of a calcium channel blocker and dantrolene together is thus potentially dangerous. However, some patients have received nifedipine and dantrolene together without incident.

Excessive bradycardia and atrioventricular block due to increase of the effects of the digoxin on autoregulation and conduction and due to decrease of the renal and extrarenal elimination of the digoxin
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Clinical monitoring, EKG and, possibly, testing of the digoxinemia. If there is reason for it, adjustment of the dosage of the digoxin during the treatment with the verapamil and after it is stopped.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Risk of increase of the toxicity of the doxorubicin due to increase of its plasma concentrations

Risk of bradycardia or of atrioventricular block, especially with older patients. Furthermore, slight increase of the concentrations of dronedarone due to decrease of its metabolism by the calcium channel blocker
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Start the treatment by the calcium channel blocker with the lowest recommended dosages, and adjust the doses according to the EKG.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Increase of the plasma concentrations of eribuline by the verapamil.
Bradycardia and/or disorders of atrioventricular conduction, due to decrease of the hepatic metabolism of the verapamil by the erythromycin
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Clinical monitoring and EKG, if there is reason for it, adjustment of the dosage of the verapamil during the treatment with the erythromycin and after it is stopped.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Disorders of autoregulation (excessive bradycardia, sinus arrest), disorders of sinoatrial and atrioventricular conduction, and cardiac failure
INTERACTION.COMMENT: -in case of alteration of the left ventricular function.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Increase of the blood concentrations of the everolimus due to decrease of its hepatic metabolism by the verapamil
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Blood concentration dosage of the immunosuppressant, testing of the renal function and adjustment of the dosage during the administration of the two medications together and after it is stopped.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Increase of the plasma concentrations of the fidaxomicin
Increase of the plasma concentrations of ibrutinib due to decrease of its hepatic metabolism by the verapamil
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Strict clinicalmonitoring and reduction of the dose of ibrutinib to 140 mg per day during the length of the administration of the two medications together.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Bradycardia and/or disorders of atrioventricular conduction, due to decrease of the hepatic metabolism of the verapamil by the inhibitor
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Clinical monitoring and EKG. If there is reason for it, adjustment of the dosage of the verapamil during the treatment with the inhibitor, and after it is stopped, as the situation requires.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Increase of the plasma concentrations of the ivabradine and of its undesirable effects, especially cardiac ones (inhibition of its hepatic metabolism by the verapamil), that add to the bradycardia inducing effects of these molecules.
Increase of the plasma concentrations of midazolam (decrease of its hepatic metabolism with increase of sedation).
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Clinical monitoring and reduction of the dosage of midazolam during the treatment with the verapamil.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Large reduction of the concentrations of verapamil, with risk of loss of its therapeutic effect.
Risk of large increase of the hemodynamic effects of the verapamil, with severe hypotension and bradycardia
Increased risk of undesirable effects (dose dependent) of the rhabdomyolysis type (decrease of the hepatic metabolism of the cholesterol lowering agent
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Do not exceed the dosage of 20mg/day of simvastatin or use another statin not affected by this type of interaction.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Increase of the blood concentrations of the sirolimus (decrease of its hepatic metabolism by the verapamil).
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Blood concentration dosage of the immunosuppressant, testing of the renal function, and adjustment of the dosage during the administration of the medications together and after it is stopped.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Increase of the blood concentrations of the tacrolimus (decrease of its hepatic metabolism by the verapamil)
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Blood concentration dosage of the immunosuppressant, testing of the renal function, and adjustment of the dosage during the administration of the medications together and after it is stopped.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Risk of increase of the undesirable effects of the tamsulosine, due to inhibition of its hepatic metabolism
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Clinical monitoring and adjustment of the dosage of the tamsulosine during the treatment with the enzyme inhibitor and after it is stopped, as the situation requires.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Risk of increase of the plasma concentrations of ticagrelor due to decrease of its hepatic metabolism
Increased risk of neurological disorders (trembling, confusion) due to partial inhibition of the metabolism of the antiviral
Risk of increase of the toxicity of the antimitotic due to decrease of its hepatic metabolism by the clarithromycin
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Strict clinical monitoring and laboratory tests. Possibly, use another antibiotic.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Increase of the neurotoxicity of the antimitotic due to decrease of its hepatic metabolism by the cobicistat
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Strict clinical monitoring and possible adjustment of the dosage of the antimitotic.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Risk of increase of the toxicity of the antimitotic due to decrease of its hepatic metabolism by the erythromycin
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Strict clinical monitoring and laboratory tests. Possibly, use another antibiotic.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Increase of the toxicity of the antimitotic, due to decrease of its hepatic metabolism by the protease inhibitor.
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Strict clinical monitoring and possible adjustment of the dosage of the antimitotic.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Increase of the neurotoxicity of the antimitotic, due to decrease of its hepatic metabolism by the itraconazole
Increase of the neurotoxicity of the antimitotic, due to decrease of its hepatic metabolism by the ketoconazole
Risk of increase of the pulmonary toxicity of the mitomycin and of the vinca alkaloids
Increase of the neurotoxicity of the antimitotic, due to decrease of its hepatic metabolism by the posaconazole
Risk of increase of the toxicity of the antimitotic due to decrease of its hepatic metabolism of the telithromycin
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Strict clinical monitoring and laboratory tests. Possibly, use another antibiotic.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Risk of decrease of the plasma concentrations of vismodegib due to increase of its hepatic metabolism by the inducer
Risk of decrease of the plasma concentrations of vismodegib
In case of intake of 10,000 IU/day and more: risk of intracranial hypertension
Risk of symptoms evocative of hypervitaminosis A
Decrease of the absorption of the vitamin D

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Risk of constriction of the coronary blood vessels or those of the extremities (ergotism), or of rapid elevation of blood pressure
Increased risk of ventricular arrhythmias, especially of torsades de pointes, due to possible decrease of the metabolism of the amiodarone.
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Clinical monitoring and EKG, and possible adjustment of the dosage of the amiodarone.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION:
--for carbamazepine, phenobarbital, primidone: Risk of reduction of the effectiveness of the voriconazole due to increase of its hepatic metabolism by the inducer
--for phenytoin, fosphenytoin:
Large decrease of the plasma concentrations of the voriconazole with risk of loss of effectiveness, due to increase of its hepatic metabolism by the phenytoin, for one thing; and increase of the plasma concentrations of the phenytoin due to decrease of its hepatic metabolism by the voriconazole, for another.
INTERACTION.COMMENT: -for carbamazepine, phenobarbital, primidone

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Increase of the effect of the vitamin K antagonist and of the risk of hemorrhage due to decrease of its hepatic metabolism
INTERACTION.COMMENT: More frequent testing of the INR. Possible adjustment of the dosage of the vitamin K antagonist during the treatment with voriconazole and a week after it is stopped.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION:
In case of prolonged use by oral or inhaled route:
increase of the plasma concentrations of the corticoid due to decrease of its hepatic metabolism by the voriconazole, with risk of appearance of Cushing's syndrome even of adrenal insufficiency
Increase of the concentrations of darifenacin, with risk of increase of its undesirable effects
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Clinical monitoring and possible adjustment of the dosage of darifenacin.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Increase of the plasma concentrations of the dexamthasone due to decrease of its hepatic metabolism by the enzyme inhibitor, with risk of appearance of Cushing's syndrome
Ergotism with possibility of necrosis of the extremities (inhibition of the hepatic metabolism of the alkaloid of ergot of rye)
Risk of reduction of the effectiveness of the voriconazole due to increase of its hepatic metabolism by the efavirenz
INTERACTION.COMMENT: If administering these substances together cannot be avoided, strict clinical monitoring and adjustment of the dosage of the voriconazole and of the efavirenz during the administration of the two together.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Ergotism with possibility of necrosis of the extremities (inhibition of the hepatic metabolism of the alkaloid of ergot of rye)
Risk of increase of the plasma concentrations of the glipizied at the origin of potentially severe hypoglycemia
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Inform the patient, reinforce self-monitoring of blood glucose and possibly adjust the dosage of the blood glucose lowering sulfonamide during and after the treatment with voriconazole.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Increase of the blood concentrations of the immunosuppressant due to inhibition of its hepatic metabolism by the voriconazole.
INTERACTION.COMMENT: -with the everolimus, the sirolimus, and the temsirolimus

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Very large reduction of the concentrations of the antifungal due to increase of its metabolism by the ritonavir, with risk of failure of the treatment
Significant reduction of the concentrations of voriconazole, with risk of loss of its therapeutic effect
Risk of reduction of the effectiveness of the voriconazole due to increase of its hepatic metabolism by the nevirapine
INTERACTION.COMMENT: If the administration of the substances together cannot be avoided, strict clinical monitoring and possible adjustment of the dosage of the voriconazole during the administration of the substances together.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Increased risk of ventricular arrhythmias, especially of torsades de pointes

Decrease of the plasma concentrations of the voriconazole with risk of loss of effectiveness, due to increase of its hepatic metabolism by the rifabutin for one thing, and risk of increase of the undesirable effects (uveitis) of the rifabutin for another.
INTERACTION.COMMENT: If the administration of the substances together is judged necessary, clinical monitoring and adjustment of the dosage of the voriconazole (generally doubled) during the treatment with the rifabutin.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Large decrease of the plasma concentrations of the voriconazole with risk of loss of effectiveness, due to increase of its hepatic metabolism by the rifampicin
Increased risk of undesirable effects (concentration dependent) of the rhabdomyolysis type due to decrease of the hepatic metabolism of the simvastatin
Increase of the concentrations of solifenacin, with risk of overdose
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Clinical monitoring and possible adjustment of the dosage of solifenacin.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Increase of the concentrations of venlafaxine with risk of overdose.
Slight increase of the sedative effects of the zolpidem
Slight increase of the sedative effects of the zopiclone
Possible inhibition of the antihypertensive activity due to antagonism at the level of the receptors
Increased risk of onset of pancreatitis and of peripheral neuropathy due to addition of undesirable effects
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Regular clinical monitoring and monitoring of the amylasemia. Do not administer these substances together if the amylasemia is at the high range of normal.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Increased risk of onset of peripheral neuropathy due to addition of undesirable effects
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Regular clinical monitoring and laboratory tests, especially at the beginning of the administration of the two medications together.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Risk of decrease of the effectiveness of each antiviral due to reciprocal inhibition of the phosphorylation reaction at the origin of the active metabolites
Increased risk of peripheral neuropathy due to addition of undesirable effects

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Risk of decrease of the effectiveness of each antiviral, due to reciprocal inhibition of the phosphorylation reaction at the origin of the active metabolites

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Risk of decrease of the effectiveness of each antiviral, due to reciprocal inhibition of the phosphorylation reaction at the origin of the active metabolites
Risk of increase of the undesirable effects, especially hematological ones, of the zidovudine due to decrease of its metabolism by the valproic acid

Large decrease of the plasma concentrations of the albendazole and of its active metabolite by the inducer, with risk of reduction of its effectiveness.
.

.

Risk of very large decrease of the concentrations of aprepitant
Risk of decrease of the plasma concentrations of boceprevir

Decrease of the plasma concentrations of dabigatran, with risk of decrease of the therapeutic effect
Risk of decrease of the plasma concentrations of deferasirox

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Decrease of the plasma concentratioins of delamanid due to increase of its hepatic metabolism by the inducer.
Decrease of the plasma concentrations of dolutegravir due to increase of its metabolism by the inducer
Decrease of the plasma concentrations of the doxycycline due to increase of its hepatic metabolism by the inducer

Decrease of the effectiveness of the estrogen

INTERACTION.COMMENT: Monitoring of the serum concentrations of T3 and T4 and adjustment, if needed, of the dosage of the thyroid hormones during the treatment with the inducer and after it is stopped.

Acute renal insufficiency with dehydrated patients, due to decrease of the glomerular filtration following a decrease of the renal prostaglandin synthesis. Furthermore, reduction of the antihypertensive effect.

Disorders of autoregulation (excessive bradycardia, sinus arrest), disorders of sinoatrial and atrioventricular conduction, and heart failure

Risk of decrease of the plasma concentrations of boceprevir

INTERACTION.COMMENT: Regular clinical monitoring and possible adjustment of the dosage of methadone.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Aside from the combination with ethinylestradiol (0.035mg)/noresthisterone(1mg), risk of decrease of the contraceptive effectiveness due to increase of the hepatic metabolism by the hormonal contraceptive by the boceprevir
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Use a reliable contraceptive method, additional or alternative, during the time these medications are taken together.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Risk of decrease of the plasma concentrations of boceprevir
INTERACTION.COMMENT: If administering these together cannot be avoided, regular clinical monitoring and laboratory tests, especially at the beginning of treatment with the two medications together.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Decrease of the concentrations of the cytotoxic due to increase of its metabolism by the inducer, with risk of lower effectiveness
Risk of increase of the undesirable effects, especially neurological, of the bortezomib due to decrease of its metabolism.
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Clinical monitoring and possible adjustment of the dosage of the bortezomib during the length of the treatment with the enzyme inhibitor.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Risk of decrease of the plasma concentrations of bosentan
Decrease of the effect of the vitamin K antagonist due to increase of its hepatic metabolism
INTERACTION.COMMENT: More frequent testing of INR. Possible adjustment of the dosage of the vitamin K antagonist.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Large decrease of the blood concentrations of the ciclosporin and increase of the plasma concentrations of bosentan
Risk of decrease of the contraceptive effectiveness due to increase of the hepatic metabolism of the hormonal contraceptive
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Use a reliable contraceptive method, additional or alternative, during the length of time the two substances are administered together and for a cycle after.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Risk of reduced effectiveness of the glibenclamide due to decrease of its plasma concentrations, because of the inducer effect of the bosentan. Furthermore, cases of hepotoxicity have been reported with these two substances administered together.
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Monitoring of the glycemia, adjustment of the treatment if needed, and monitoring of the hepatic biological constants

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Risk of decrease of the effectiveness of the hormonal contraceptive due to increase of its hepatic metabolism.
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Use an additional or alternative reliable method of contraception during the time these substances are administered together and one cycle following

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Risk of decrease, large for the rifampicin, of the plasma concentrations of bosentan
Risk of increase of the effects of the botulinum toxin with the aminoglycosides (by extrapolation from the effects observed during the course of the botulism)
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Use another antibiotic.

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Risk of excessive bradycardia (addition of the effects)
Increase of the bradycardia inducing effects which can have fatal consequences. The beta-blocking agents are even more at risk since they inhibit the adrenergic compensation mechanisms
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Clinical monitoring and sustained EKG during the 24 hours following the first dose.

CLASS.name: MEDICATIONS THAT TEND TO INDUCE TORSADES DE POINTES

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Increased risk of ventricular arrhythmias, especially of torsades de pointes
INTERACTION.COMMENT: Clinical monitoring and EKG

CLASS.name: FLUOROURACIL (AND BY EXTRAPOLATION, TEGAFUR AND CAPECITABINE)

INTERACTION.DESCRIPTION: Strengthening of the effects, both cytostatic and undesirable, of the fluorouracil.
